review_title: ⭐️ Luxury Defined: Marina Bay Sands is the Best Hotel Stay in Singapore
review_text:
If you’re looking for a 5-star luxury hotel in Singapore, Marina Bay Sands is in a league of its own. This iconic hotel offers not just accommodation — but a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

🛏️ Spacious Rooms with Breathtaking Views
My room was large, elegant, and spotless — offering an unforgettable panoramic view of Marina Bay. Whether you face the bay or Gardens by the Bay, every view is stunning (tip: request a higher floor for maximum impact).
In-room amenities were exceptional, including TWG teas specially blended for Marina Bay Sands. The bed was ultra-comfortable with blackout curtains and silent surroundings — perfect for deep sleep.

🍽️ Rooftop Breakfast & Infinity Pool
Breakfast at the world-famous rooftop infinity pool is a must. Fresh tropical fruits, pastries, hot dishes — all served with a skyline view that’s hard to beat. The rooftop pool, bar, and restaurant offer the best photo ops and moments of calm in a vibrant city.

🛎️ Exceptional Service & Concierge
Service was fast, discreet, and consistently top-tier. The concierge team organized a private tour of Singapore with precision and style — one of the best I’ve had. Staff across the hotel were warm, efficient, and welcoming.

📍 Prime Location in the Heart of Singapore
The hotel is in the best location in Singapore for tourists and shoppers:

Direct MRT (subway) access right beneath the hotel
Taxis readily available at all hours
Walking distance to top attractions: Merlion Park, Marina Barrage, Chinatown
Direct access to the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands mall — packed with luxury retail and dining options
💡 Insider Tips for Your Stay
Ask for a high-floor room for better views
Wake up early to enjoy a peaceful rooftop breakfast
Take advantage of the concierge for curated experiences
Start your walking tour from the hotel to explore Singapore’s heritage sites and skyline icons
✅ Final Verdict

Marina Bay Sands isn’t just the best hotel in Singapore — it’s an icon. Whether for a romantic getaway, business trip, or urban adventure, it delivers luxury, convenience, and unforgettable views at every turn. I would absolutely stay again.

review_title: After a rough start they won us over like no other hotel. What memories we created there.
review_text:
We had been looking forward to our stay at Marina Bay Sands for a very long time and our expectations were set extremely high. Unfortunately not everything went smoothly from the very beginning. I would not hesitate to call our initial experience a real disaster to the extent that my first impression and evaluation were completely opposite. I was very disappointed and, to be honest, upset.

However mistakes can happen in any hotel or company and the most important thing is how the property responds when issues arise. In this case the reaction was absolutely exemplary. Thanks to the incredible care of Mr. Viktor M. and his team with special mention to Shataz H. and her team, room stylist Htet P., the airport transfer driver and the assistant at the airport (my sincere apologies for not remembering all the names) they managed to turn an unpleasant situation into an unforgettable experience and a memory of a lifetime. For this I will be grateful until the end of my life not only for how they faced the problems head on but also for everything they did for us. I feel humbled, grateful and happy that everything eventually turned out more than excellent, although at the same time sad that our twelve day stay in Singapore has already come to an end.

Next time during our fourth visit we were originally planning only a stopover and as I am professionally from the travel industry we wanted to explore more of the iconic hotels Singapore has to offer. However after what Marina Bay Sands has provided us this time I am now seriously considering remaining loyal to Marina Bay Sands and its team for all our future stays in Singapore.

Thank you for everything and I very much look forward to any future reunion. I wish the entire team all the best and many more satisfied guests like my wife and me.

Now a few words about the rooms, restaurants, pool and other attractions that Marina Bay Sands operates around the hotel. The rooms are modern, luxurious and above all clean. The room stylists are very well trained, they pay attention to the smallest details and are able to notice tiny things that would never cross my mind. From the restaurants we had the chance to try the newly renovated Lavo which was one hundred percent, Wakuda one hundred percent, Spago one hundred percent and Rise ninety percent only because of occasional chaos during breakfast service. The infinity pool does not really need any introduction and there is nothing to add that has not already been said a million times. For us it is one hundred percent. The attractions in the area such as the ArtScience Museum, The Shoppes, the casino and others were all one hundred percent. The hotel services that we had the chance to try were also one hundred percent. The location is unbeatable. For most tourists Marina Bay Sands is the centerpiece of their exploration of Singapore. The price may seem high at first glance especially when compared with competitors but based on our own experience I must say it is more than reasonable. The value for money is in my opinion very advantageous. Communication is the category that is hardest for me to evaluate because in the beginning it did not work well on several levels. However once the problems started to be addressed it was on such a level that it became a great inspiration for me. Especially thanks to the already mentioned Viktor M. and Shataz H. You did such a great job.

review_text:
The Marina Bay Sands is probably the most iconic and spectacular building in Singapore. Its unique architecture, made up of three towers linked at the top by a huge boat-shaped platform, makes it a symbol of the city and one of the most recognizable images in the world.

As soon as you enter, the main hall impresses with its dimensions. It is a huge, elegant and modern space, full of restaurants of all kinds, cafes and luxury shops. The Mood is vibrant and cosmopolitan, with visitors from all over the world coming both to stay and simply to see the place.

Restaurants and bars with unparalleled panoramic views of Singapore can be found on the upper floors. From there you can see the bay, the skyscrapers of the financial center and nearby attractions such as the Gardens by the Bay or the Cloud Forest. Many visitors recommend taking to the SkyPark Observation Deck to enjoy the sunset or the illuminated city at night.

Another big attraction is the rooftop infinity pool, exclusive to hotel guests. It is one of the most famous swimming pools in the world as it gives the feeling of being literally swimming over the Singapore skyline. Although not everyone can access it, just seeing it in photos or from outside the building is already impressive.

Marina Bay Sands is not just a hotel: it is a complete leisure complex. Inside is a large luxury shopping mall with international boutiques, a world-class casino, an art and science museum with very interesting exhibitions and even a theater with shows. Everything is connected to Marina Bay and integrates seamlessly with other area attractions, such as the ArtScience Museum, Gardens by the Bay, the Cloud Forest and the Helix Bridge.

review_title: An absolute dream this world-class hotel
review_text:
Recommendation for Marina Bay Sands

A stay at Marina Bay Sands is simply a dream – an absolute top class hotel!

As soon as you enter, you will be impressed by the stylish elegance and high-quality, beautiful furnishings of the rooms. Everything is thought through to the smallest detail and exudes luxury and comfort.

I would particularly like to highlight the outstanding Service: super friendly, attentive, warm and always striving to fulfill every wish of the guests – I have hardly experienced anything like this worldwide.

The breakfast buffet is the most varied and best I have ever enjoyed – a true culinary journey around the globe.

The rooftop infinity pool, the largest and best in the world, is an incomparable experience. The view over Singapore alone is breathtaking and unforgettable.

In addition, there are the great shopping opportunities right in the house as well as numerous other offers that complete the stay and make it perfect.

For me, Marina Bay Sands is a dream hotel unparalleled in quality, Service and uniqueness. Every stay here is a special experience that you will never forget.

review_title: Infinity pool on the 57th floor and impeccable Service: Marina Bay Sands captivates you
review_text:
We stayed three days in Singapore and decided to spend the last night at Marina Bay Sands: the experience was truly unique. In fact, this hotel is one of Singapore's iconic attractions, a must for those visiting the city.
A plus not to be underestimated: access to the Observation Deck is free for hotel guests, offering spectacular views of the city.

I was immediately impressed by the kindness and professionalism of the staff at the entrance, who promptly handled the luggage with great care. The hotel is very large, so check-in procedures can take a while, but again the staff was extremely helpful and courteous. We were offered a room upgrade to a higher floor with spectacular views of the park and, in part, the city. The only condition was to wait about 45 minutes, which we spent pleasantly in the infinity pool area, sipping a welcome cocktail offered by the hotel.

The room on the 28th floor was really superb: about 50 square meters, with a large terrace, home automation system to manage curtains, lights and more, a spacious bathroom with separate bath and shower, Japanese toilet, and a high quality amenities kit.
In particular, I appreciated:

Sheets of Frette
Bathrobes and soft towels
Very comfortable slippers
Wide range of bathroom products
Well stocked minibar
Tea and coffee making facilities
Station with liquor and snacks
Large television set
Comfortable king size bed
Bright and spacious room
Large safe
Well-organized spaces for suitcases and clothes
Dyson hair dryer
The highlight of the hotel is undoubtedly the infinity pool on the 57th floor, which connects the three towers of the building. According to some rankings, it is among the top three infinity pools in the world. The view is breathtaking, and access is reserved exclusively for hotel guests. The area is furnished with lush plants, sun loungers, towels available, and impeccable Service that allows you to order snacks and drinks directly from the sun lounger.
Near the pool there are also panoramic hot tubs, ideal for relaxing while admiring the Singapore skyline in an exclusive atmosphere.

There are three main restaurants: Spago, Ce La Vie and Spago Lounge. We had dinner at Spago and were very satisfied.

The only point that can be improved: breakfast. You can do it in the area adjacent to the infinity pool, chosen by almost all guests. However, I had to do almost an hour in a row, and the breakfast is not buffet style but à la carte, with quite long waiting times. If I had known, I would have opted for the restaurant near the lobby.

In conclusion, the experience was excellent. I chose this hotel because of the infinity pool, and I can say that it was absolutely worth it. The price is high, but justified by the overall quality of the stay. Highly recommended.

I am departing Singapore today and as I think about my wonderful trip, Marina Bay Sands stands out. Thank you to Marina Bay Sands and their staff for making our trip memorable.

First, the room was immaculate and very thoughtful. The dual sinks were separated so my wife and I have our own space. It is far easier on the plumbing to have dual sinks next to each other. The bed sheets were freshly prepared. We wash and dry our sheets and we know the effort it took to prepare the bed. We had a wonderful sleep.

The staff was always thinking of how to improve their services. When we ordered two candies, the quick service heard we were checking out and offered luggage service. In addition they delivered the candies in ten minutes because they heard we were going to the airport. Super proactive.

I will make Mariana Bay Sands my go-to-hotel when I visit Singapore. Absolutely memorable experience.

review_text:
We stayed at this iconic hotel for one night only, but it was really worth it, if you are planning a trip to Singapore you must definitely try it!

It was a fantastic experience, the hospitality was amazing as was your kindness. We had a beautiful room (Sands Premier King Gardens By The Bay View) overlooking the spectacular Gardens by the Bay! We could see comfortably seated on the terrace the light shows of the Garden by the Bay, really beautiful.

The room was really luxurious, super equipped, comfortable and the view from the balcony was breathtaking! Frette sheets, bathrobes and soft towels, comfortable slippers, lots of bathroom products, minibar, tea and coffee making facilities, liquor station, snacks, huge TV, comfortable king size bed, bright and spacious room, bathtub and shower, super technological toilet, large safe, spaces for luggage and clothes, Dyson hairdryer...
The staff was super welcoming, friendly and helpful: really great!!! We had a little problem with the TV, but a technician arrived in 5 minutes to repair it.
We told the reception that it was my husband's birthday and that we would appreciate an early check-in and a great view from our room, all requests were met! You also gave us a delicious chocolate cake for her birthday.

The infinity pool is truly unique!!! It enjoys a panoramic view of the whole city. It is divided into 3 areas, one of which is adults only, there is a bar, many sunbeds and rooms to change, in addition to the staff who takes care of security and assistance in the pool.

Access to the swimming pool is reserved for hotel guests, free access to the platform with panoramic views is also provided (for outdoors there is paid access).

Thank you very much, we hope to return to your hotel soon, maybe for a few more nights...
Absolutely recommended!

review_text:
I had been dreaming of my honeymoon for so long, and Marina Bay Sands was always at the top of my list of places in Asia to celebrate this special time. We arrived in the evening on 23 Aug 25 and stayed at Tower 3 in a Sands Premier City View room. From the moment we stepped in, we were overwhelmed with beautiful flowers at the Front Office, setting such a warm and romantic atmosphere.

Michelle Nguyen was the one who welcomed us, and her kindness truly touched our hearts. She noticed my heavy luggage and cared enough to check on me, even offering bath bombs and salts so I could relax after carrying it. That small but thoughtful gesture showed how deeply she cared. On top of that, she surprised us with an upgrade to a higher floor with the most breathtaking view.

Everywhere we went, from housekeeping to the bellboys, we were greeted with warm smiles and genuine care. It made us feel so cherished.

review_title: Wil be back for my birthday!
review_text: We went to Singapore to celebrate my wife’s birthday, and we were so glad that we stayed at Marina Bay Sands. From check-in down to our last day, the overall experience had been very memorable because of the staff that were very friendly and accommodating. I would like to specifically thank Eunice Marasigan for the warm welcome and for providing us all the necessary information for our smooth sailing vacation and fun experience to the fullest extent. She always checked in on us making sure that we were being provided by all the things that we needed. She absolutely went above and beyond. As a treat for my wife’s birthday, they brought cakes every day to all the 3 rooms that we booked, plus champagnes on our last night. They also provided a limousine transport to the airport, where MBS’s personnel were already waiting for us to provide assistance for our airline check-ins. Because of our extraordinary experience at MBS, I already put in my bucket lists that one of my birthdays will be celebrated there. If your room comes with premium services, I highly recommend that you request for Eunice as your service provider - she is a true gem to MBS.

review_text:
We had a wonderful time at Marina Bay Sands. We booked three rooms (two Garden View Standard Rooms and one Garden View Suite) for our family. The rooms were spacious, comfortable, and elegant. Our elderly family members and children particularly enjoyed the garden view from the balcony, especially the nightly light shows. We also had a great time at the SkyPark observation deck and the rooftop infinity pool. Our stay included a breakfast buffet, afternoon tea, and aperitifs, all of which we thoroughly enjoyed.

The staff at Marina Bay Sands provided excellent service. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by the bellhops, Jan and Ian, who helped us with our luggage. Michelle Nguyen from the front desk checked us in smoothly and made sure to accommodate our need for quick rooming due to our little children. We were also welcomed by Eunice Marasigan from MBS Premium Services in our rooms. She was enthusiastic about showing us how to make the most of our stay at MBS. Eunice was incredibly thoughtful and ensured our stay was both memorable and pleasant. When she learned that it was a birthday getaway for me and my family, she surprised us with birthday cakes delivered to our rooms throughout our stay. On our last day, champagne and sweets were delivered to all our rooms as a special touch. It was such a kind and thoughtful gesture.

Our room was kept clean and comfortable throughout our stay by Xiao Xin, our room stylist. We also had DJ, King, and Edgardo from guest services, all of whom were friendly, accommodating, and always ready to assist.

At checkout, MBS limousine services were provided, and we were greeted and assisted by MBS staff members Dina and Theodore at the airport. This was a lovely surprise, as MBS extended their service all the way until our departure. A big thank you to Eunice Marasigan from MBS Premium Services for coordinating everything and ensuring we had the best possible experience at Marina Bay Sands.

We’ll definitely be back soon!

review_text:
Our recent stay at Marina Bay Sands Singapore was truly amazing. Traveling with seniors and two young kids isn’t always easy, but the team at MBS made everything feel effortless from start to finish.

We were warmly greeted by Jan and Ian from the bellhop team, who handled our luggage with care. At check-in, Michelle Nguyen was incredibly thoughtful — she picked up on what we needed without us even saying a word. Huge thanks to her!

Throughout our stay, King, DJ, and Edgardo from Guest Services were consistently helpful and kind, and Xiao Xin kept our rooms spotless and fresh every day. Also, a big thank-you to Eunice Marasigan from Premium Services — her guidance really made a difference and helped us enjoy the best of both MBS and Singapore.

To top it all off, we were surprised and grateful to be assisted at the airport by Theodore and Dina, who made sure our departure was smooth and stress-free. The service at MBS genuinely went above and beyond — we’ll always remember this trip!

review_text:
Our stay at the hotel couldn't have been better. Especially because of the warm welcome we received from the moment we arrived.

As soon as we arrived, Eunice (Premium Services) gave us the warmest and most attentive welcome, showing us in detail the impressive room we had been given. Her service was exquisite and incredibly pleasant. She even gifted us with a song she composed :-).

The infinity pool is simply stunning. It offers unbeatable views of Singapore at any time of day; but sunset is undoubtedly the
best time to enjoy these
wonderful views of the city.

As for the food, the brunch buffet is the best we've ever seen. Such an impressive variety of top-quality dishes, it's a shame we couldn't eat more :-)

The room is incredible. Decorated with exquisite taste, it offered us unbeatable views of both the bay and the Gardens by the Bay.

The entire hotel is stunning, and its unique design leaves you in awe from the moment you walk in.

But without a doubt, the best thing about the hotel, and what makes a real difference, is its staff. Polite, pleasant, and always attentive :-)

We want to thank King from Guest Services for their services and Leslie from Butler for her thoughtfulness; but we especially want to thank Eunice (Premium Services) for all her help and attention, as well as all the thoughtfulness she provided for our entire family. She made this already memorable visit an event that will be hard to forget and one we will always cherish. We can't thank her enough.

review_title: 🌟 A Masterclass in Hospitality — Thank You, Marina Bay Sands
review_text:
Our recent stay at Marina Bay Sands was more than just a visit to one of the world’s most iconic hotels it was a case study in world-class hospitality at scale.
Every detail was handled with precision and care. A heartfelt thank you to Daniel Whitelaw, Director of F&B, whose leadership was evident in every interaction. Special recognition to Apriel and Jovita from the Premium Services team, who not only received us warmly, upgraded our room and also arranged for a LEGO set to be personally delivered to our son.
Equally, gratitude to Sathi and Shangkar from Bell Services for their warmth, professionalism with our mountain of luggage.
From the panoramic suite views to the theatre of Mott32 and the magic of the infinity pool, the property speaks for itself. But it’s the people, their judgment, timing, and empathy who elevated our experience from transactional to truly memorable.

Grateful for the experience and more importantly, for the people behind it.

review_text:
Definitely in the first places of the hotels where I have been and you come back with your eyes closed! I booked directly with the hotel asking for a room on the upper floors overlooking Supertree Grove: just fantastic. Every night from the balcony I could enjoy the light and music show... incredible and really exciting.

The hotel is huge and I try to briefly summarize the pros and cons:

Against:

I had booked a room with a balcony, but initially I was given one with no outside seating and a very narrow balcony. I had to wait one night to get the one with sofa and coffee table, so I recommend specifying it clearly in the request.

I arrived very early in the morning and could only have the room at the exact time of check-in (certainly because of the high turnout)

Superb breakfast, but with queues practically always. In any case, never more than 10/15 minutes.

Pros:

The spectacular infinity pool, where I could relax while waiting for the room.

Free admission to the observatory, reserved for guests, is a must-see plus.

The rooms: modern, ultra-technological and spotless. I loved the little details, like the neat phone/laptop cables with custom cable ties.

Presence of a bar corner in all rooms (not included, shame because the cost of the room is quite important).

In summary: this was one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed at. Worth the expense without a doubt and would stay there again I don't remember every detail because it's been a few months and I've made other trips, but it remains without hesitation among my favorite hotels ever.

review_title: E = F! Excellence and Faultless services from Marina Bay Sands
review_text:
Thankyou very much to all team members involved in helping us have a truly unique, memorable experience. Particularly Robby from Premium Services. Mervyn, I hope your son's knees are going well🦿🙏

Excellent and Faultless is the feedback from Schonel Enterprises Asia Pacific in our review of the facilities and services provided.

Our Premium Room was incredible. The coffee machine even has a leather outfit on it! The Premium Services team surprised us with beautiful flowers and champagne for arrival, and personalised service every step of the way.

The bedroom was very large, bigger than the average entire accommodation in most resorts. The bed was like being cuddled by a cloud and the sleep was superb.

Ordering room service through our TV was fascinating, and we were completely satisfied by the quality of the food.

Working with Robby and getting a thorough understanding of the range of services and facilities, in particular the meeting rooms for our bespoke consultancy services was very important.

We will be returning for our growing business activities with regional clients, and continuing our plans for the regional headquarters in Singapore, as it is one of the best locations globally.

Thanks again Robby, see you soon. John

review_text:
EPIC! From check in, to accommodations, rooftop infinity pool & that view!
If you have to splurge 1x for a 50th birthday on accommodations, let it be this!

Check-in: gave complimentary water bottles & luggage storage. Staff pleasant & wonderful interaction! Allowed us access to roof top infinity pool. Where we happily lounged at till check in! Greeted w/a complimentary birthday cake upon entering room!

Garden View Room: HUGE w a balcony that has outdoor furniture. The view was amazing! Clean, comfortable beds & gd water pressure. Complimentary In-Room Coffee & teas.

Sky rooftop infinity swimming pool! Photos don’t do this justice! Water was perfect temperature, skyline 360° views while you’re inside the swimming pool was magical. Jacuzzi was warm & the great jet water pressure. Day & night, go to the pool for those photos to make your friends jealous that you are living your best life!

review_text:
We chose this hotel to celebrate both mine and my husbands 50th Birthdays! It was on my bucket list for a long time but we saved it for a special occasion. We managed our expectations and……. they were exceeded! We stayed for 2 nights and paid for a late check out, we are so glad we did as one night would not have been enough and if we could have we would’ve stayed longer!
From checking in to checking out the whole experience was first class! We were shown to our room promptly after checking in, when we opened the door we were totally blown away. OMG we had the most amazing room which was maintained nicely throughout our stay with amazing views.
The highlight of our stay was the infinity pool where we spent a lot of time during our stay, the views were absolutely amazing and we will never forget these views. The service for food and drinks was very good, and it was lovely talking to Ryan Goh the lifeguard on duty.
We were also lucky to have birthday treats in our room but the bottle of champagne was super special!
Breakfast was busy but it was so worth the queuing, the Kaya Toast and Teh Tarik was on point and there was something for everyone.
We are so grateful to have stayed at Marina Bay Sands Hotel and we hope to return very soon one day!

Thank you!!

review_text:
Our Marina Bay Sands stay has been nothing less than the extraordinary! I had chosen their hotel to celebrate my husband’s birthday and they have truly made it an unforgettable experience! review_text: The hotel is terribly expensive but inferior to the price you pay. It is super busy everywhere especially at the pool (where you are lucky if you know where to find a place among all the children) and the restaurants. In addition, those restaurants are very expensive but the food is not great and you wait for more than 10 minutes to drink everything. The Service is also not good enough, so we were at check-in for more than an hour because of the simple reason that the extra bed had to be in the other room. You also have to wait for a taxi for more than 15 minutes because they arrange their own taxis, which cost taxis for a 10-minute ride cost €46. There is also not even one place in the whole hotel where you can have a drink. The hotel wants to look super luxurious but the whole thing is full of little screaming children. There is nothing to do in the hotel itself anyway. The hotel itself really only consists of a lot of rooms. For restaurants, gym, theater and shops you have to go to the shopping center further down. The rooms are really beautiful. You don't see them that luxurious and modern. The best thing about this hotel is the beautiful view of Singapore from above.

review_text: We chose MBS Hotel as we were watching Lord of the Rings at the Sands Theatre. The hotel room itself was quite nice but the rest of the Hotel was a 2 star experience. Checking in and “registering” for breakfast felt like a check in at the airport with roped in queues. Not only do you have to wait for them to verify you as hotel guest with your room card, you have to wait for a print out and for a staff to escort you to your table. We didn’t see any clear signage of halal food at the buffet spread. The lobby has too many people walking about and felt like a shopping mall. The restaurant for breakfast is on the lobby floor with lots of people passing by. The fitness centre was relocated and is now in another building across the road!! You have to walk a long underpass to get to the building across the road or cross the heavy traffic road and then take escalator or lift to the center. Everywhere you have to show that you are a hotel guest as otherwise they will charge you for being on the observation deck and/or visiting the infinity pool area. There is no direct lift in every tower to the pool area which means you have to use transfer lifts or end up traversing the very public lobby in your bathrobe. If you want a quiet exclusive experience, MBS is not the hotel for you.

review_text: I made a reservation for 2 nights at the renowned 5-star Marina Bay Sands hotel in Singapore. We booked the Sands Premier Room with Garden by the Bay view (Double Queen). We (I, my husband and my daughter) all had the most amazing and incredibly memorable stay at this prestigious hotel. We were absolutely astounded at the room we were taken to, by the Premium Services staff, Robby. Out of our great astonishment, we were told that our room was upgraded to a Sands Bay Suite. It was the best surprise we had received in our lives. We have thoroughly enjoyed the luxurious room that offered mesmerizing views of the GBTB. Every part of the room is beautifully decorated with quality items. The furnishings, linen and towels were very comfortable, the refreshment bar was filled with an array of snacks and beverages. You won't get dehydrated as lots of complimentary bottled water were provided. In addition to all the luxury features of the room, the bathroom amenities were of famous brand and a highlight for my daughter, who appreciated such products she can use. All areas of the hotel staff are super friendly, courteous and helpful. They were genuinely very willing to provide you with excellent services and treated you like special guests. I would like to thank a few teams - the reservations, premium services, sands lifestyle front desk, the rise restaurant, reception counter, the transfer and bell staff, for their remarkable services extended to us. I would highly recommend anyone to stay (at least once) in this magnificent hotel to enjoy a lifetime experience.

review_title: Amazing trip, special review for Mark from Guest Services.
review_text: We had an amazing trip overall! Beautiful hotel, lives up to all of the glowing reviews! Great food and service but I want to specifically highlight Mark from Premium Services concierge. He was instrumental in setting up a surprise for my wife's birthday including balloons, champagne and a bouquet of flowers (he threw that in on his own!). He communicated often with me regarding birthday plans but also went the extra mile in coordinating dinner reservations as well. One time, he even physically walked to the restaurant (which wasn't directly on MBS premises) to confirm what the seating looked like at a particular time of evening (sometimes the restaurant officially was listed as completely reserved but still had some tables open). The entire concierge services team was fantastic but his efforts warrant a separate highlight. Thank you for an amazing first trip to Singapore!

review_title: A Stay Saved by Exceptional Customer Service
review_text:
Our recent stay at Marina Bay Sands started very badly: we arrived the day after the National Day, we encountered several inconveniences that could have spoiled our 5-star experience!

You still have to keep in mind or know that the hotel has more than 1700 rooms! Which basically means not far from 3,500 customers! You can imagine breakfast and the world in the common areas, considering the integration into a large shopping center. An almost cultural experience...

But the management response has been exemplary: proactive, responsive and remarkably effective. Their quick and personalized intervention completely changed the course of our stay, turning a difficult departure into a pleasant moment for the whole family.

For Western travellers, it may be a good idea to contact management in advance in order to benefit from individualised care – for example, transfer from the airport and personalised Welcoming – to avoid being drowned in the influx of arrivals and to ensure a stay perfectly aligned with the usual expectations of this clientele.

Thanks to this attention, we were able to fully enjoy the hotel’s iconic facilities, its unique setting and its exceptional Mood. We leave with a very good memory and warmly thank the whole team for their professionalism and sincere concern for the well-being of their guests.

The property is very large, so getting around can be a bit challenging — I recommend staying for at least two nights.

review_text:
I celebrated my 50th birthday here at the Marina Bay Sands. I was very embarrassed because we came from direct travel and had a ton of luggage and were dressed like we just came from the beach. We were immediately greeted though so warmly I quickly forgot. Everything is extremely organized and efficient with everybody having a defined role, but really going out of their way to make the experience unforgettably a cut above the rest. I never got to directly think many of the people that touched us when we were there. They were kind to us without any return gratitude.

Aellex pulled me out of line for VIP check-in, as I told him I was so embarrassed as to how we were dressed, and he said you just look like a VIP so I’m bringing you back here. Gwen took my daughter to get a complimentary drink, and Anna helped us check-in and relayed a kind story about her relationship with her mom and herself, as she noticed I was travelling alone with my daughter. I won’t ever forget Anna and hope to say thank you again for the relatable story and making our stay the best ever in my life.

Extraordinary customer service, the beautiful room (thank you to Danny, Yan, and Yvan, thank you for every detail and the tour of how the smart switches worked in our room), and the food… we had breakfast at the pool, which was a tremendous opportunity because of the short timeframe we had… And we had a beautiful 50th birthday dinner at Ce La Vi. This was the best birthday of my life, and I will always think of it hand-in-hand with being at Marina Bay and the special people that made it unforgettable. Thank you so very much.

Extraordinary customer service, the beautiful room (thank you to Danny, Yan, and Yvan, thank you for every detail and the tour of how the smart switches worked in our room), and the food… we had breakfast at the pool, which was a tremendous opportunity because of the short timeframe we had… And we had a beautiful 50th birthday dinner at Ce La Vi. This was the best birthday of my life, and I will always think of it hand-in-hand with being at Marina Bay and the special people that made it unforgettable. Thank you so very much.

review_title: Excellent Balinese Massage, But Renovation Affected the View
review_text:
I booked the 90-minute Balinese massage and was impressed from start to finish. The therapist was extremely friendly, attentive, and demonstrated excellent technique, ensuring I felt comfortable throughout the session. The massage pressure was perfect, and she focused on my sore areas with great skill, leaving me completely relaxed.
The only downside was that the spa is currently undergoing renovation, so the treatment rooms were relocated to the 2nd and 5th floors. This meant the usual stunning views were not available, which was a little disappointing. Nevertheless, the overall service and professionalism more than made up for it, and I would still highly recommend it once the renovations are complete. I believe it will be an even better experience after the renovation is finished.

review_title: Best customer service I have ever experienced at a hotel
review_text:
The Premium Services Team at Marina Bay Sands provided the best and most exceptional hotel customer service my family has ever received.

The day before we arrived, Mark Delegero contacted us multiple times to organise a complimentary hotel limo pick up service to take us to Marina Bay Sands on the day of our check in. He was in constant communication with our driver and immediately notified him when we were ready for our pick up. Our driver was friendly and talkative and had a lot of knowledge on Singapore. Once we arrived, Robby greeted us at the front of the hotel and took us straight to our room for an in room check in. The bell service team were also extremely prompt with bringing our luggage to the room and were very friendly. Not only did Robby give us a personal tour of our suite (complimentary upgrade) but also surprised our family with free buffet breakfast, afternoon tea and aperitif hour each day of our stay. He also surprised our family with free tickets to a balloon exhibition that was happening at the Expo centre. He was very kind, welcoming and knowledgeable about Marina Bay Sands and all the services the hotel had to offer. He also helped us organise dinner reservations and organised a birthday cake and champagne in our room upon our arrival.

Our entire experience at Marina Bay Sands and interaction with every staff member was memorable, exceptional and exceeded our expectations. We are so very grateful for the experience we had and the attention to detail shown. We will 100% be back and would recommend anyone to stay at Marina Bay Sands.

review_title: An amazing stay- we were sad to leave
review_text:
Recently spent one night for the end of our honeymoon at Marina Bay Sands.
We had the best experience and didn’t want to leave. The staff were incredibly professional and welcoming upon check in. We received an incredible and kind upgrade and were blown away by how special they made our stay (along with a little surprise dessert). The staff at the gym, breakfast (which had great variety and was yummy), check out, pool and luggage storage were also amazing. The only thing we were frustrated by was that males were not permitted in to breakfast wearing a singlet. After waiting in the queue for 20 mins, this was not mentioned until we were at the front of the line. We don’t have an issue with this rule, however there were no signs or information given about this and we felt it was inconsistently enforced as hotel slippers were worn at breakfast by multiple guests, despite these also not being permitted. Nonetheless, we would happily recommend this hotel and look forward to staying again.

review_title: Horrifying Experience at Marina Bay Sands – Zero Care After a Life-Threatening Lift Accident
review_text:
My stay at Marina Bay Sands turned into a nightmare due to a terrifying lift malfunction in Tower 2. While using the Paiza lift to the 55th floor, the lift suddenly plummeted in a free-fall between the 42nd and 55th floors. My heart was pounding, and I barely had time to grab the railing while mashing the emergency button and every floor below. The lift finally jerked to a stop at the 47th floor, where I stumbled out, visibly shaken. Another guest sitting outside heard the loud bangs from the lift and asked if I was okay—even he was alarmed.

A staff member escorted me upstairs, where Senior Service Manager Ella Barrientos spoke to me. When I said I needed urgent medical help, she downplayed the incident and told me to wait 1-3 hours for a the hotel to get a doctor from raffles hospital to come over. When I demanded an ambulance, she
discouraged it, pushing their MBS limo service instead—another 30-minute delay. It was clear they didn’t want an ambulance report documenting the incident.

Unacceptable Failures:
1. No Emergency Priority – They denied me immediate medical care, downplaying a life-threatening malfunction.
2. No Follow-Up or Support – Not a single staff member came to the hospital to check on me. No calls, no updates— total abandonment.
3. Zero Accountability – The staff acted like this was a minor inconvenience, not a safety failure that could have killed me.

This was not just an accident—it was gross negligence. Marina Bay Sands failed at every level: emergency response, guest care, and basic human decency. Never again. If you value your safety and well-being, avoid this hotel at all costs.

★☆☆☆☆ (1/5) – Reckless, Uncaring, and Dangerous

review_text:
To celebrate my 40th birthday and my daughter’s 18th birthday, I decided to treat myself to a night at this hotel. Although the price is quite high (CDN$1,225), I loved my experience.

As soon as we arrived by taxi, the staff immediately took care of us. I was supposed to have a room overlooking the gardens, but it wasn’t ready yet. So I was offered a room with city views at no extra cost. Just... wow!

When I booked directly on the hotel website, I mentioned that I was paying myself this luxury to celebrate my daughter’s 18th birthday and 40th birthday. After a first swim, we returned to the room, and a party cake had been dropped off for my daughter. What a beautiful attention!

The room was exceptionally clean. The bathroom, perfect. We could have made cocktails so well thought out.

The pool? It is simply breathtaking!

The breakfast buffet (included) was exquisite. I also tried the evening buffet. Personally, I preferred the morning meal, but my daughter preferred dinner. As a result, we were both satisfied.

Certainly, if I ever return to Singapore, I want to come back here — maybe even for more than one night.

Thank you to all the staff for this unforgettable experience.

review_text:
Amazing place !
Expensive , but worth it !
First time in Singapore, and very happy to stay in this hotel
Close to everything to visit
Many restaurant
The pool was a bit crowded, but the view and experience is unique.

The deposit of policy is a bit unfriendly … they charge your credit card in advance … and once the spending exceed the deposit already charged, I received within couple of hours : 1/ letter in my room 2/ a message on TV Screen 3/ a phone call by the reception asking me to come down and pay … I am used to travel in five stars hotels in many countries and never felt the same eagerness to increase a deposit (to be noted I already paid the rooms for close to 20 000 SGD, and the 3 messages received within couple of hours were related to 600 SGD spending ….) … it felt a bit weird , and it is the first time I felt I was looked upon as someone who may leave the hotel without paying … all the more so than they have my credit card details.
No drama, but it is not up to the standard of the hotel

review_title: Kudos to Lisa for one of the best massages!
review_text:
Lisa is hands-down one of the best massage therapists ive been to. From the moment I walked in, the space felt calm and welcoming. She hs a natural instinct for finding tight spots and working through them without needing much direction.

The session was the perfect mix of soothing and effective—great pressure, thoughtful check-ins, & real results. I left feeling lighter, especially in my back and shoulders. If u’re looking for someone skilled, attentive, and genuinely caring, Lisa’s the one. I’ll definitely be booking again.

review_text:
I had a 90-minute massage with Lisa and it ws honestly 1 of the best I’ve ever had. Right from the start, she made me feel at ease with her warm, professional approach and calming setup. Her technique struck the perfect balance between relaxing and genuinely therapeutic—she somehow knew exactly where the tension was and worked through it without me having to say much at all!

The pressure was spot on, and she checked in just enough to make sure I was comfortable. By the end of the session, I felt completely relaxed and could feel a big difference, especially in my back and shoulders. U can tell Lisa really knows her craft and puts genuine care into her work.

I’d highly recommend her if you’re looking for a massage that not only feels great but also really helps. I’m definitely coming back.

review_title: Come for the room, lower your expectations for everything else
review_text:
For the price, very average. I’ve stayed at quite a few luxury resorts and hotels. The service and friendliness were below average for the cost and reputation of the hotel. The front desk was barely warm, welcoming, or friendly. Very transactional… I get it, you want our money. There is literally nowhere to sit in the lobby area, just a few hard benches.

The best part of the stay was the room. The amenities were nice (Nespresso machine, Dyson hair dryer, chocolates, TWG tea), the view of the Gardens, and overall comfort was great. Our room attendant was phenomenal, the most friendly and attentive part of the stay. The attention detail was superb. Everything from wrapping up our cords, to placing bookmarks in our books, to noting which teas, chocolates and coffee pods we liked and stocking with extra…. Soo good! I only wish the balcony had a sitting area? Even a stool would be nice.

The pool area was also quite good. Views couldn’t be beat and the chairs were comfy. Towels and water were plentiful. Again the prices were crazy. $15 for a small bottled beer, $25 for a cocktail that was 4 sips. For that price I would expect a Texas Roadhouse sized goblet. Lifeguard did a great job keeping kids out of the adult area.

I’m not sure if I’d return, service (minus housekeeping) left a lot to be desired for the cost.

review_text:
From the very first moment at check-in, the Marina Bay Sands team made us feel incredibly welcome and cared for. Whether at the front desk, in the restaurants, by the pool, in the hallways or through housekeeping – every single member of the team was kind, attentive and committed to making our honeymoon unforgettable.

The room and the view were simply breathtaking. We are beyond grateful for the thoughtfulness and warmth that turned the final days of our trip into something truly magical. You made our dream come true – and gave our honeymoon the perfect ending it deserved.

The infinity pool? Unforgettable.
Dinner at Spago? Absolutely delicious, exceptional in every way – and with the most spectacular view.
And even the shower room after checkout? A beautiful gesture that once again showed how much this hotel values every guest.

To the entire Marina Bay Sands Team: thank you from the bottom of our hearts.
There’s only one possible conclusion after this experience – we have to come back!

With gratitude,
Jens & Ina Kögler

review_text:
We stayed 2 nights in July. Oh, wow! Very 5-star. Lots of staff, all very helpful. Freebies in the room - sweets, chocs, slippers, tea/coffee/water, even a customised birthday cake. Super room with a beautiful balcony giving a view over the gardens.

Enormous breakfast buffet, very very fine. "You need gluten free? Here, come speak with the chef. If we don't already have it he will make it for you." Could not fault their helpful attitude.

And of course there's that rooftop infinity pool. Which, if anything, is better than the photos make it seem. So chilled to lie by the pool and have drinks and food magically appear.

I forgot the Jazz bar! Every night from 20:30 on the 56th floor, live jazz! So sophisticated. Go!

The only glitch we had was that check-in seemed to take forever. But that was easily forgiven and forgotten.

Yes, it is expensive, but it is definitely worth the expense. We loved it and will definitely go back if we manage to save up.

review_title: Comfort Beyond Words at Marina Bay Sands Spa
review_text:
From the moment I stepped into the luxurious calm of the Marina Bay Sands Spa, I knew I was in excellent hands. Avril, the receptionist, greeted me with a warmth and professionalism that immediately set the tone for the experience — attentive, gracious, and effortlessly welcoming.

But the real magic began with Crystal, my masseuse. I’ve had my fair share of massages, but this one redefined excellence. Crystal is not just highly skilled — she’s intuitive, precise, and masterful in her technique. Every movement was purposeful, tailored to my needs, and delivered with such finesse that I was completely transported. Truly, the best massage I’ve ever received.

If you’re looking for a spa experience that’s equal parts luxury and expertise, make sure you ask for Crystal. And thank you, Avril, for making everything feel seamless from start to finish. Can’t wait to return.

review_title: Good place to relax by the Gardens
review_text:
When we entered the lobby, one of our group remarked, “This feels like an airport.” The check-in queue echoed the experience you might have at Changi Airport — systematic, swiftish , but not particularly personal. What made all the difference were Simon and Ivy. Their thoughtful professionalism and warm demeanor turned a routine process into a genuinely welcoming start to our stay. Huge thanks to them.

Our rooms were located on the sixth floor of Tower 3, facing Gardens by the Bay. They were fresh, impeccably appointed, and the view toward the gardens left little to be desired. That said, the road-facing side meant some noise filtered in — improved glazing could help future guests sleep a little more soundly.

The 57th floor houses the famous infinity pool — a marvel of modern architecture and an unforgettable place to unwind. The water was refreshingly cool, the sun generously warm, and the pool bar staff kept service moving with a smile. The poolside menu could use a bit of expansion, but that’s just being particular.

Also on the 57th are Spago and C‘est la vie, both boasting the same panoramic views you get from the pool. We had breakfast at Spago Lounge one morning and tried the buffet on the first floor the next. Spago was fine — pleasant but unremarkable. The buffet was chaotic. It felt less like breakfast and more like watching herds of buffalo descend on the food stations. There’s plenty of choice, yes, but for a calmer experience, I’d head down to the mall level for artisanal bakeries and quieter cafés.

The overall experience at Marina Bay Sands remains iconic. Would I return? If they could somehow merge the peaceful, polished atmosphere of the Four Seasons with the drama and grandeur of the infinity pool — absolutely. Finally a big thank you to Madurai, the Bellman who eased our departure to Changi airport.

review_text:
I am a confirmed guest of MBS from 8th July to 11th July, 2025, can provide evidence of my tenancy if required. So check-in is hands down the worst that I have experienced in 25 years of travelling and over 50 countries visited. There were hidden costs - yes hidden until check-in - and a "delay" of a security deposit of 1 month!!!! announced at check-in! So they take my deposit and security bond IMMEDIATELY, but refund takes 1 month!!! WTF?
Okay, let's continue. I was given the the hard sell on all "features" and "functions" of the MBS. Yep, knew all that before I got there because I have the internet!!! Christ, check-in took 20 minutes because of this sales pitch! I'm not exaggerating, 20 minutes of an up-sell and myself and my daughters were dying for oxygen!!!
Please, pull back on the up sell and just let people check in! Your guests generally have travelled for a long time to be at your check-in, just let them get to their room!

So the facilities are excellent, as you'd expect. Please be aware, like Las Vegas, big hotels = long walking time to anything. The key feature to this hotel is the pool. Just 100% superb, but outside that, you're going to pay the price. I stayed at the MBS for 3 nights, then the Fullerton Hotel for 4 and the Fullerton kills this hotel for value, customer service and quality. Having stayed at the MBS, I will never stay there again, not even if you paid me.

There's many people who stay one night to access the pool and then rave about 5* quality and how great they are being able to afford such luxury. Spare me. If you've ever stayed in a genuine 5 star hotel, you wouldn't rate this one as close.

review_text: Family of 3 from Boston. First time to Singapore for a 3nite 4 day visit. We were coming from a weeklong stay in Bali resort. The change between Bali and Singapore and Ritz Carlton Ubud to Marina Bay Sands is immediate. Singapore is truly a beating city life place. Took is about half a day to get accustomed to the electricity of the life in hotel and city. The lobby of the hotel is convenient connector to shops metro , ArtScience museum and the hotel. As such the is a lot of people passing though the hotel lobby. We took advantage of this convenience by visiting the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, Garden by the Bay, ArtScience museum and the shopping mall. Now the hotel. It is extremely modern and well appointed. We stayed at 34th floor overlooking the Garden. A wonderful view. The room was exquisitely appointed with asian motif furniture. Good size for a family of 3. 2 beds. The complementary breakfasts was top notch. Two restaurants to choose from. Buffet on the libby, or a la carte on 57th floor (adjacent to infinity pool). Both serves great food. The infinity pool has a fantastic view to the city and around. Each person of the party needs to present room key to enter. As luck would have it, our second day was a Saturday where the city was having the fireworks. We got to watch the whole show from our room in comfort. All the staff were courteous and multi lingual. Room service was top notch and very fast.

review_text:
We arrived on a plane from Vietnam that changed schedules twice and so we arrived late. They had not received the payment of the room by the agency made well in advance (I do not know how you can receive money and not combine it with the payment of something) and did not do any research but just another charge on my credit card. No effort to search the agency's emails, nothing. Luckily my card was large because when you stay 20 days on the road you have a lot of expenses. at 11pm in a hotel like this with these costs no one gave you food, Room Service did not even answer the call, it was 11pm not 2am.
They arranged the transfer to the airport from the hotel departing at 6.30am and had told the agency that they would provide us with a box with breakfast: absolutely nothing. We were fasted from lunch the day before...... I would say scandalous.
When we left they recognized that the room had already been paid for and then they reversed the charge that still blocked the amount for 15 days.

review_title: An amazing family vacation at MBS
review_text:
Our family of 2 adults and 2 kids (4 & 10) have just returned from a wonderful 7 nights stay at Marina Bay Sand. The Marina Bay Sands team went over and above to ensure our stay was memorable and amazing. We were treated so kindly by all staff, and we can honestly say that it is our favourite hotel in Singapore. Marina Bay Sands is a destination in itself, and we feel very fortunate to have been able to experience this once in a lifetime destination.

From the time that we landed at Changi Airport, we were met by the competent Premium team at arrival to escort us to our waiting vehicle; then when we arrived at the hotel we were again meet by another Premium team member who escorted us straight to our suite for a hassle free in-room check in avoiding the hustle and bustle of the main foyer; and then on our day of departure, Victor Mai, the hotel Manager took the time to personally assist us with a stress free check out. All of this made travelling with kids so easy and stress free.

Our kids have some sensory challenges and special dietary needs which made breakfast at the Rise restaurant a particularly stressful time – once Victor was made aware of this, Victor went over and above to offered solutions for us to have a more peaceful and enjoyable breakfast time as a family. We really appreciate Victor’s understanding and kindness.

The hotel itself is a beautiful work of architecture and our room, a Family Suite on the 9th floor did not disappoint – we had a spacious balcony offering breathtaking views overlooking Gardens by the Bay, and best of all, we were able to watch the Super Tree Light Shows each night from there which was just a magical experience.

Our Family Suite was well designed with family in mind – so spacious and impeccably cleaned; and with all the amenities a small family would need, best of all we loved the washer/dryer which came in handy when travelling with small children and the microwave oven which we used many times for our fresh popcorn. Our kids adored having their very own room which had a bunk bed, bean bags, a huge TV, Nintendo Switch and kid-friendly amenities.

We would like to say a special thank you to the following wonderful people at MBS that has made our holiday a truly memorable one.

• Victor Mai (Manager) – thank you for your understanding and kindness around our children’s dietary needs, and for handling our departure with such care. It really means a lot to us.
• Sid (The Club Lounge) – thank you for your kindness and friendship, we really enjoyed getting to know you, you made our little family feel so at home each time we dined at the Club Lounge, we will miss you. Thank you for taking the time to personally check that the kids' meals were always prepared to their special dietary requirements.
• Jian Dang (Room Stylist) – thank you for your hard work in keeping our suite impeccably clean and well stocked and we appreciate your thoughtfulness in ensuring that the kids always had plenty of their favourite popcorn available.
• Angel (Premium Services) – thank you for your help with our special room service request when were out one day, your care in keeping us informed along the way which gave us peace of mind.
• The Pool Team – your friendliness and beautiful smiles always made us feel so welcomed each time we visited the infinity pool. Thank you for all your hard work in ensuring that we always have enough towels and refreshments and for keeping everyone safe.
• Raymond (Bellman) – thank you for helping us with our many pieces of luggage, your dedication and care is really appreciated.

We highly recommend the Marina Bay Sands especially if you are travelling with little kids as the Family Suite is awesome and has everything you would need; the location is perfect as there are so many dining options at the hotel and the shopping mall; lots of kid friendly attractions right at your door; taxis are always readily available without having to wait long; and the helpful, friendly MBS team are always on hand to help make your stay as stress free as possible.

We look forward to visiting again soon.

review_title: Blown Away by the Paiza Experience – A True 5-Star Stay ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
review_text:
We recently stayed two nights at Marina Bay Sands’ newly renovated Paiza Suite to celebrate our anniversary and my wife's recovery—and we were truly amazed. Having stayed before the renovations, we didn’t expect much, but this visit completely changed our impression.

The suite was incredibly spacious with a gorgeous skyline view, karaoke room, fully equipped kitchen, and thoughtful in-room amenities (yes, even a pillow menu!). The attention to detail was superb.

The real highlight? Paiza Butler Service. Huge thanks to Ben and Vicky, who went above and beyond anticipating our needs—even noticing small things like when we needed a plastic bag or misplaced our key. Check-in and checkout were seamless.

Sky Residence, the exclusive lounge for Paiza guests, was another standout—amazing food all day with rotating menus. Special thanks to Mr. Sara and Ms. Joppy for their warmth and impeccable service. I may have gained 5 lbs in 2 days, but it was worth every bite.

Also shoutout to Laura and Sun at the infinity pool who added to the magic with their smiles and stunning photos.

This was more than a luxury hotel stay—it was a world-class experience. Can’t wait to return!

review_title: Still unique on this earth. But be careful when booking a suite as part of the Sands Collection.
review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is indeed unique in the world. The three towers alone, the huge lobby, but also the pool in the 56th floor. Stock are more than breathtaking and leave nothing to be desired. A detour to Garden by the Bay or the harbour front is an absolute "MUST".
However, those guests who book a not exactly affordable suite as part of the "Sands Collection" are very disappointed. If regular guests have been used to enjoying the unique advantages of the "Club 55" in the course of the suite booking in recent years, they will be clearly disappointed. The "Club 55" is now forbidden to these suite bookers, only small pre-made snacks and 1 (!) Drink offered. And this offer can be found again in a location in the lobby, which at best exudes the charm of a bad train station pub.
Unfortunately, the management changed: If you want to enjoy full enjoyment as part of a suite booking, you must choose the "Paiza Collection".

Marina Bay Sands: Unfortunately, you lost a regular customer.

review_text: For years, my dream has been to visit Singapore, and especially the Marina Bay Hotel. I've seen all kinds of photos and reviews, but I wanted to personally see if it was true. I'm just speechless in terms of quality.but after my visit I can say that the hotel's other asset is the staff. extremely kind, they treat the guests very well, smiling. When we were at the pool, Ravi served us, explained everything about breakfast, answered all our questions, gave us directions on which places to visit in the city, which season is suitable, I liked the offer for the new year and the fireworks.I never thought I would be so impressed by the hotel, the service and the staff, the food was extremely delicious, diverse, I have never seen such a choice anywhere and I hope to come back again for a longer stay one day.

review_text: We were lucky to get a room at MBS (Marina Bay Sands) when we were visiting family for the Lunar New Year. For a hotel of this size, with so many facilities and rooms, our stay had been most impressive to say the least! Not only was the room very clean for our entire stay, the housekeeping team was polite, warm and friendly. MBS is a busy hotel with many people on its premises all the time. Yet, we quite like the lively vibe of the hotel, especially since it was the festive season. Would definitely recommend the view and chillax time at the infinity pool deck, and also seeing Singapore at night from the Skypark Observation Deck. A stay at MBS is definitely worth the splurge!

review_text:
We recently stayed in one of the suites. A truly breathtaking experience for the family. Whilst I do not usually take to social media platforms to do reviews, MBS is truly deserving of this!

Service - Top-notch and highly impressive - having stayed in suites around the world prior to this, the butler team has taken hospitality to a different level - if I must use only a short phrase to describe this - world-class! Thank you very much to the butler team especially to Lesley ( Senior butler, who started reaching out to us via email ahead of our stay),Thana ( our butler for day 1) , Charlotte ( day 2) and Ruth ( day 3) . Whilst words cannot describe our appreciation to this stellar team, including the staff in the Sky restaurant ( the manager on the ground on 17th June who attended to us during brunch and also the team attending to us at the table including Vella and her 2 colleagues ), not forgetting Edx, who helped us with the luggage at checkout - thank you for going above and beyond for us during our short stay!

The hotel and hospitality industry is only made possible and can only climb to greater heights ( pun not intended) because of their members of staff who are the faces of the hotel. I do hope the hotel management continues to institute measures and retain their excellent teams with the needful incentives and commendations at appropriate junctures. This will continue to encourage their teams to strive and maintain excellent standards.

review_title: An unforgettable night in the family suite at Marina Bay Sands
review_text:
We stayed one night in the family suite with two bedrooms and a separate children’s room – and it was MAGICAL! Right from the start we were picked up by luxury cars, which set the tone for the entire stay.

The room was huge, tastefully decorated and had everything we could want – and more. You could really tell that every detail was well thought out. The service was absolutely top class, with staff who were both professional and incredibly friendly.

Room service was on point – fast, smooth and with great food. The breakfast really gave everything you could want – an abundance of options, high quality and something for every taste.

The highlight was of course the infinity pool. Swimming up there with the iconic views of Singapore was an experience in itself. We ate club sandwiches and drank mocktails by the poolside – it felt like a scene from a movie.

We ended the night in the casino, which really delivered! Professional atmosphere, excitement and world-class entertainment.

We had high expectations, but Marina Bay Sands delivered well above them. A day we will never forget!

review_title: Major changes to suite guest benefits
review_text: Afternoon tea has been reduced to a smaller section of space in Rise, with a major change to suite guest benefits starting in June. Cocktail hour has also been abolished, becoming aperitif hour, and reservations must be made at six restaurants. Popular stores are full of reservations. It's not a buffet like before, just one plate and a drink. Seating is only available for an hour. I paid extra to drink champagne, but it was only an hour, so it was very hectic. I miss my old style.

review_title: Major changes to suite guest benefits
review_text: From June, the benefits for suite guests have changed significantly. Afternoon tea has changed from a club to a rise, and it's a very small space, with coffee being an automatic machine. Cocktail hour has also been changed to aperitif hour and you have to make reservations at six restaurants. The popular wakda was full of reservations. And only a set plate and a drink (no champagne, sparkling wine) and only an hour's seating. It used to be two hours in a spacious space and you could have all you wanted. It has changed so much, it is so disappointing. It was a suite stay with no special feeling whatsoever.

The bed and ameneties? No need explain – everythings was perfect, just like you’d expect from a world class hotel. The rooftop pool was totaly a highlight! We enjoyed meeting with travlers from all over while soaking those infinity pool vibes.

Also the casino downstairs – what a fantastic thing! We spent few fun nights there, impressed by the new machines and very friendly staff.

Sleep quality? Perfect. Cleaness? Impecable. Every detail make our stay realy unforgetable. Thank you for the luxury, excitment and the memories – we be back!

review_title: Mixed but o really good experience
review_text:
MBS Review
Top marks to welcome team (seamless transfer of luggage from taxi to luggage hold and then onto the rooms). Also very happy with room design ( thoughtfully laid out) though being on 3rd floor, balcony is noisy and showed road view rather than any garden by the bay view. For the price (over $32k), I would expect a quiet balcony with magnificent views.

Staff service is a mixed of helpful and indifferent. Not impressed by front desk and concierge, while Housekeeping is great, as are in-room dining, gift shop staff and limo service. Special mention of spa team -Yaneli , Lisa and Enita who provided excellent and friendly treatment. Also sky deck activities such as yoga and sound meditation were great though 2 classes were cancelled last minute due to lack of alternative arrangement during inclement weather.

Stay marred by drinking glass breaking in my 3 year old grandson's mouth in Rise restaurant during breakfast, staff were quick to act though.
In addition, the stay did not end on a happy note as my departure was held back by an unjustified demand for extra charge ( breakfast for the little ones).

Nevertheless overall experience is good.

review_title: Easily the best experience my family have had whilst on holiday!
review_text: Easily the best experience my family have had whilst on holiday! A new bench mark has been set!!! I would give Marina Bay Sands 10 stars if I could. Everything was just perfect. The team members at check in were lovely and made everything so easy. My luck with rooms is terrible, it doesn't matter what I pay I get the car park view. Not this time with no special request from us, we received a beautiful view of the gardens by the bay and could watch the light show every night. We even received a personal guide on arrival and departure that helped us settle in and get on our way which was amazing when travelling with a newborn and a 4 year old. The room has all the amenities you could ever need, drinks for the adults to snacks for the kiddies. So much thought has been put into all the little things you may need as a family on holiday, felt like we had more than we needed and all those things we forget they had. All the staff were fantastic and the food was incredible. Breakfast buffet had plenty to choose from and the dinner buffet was the best my wife and I have ever experienced. There is nothing I can fault and you won't be disappointed if you stay. No need to even bring any toiletries or a pool towel, the quality from toothbrush to the staff waiting at the pool with a towel and water bottle were just superb. We will definitely be back.

review_text:
So the lobby is nice, and swimming pool also, but if you are looking for a nice room, stay away. We had a room with two beds, and one ONE power outlet that was worn out and we had to use multiple adaptors (which we fortunately had) to get things to stay in without falling out, and plug in two chargers. We shared one bed, while our child use the other. Which meant even with our adaptors, the person on the outside cannot charge their phone.

But the worse part is the awful polyester bathrobes. I know resorts need to save money, but seriously, they can't afford to supply a cotton bathrobe to their guests when charging 1,300 dollars a night!

This will be the first and last time I stay here. It has 5 star prices, but the room is more like a 3 star place.

review_title: You can't really stay anywhere else when in Singapore!
review_text:
First visit to Singapore, and the Marina Bay Sands was the highlight of our trip! What an amazing property! Where do I start:

ROOMS - Spacious rooms with a large shower/tub, separate toilet with sink, good sized closet space with drawers and hanging shelves, good quality amenities. Excellent in every way.

SERVICE - Courteous and prompt, whenever we needed to call for anything! Concierge was also helpful in helping us navigate the city.

INFINITY POOL - Rooftop pool is one of the main highlights of this property! Go up early before the sun beats down on the roof - we got there at 6am every day when the pool opens, and it was heavenly right up until sunrise. Or you could go at sunset, but it gets really crowded then.

RESTAURANTS - We had breakfast included at their Spago, the rooftop restaurant, or the one at the Lobby level. The breakfast at Spago was a set menu - we chose the Laksa - outstanding!! The one in the lobby is a buffet, and that had a massive spread as well, but it was very very crowded! I guess folks prefer buffets to set menus?

FITNESS CENTER - Even though the fitness center is a bit of a hike to get to, coz it's in the Casino side of the building, it's a very well equipped gym and totally loves up to the hotel standards. Plenty of strength and cardio machines, all brand new and use the latest tech. Very impressive. If you prefer to run outdoors, there's a great 5k loop around the waterfront by the hotel - the concierge can help with map it (just keep in mind that it's hot and humid almost all the time!).

The shopping mall at the base of the hotel, as well as the walkway to Gardens by the Bay from the hotel, are both incredible. The mall has plenty of high end stores, and some excellent restaurants / coffee shops. You can never really get bored at this property!

All in all loved Marina Bay Sands! Will definitely positively stay here again on our next visit to this beautiful country!

The massage was an incredible experience—so relaxing that I actually fell asleep! I still felt the benefits afterward, completely at ease and tension-free. They also serve tea before and after the massage there’s tea and snacks for you, which added a really lovely touch to the whole experience.

Nina was especially wonderful; she taught me techniques to relieve tight spots, gave helpful tips, and even gifted me a massage ball to take home. Such thoughtful and professional service. Highly recommend!

review_text: If you going to Singapore, this hotel is a must. Woooow! We had a conx flight on Singapore and we decided to stay 2 nights at the Marina Bay Sands. Its the most beautiful hotel we have been. Its huge. They have a lot of restaurants, casino, shopping mall... and much more inside the hotel. Also the infinity pool is only available to the guests staying at the hotel. The stuff super nice, we were able to check in earlier, and also for checkout. They gave us a complimentary late checkout and after we were able to keep our bags at a storage place until we return. The room had a letter welcoming us, super nice suite. Big tip book directly with the hotel. We had a good discount with.

review_title: Yoga at Marina Bay Sands with Instructor Vikram
review_text:
We recently attended a yoga session at Marina Bay Sands, and it was such a memorable experience! The weather was absolutely perfect—breezy and bright, making the outdoor setting feel both calming and energizing.

Instructor Vikram was fantastic. Even as beginners, we felt completely comfortable throughout the class. His guidance was clear and supportive, and what really stood out was his light humour—it kept the mood light and made the session genuinely enjoyable. He struck a great balance between mindfulness and fun, which made the experience feel less intimidating and more accessible.

Whether you’re a first-timer or someone looking for a scenic yoga escape with an experienced instructor, this class is worth trying. We’ll definitely be back!

Special kudos to Jenny and Dennis from the poolside they were incredibly friendly and thoughtful, going the extra mile to make sure our stay was comfortable and the kids were having fun. review_title: Mixed review due to room mix up
review_text:
With the sheer number of guests and rooms in this iconic hotel, it’s no surprise that check-in can be slow, and this visit was no exception. However, as a returning guest, I was very pleased to see that the check-out process has been streamlined—you simply drop your key card and any charges are billed directly to your credit card, making departure quick and hassle-free.

Unfortunately, there was a frustrating issue with our room allocation. Despite multiple confirmations prior, the hotel failed to provide the single king bed we had booked. The check-in staff offered us a downgraded room with blocked views—far from the full view with balcony we had reserved—if we wanted the correct bedding arrangement. This was disappointing and not what I would expect from a hotel of this calibre.

That said, aside from this annoyance, the overall experience was pleasant. It’s always a treat to stay at Marina Bay Sands, especially for access to the iconic infinity pool, which remains a highlight of any visit.

review_title: Fantastic Stay At Marina Bay Sands
review_text: Our two-night stay at Marina Bay Sands exceeded our expections in every way. The room (suite) was fabulous and all of the generous little extras made us feel pampered and like all of our wants and needs had been anticipated and prepared for us in advance. The restaurant buffet experiences were equally fabulous, with a fantastic variety of dishes from many different cultures and an abundance of choices. We had planned to do some sightseeing in Singapore during our stay, but the resort itself had so much to offer in terms of great experiences that we never left the resort campus. We were expecially looking forward to the rooftop infinity pool and it was everything we were hoping for. We were expecting it to be crowded, but that was never the case. It was very relaxing and an exceedingly awesome experience! To cap it all off, on our final evening, after a relaxing sunset soak in the pool, we returned to our room to find a complementary tray of smoked salmon, caviar, and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us, along with a sweet customized message from our personal concierge, Eunice, who had decorated our envelope with a drawing that clearly indicated she had been listening when we shared some of our current travel experience with her. Very touching. We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the Marina Bay Sands and would love to return some day.

review_title: HUGE Thanks to Erica and Betty for Making Our Stay Perfect!
review_text:
I'm writing to express our sincere gratitude to Erica and Betty at Marina Bay Sands. My parents, who previously enjoyed a wonderful stay, were initially given a room that didn't meet their expectations. Erica and Betty listened with empathy and immediately took action, going above and beyond to find a more suitable room that was perfect for their comfort. Their personal touch was truly remarkable; they escorted my parents to their new room, ensuring they were settled and happy. This level of care made all the difference and turned a potential disappointment into a fantastic experience.

Erica and Betty, thank you so much for your outstanding service and for going the extra mile. Your dedication and genuine care for guests are truly commendable. We will certainly recommend the hotel and look forward to returning, knowing we'll be in such capable hands.

This is the best hotel I have ever experienced.
Thank you very much.
