review_text:
We stayed at Marina Bay Sands during the third week of April to celebrate my birthday and anniversary at the same time, and honestly, it was such an amazing experience. From the moment we arrived, everything felt smooth and welcoming. A big shoutout to Ms. Yve who checked us in—she was super friendly and helpful. It was my first time in Singapore, and she gave us great suggestions on where to go and what to check out. You can tell she really knows the place and loves helping guests.

Our room was beautiful, super clean, and had a great view—it definitely added to the whole experience. And of course, the infinity pool was a major highlight. It’s just as stunning in real life as it looks in the pictures. We spent a lot of time up there just relaxing and soaking in the view.

Overall, it was a really special and memorable stay. Everything felt worth it, and we’re already talking about coming back. Thanks again to the team for making our trip so wonderful!

review_title: It gets better every time we visit.
review_text:
This was our second stay at MBS as a friend was visiting and I wanted to treat her. I left the reservation too late and couldn't get a Paiza suite. However the wonderful lady at check in arranged an upgrade and we got a Seaview suite on the 52nd floor.

These suites are worth every single penny. Minute details were thought of when designing the suite. Wireless charging on almost every surface, a beautiful vanity to get ready at with a Dyson hairdryer. A room scent to use and take home. A variety of teas that will blow your mind. The shower is phenomenal and the bathroom also has a TV. On top of the two already in the suite! I could fault nothing!! And I'm picky!!!

We had breakfast at Spago on day 1 which was good. Dining options are not extensive and they will not cook to your needs. Food comes off a line and the chef won't take any changes. I asked for my bacon to be cooked longer as the fat was barely rendered for the table next to us and it was a no from the chef. I ordered an omelet.

Couldn't have breakfast at Rise the next day as the queue was at least an hour long. A kind staff member suggested Origin and Bloom at tower 3 and it was the best decision to have a quick snack there. So so good!

The infinity pool never disappoints. Multiple closures due to lightning but don't believe other reviewers that it will ruin your stay. There are 2 for 1 cocktails when the pool is closed! It also never lasted more than an hour and we were back in! Do try the jacuzzi as well.
Poolside snacks are good but limited. I do wish there were more local food options available on the menu.

There was a very rowdy couple one day at the pool. Fighting with one another and swearing so loudly. The woman even asked that someone call the cops. The staff handled this situation so impeccably well. Bravo!

The staff at this establishment are the true attractions. Thanks to Mo, James and Charis at the pool for great service and conversations.

We will always be back!

What a stay!!! The best experience in a hotel that we have ever experienced! From the assistance of the staff to the stunning rooms, the stay was excellent! We were assisted on check in and check out with Sarah, she was helpful and answered all of our questions! We dined at Koma and Jen & Synthia was amazing! The bed was so comfy, the gardens by the bay view was insane! The room facilities were amazing, what did we not have… haha!! This hotel is worth every penny. On our check out the porters DJ & Chris were so attentive and helpful, engaged in a great conversation and wished us safe travels. We had a late flight therefore did not have to leave the hotel until 6pm, however, we were provided temporary passes at a later checkout time at midday so that we could still use the infinity pool. We also were given a room to shower before we left the hotel. The service is beyond remarkable. Thank you Marina Bay Sands! Until we meet again!

Also, it is worth downloading the Marina Bay Sands app, and create an account to redeem points and redeemable dollars!

review_title: Unforgettable start to our Honeymoon at Marina Bay Sands
review_text:
Our stay at Marina Bay Sands was incredible from start to finish. The highlight was the iconic infinity pool on the 57th floor—stunning views, great drinks, and excellent service!

The fitness center was also a standout—spacious, fully equipped (yes, even a squat rack!), and top-tier service from Uma made our morning workouts enjoyable.

Beautiful rooms, fantastic food, and everything you need all in one place. The complementary bottle of champagne for honeymoon was a nice touch! Can’t wait to come back!

review_title: Didn’t want to leave Marina Bay Sands
review_text: We stayed two nights at Marina Bay Sands. We arrived early and were hoping to have a room upon arrival however they advised us the room will be ready at 3.00pm. We pre-checked in, were given pre passes that gives us access to all areas. We had a look around the shopping mall, Little Venice with Gondola had lunch at the food court. We went back at 3.00pm to check in only to be told our room was not ready! Very disappointed, we went to level 57 and enjoyed the views saw the infinity pool that we were hoping to have a late afternoon swim. Room was finally given to us at 4.30 pm, having had to complain, check in reimbursed us $100 to spend at the hotel. The room was immaculate Jo Love toiletries. Bathroom was spacious, our room was good size had state of the art features, garden by the bay view was stunning, we were Tower 2, level 17. City views from infinity pool were stunning, the other side had garden by the bay views. Spargo for breakfast was scrumptious, staff at the restaurant and hotel went above and beyond to keep hotel guest happy. We really enjoyed our two stay at Marina Bay Sands. Would be back one day. Thank you Raymond at Guest Services ensuring all luggage was packed ready for us to return home to UK.

The gym aslo has a very complete set of machines from stair masters, treadmills, and suprisingly a punching bag. review_text:
We were really looking forward to this hotel and I’ve got to say it really didn’t disappoint.

We stayed in a double queen room facing the gardens and the view was stunning. The room was a great size, with a balcony and a really well equipped bathroom. I think it was probably the nicest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in. Beautifully done in every way, I really can’t see how the rooms could be improved.

The roof top pool is spectacular, an amazing experience and frankly worth the cost of accommodation.

The only issues we had were breakfast. We are a family of four and went to the rooftop restaurant the first day and were surprised there was no kids menu. The menu for adults is great but not many 10 year olds want an omelette with whipped feta and wild mushrooms. We asked for something less complex and were told no, the menu is as it is. They didn’t even have an apple juice. The next morning we went to the buffet in the lobby and had to wait over 15 minutes for a table which we hated. The restaurant is in the lobby and it feels quite exposed and queuing for food like that felt really awkward. We returned to the rooftop the next morning as we hated the buffet experience but the service on this third and final day was beyond dreadful. We had struggled to be understood on the first day but managed to at least get a plateful of food, this did not happen on the third day. We waited 20 minutes for coffees that never came, the fried eggs we ordered came delivered as some sort of oily whipped meringue-like mess. Genuinely an awful experience so we left and decided to have breakfast at the airport. It was an awful end to what had otherwise been a great stay.

Upon checkout I queried why we hadn’t received the credit towards our spend in the hotel as this was part of my deal when booking. I was told I had to claim this at a machine. This wasn’t explained at all during check-in and we really wanted to just get checked out as the kids hadn’t eaten. They offered to take me to the machine there and then but this felt awkward and time consuming. I think they should make it clearer upon checking in. It was only a hundred dollars but given we’d run up a bill of thousands of dollars in 3 days it seemed a shame to not be able to use it.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is in a class of it's own! It's so much more than a hotel, the whole experience was superb. We have enjoyed 5 star hotels in other locations, but the Marina Bay Sands took our breath away! There aren't enough words to say how special they made us feel during our stay.

The room and view over Gardens By The Bay were so beautiful and the light and music show were magical.

The infinity pool was unforgettable, the shops and restaurants restaurants were endless and the staff couldn't be more accommodating and welcoming.

We just wished we could have stayed longer, it was the cherry on top of a spectacular stay in the utopia of Singapore!

We just wished we could have stayed longer, it was the cherry on top of a spectacular stay in the utopia of Singapore!

review_text:
One of the best hotel experiences we’ve ever had. While it’s expensive (we only stayed for one night) it was absolutely worth it. The room was just amazing and being able to use the infinity pool and watch the sunset was an incredible experience. Would absolutely recommend if you’re in Singapore!
Skip the food at the pool ( the club sandwiches were awful, could have made better myself - esp for the price!) and enjoy the drinks - 2 for 1 between 10pm and 11.45pm.
Also be sure to ask about use of the hospitality suite if you’re checking out and want to freshen up before a flight etc as it must be reserved in advance.

review_title: Amazing hotel - best we have stayed in and an awesome unexpected room upgrade
review_text:
We have just returned from an 11 night trip to Singapore and Bali. The first stage of the trip was 4 nights at the Marina Bay Sands, which was definitely the highlight of our whole trip.

At check-in, the receptionist asked whether our trip was for a special occasion. We explained that it was for a joint 60th birthday plus a retirement, thinking perhaps that we might receive a cake or something. We were instead informed that we would be upgraded from our booked room ("Premier Garden View") to a room in their "Paiza" floors, which turned out to be a "Paiza Bay Suite". This was a fantastic and totally unexpected upgrade - I won't go into details of the room - everything is on the MBS website, but basically it took our stay to a whole new level.

The Paiza rooms benefit from many perks including butler service, breakfast/brunch, afternoon tea and evening drinks/canapes in the exclusive Sky Lounge on the 55th floor. We made full use of these facilities during our stay and the experience and service were first class.

The room facilities were excellent and could not be faulted.

One tiny tip - I did have some trouble connecting to the Chromecast facility on the (huge) TVs in the room, but it turned out that each TV has a little cupboard at the bottom left corner hiding the very useful HDMI input connector so that worked much easier.

Of course the infinity pool is a must-use facility. Unfortunately our stay was rather short so we only used it once but the pool and amazing views across the city were very memorable.

The hotel is perfectly located for easy access to all the popular attractions and of course has its own MRT station in the attached shopping centre for slightly further trips.

review_text:
In April, I spent two nights at Marina Bay Sands to attend a conference. While the stay was short, the entire experience was exceptional.

The event organizers had reserved MBS’ newly renovated suite, which greatly differed from my previous stay in 2019. The refreshed suite offered an elevated level of luxury. The interior was entirely refreshed with new decor and furnishings, plus ambient lighting and a luxurious marble bathtub that provided a warm and relaxing experience.

The service provided by the MBS staff from the day of arrival was simply exemplary. All the staff, from the Front Office, restaurant to housekeeping, were professional and extremely detail-oriented.

Though my time at the property was short, this recent stay was indeed memorable. I cannot wait to return for a longer stay next time to enjoy Marina Bay Sands, and I highly recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travelers who desire a memorable, top-notch hospitality experience.

Had not only the booked view in the Garden, but from the bathtub even something into the city (RandTower 3). The bathroom alone was huge. The next morning it talked until noon, which did not bother us any further because we had a fantastic pool day. Well, for the... unfortunately there are no changing rooms by the pool. You change in the toilet. There is a shower cubicle there. Roof terrace is big enough, here you should set up 2-4 changing rooms. The two areas where you can check into the hotel are kept quite open and seem cold. Those who can afford it should definitely stay at least one night in the hotel. Be sure to visit Rise Buffet Restaurant as well.

review_text: What a hotel! I travelled across Asia with my young family (3 children) and visited various cities - all were 5 star resorts. I wasn't sure whether to book this hotel as it was over double every 5 star "equivalent" but I am so glad I did. The service was great, staff attentive and rooms were lovely. We had an interconnecting room facing Gardens By The Bay (I would recommend). I had one small issue at check-in which I forgot about but it was logged and management (Abdul Rahman Bin Umar) sorted it out proactively. The only niggle is the queue for breakfast can be long (c15-20 minutes) however it is worth the wait - the options/selection on offer is so good! We are back in London and still talk about this one hotel. The big highlight is the pool on the 57th floor - we were there throughout our trip including 11pm in the evening - it was a special highlight. If you are in two minds, don't overthink it - just book MBS!

review_title: Too Expensive and a Disappointing Experience
review_text:
We visited Marina Bay to go on the observation deck in the morning. This for two of us was $75SDollars. This is quite a lot of money but we were expecting to be amazed and see so much at the top.
Oh dear.....the poor tourist is confined to a very small potion of the roof space (probably about 1/8th on the left hand side of the photo image on the left. There is a somewhat overpriced minibar up there where a small can of coke is $5 - so we shared one like most people up there, Perhaps given the cost of getting up there a small drink could be included (especially since on a fine day with the sun out there is no shade or cover up there and it is absolutely baking hot.
On arrival at floor 56 and stepping out the lift it is 'compulsory' to have your photos taken. When you walk around the other side a member of staff is quickly finding the taken image and sell it to you for another $70SDollars - A right rip-off without asking permission in the first place. Interestingly the roof is arranged that to use the toilets you have to go to the exit. So if you go to the loo on arrival (because you need to) you are immediately pointed to the down elevator. Needless to say we ignored this instruction and went back out again as a 4 min stay seemed a little short. What a stupid design.
The view from the deck is very good but that is all it is - You cannot move around the rest of the deck and get other views and perspectives. It is too expensive and disappointing for what it is , you are treated as being in a sausage machine - take your money and get you up and down as quickly as possible . Avoid

review_text:
It is seen from a distance, as a line stretched between three towers, a footbridge placed on the future. Marina Bay Sands is not a hotel, it is a symbol. A feat of architecture set on the bay, facing the light city of Singapore. We come here for luxury, of course, for elegant rooms, shopping galleries, Michelin-starred restaurants... but what we come looking for, what remains etched in the memory like an explosion of beauty, is the view.
On the 57th floor, everything opens. The sky, the port, the city. There, suspended in the heights, an open-air bar welcomes you. No needless flashing. Luxury here is the altitude, the space, the light. We sit down with a drink in hand — a cocktail with Asian accents, a New World wine, whatever. The main thing is elsewhere: Singapore at your feet.
The bay unfolds like an origami of glass and steel. Below, the Gardens by the Bay gardens draw their futuristic plant forms, huge metal trees pop up like a dream of Miyazaki. Further on, the port rustles with a distant activity, silent from the tops. And all around, the city. Vertical, effervescent, ordered like a giant microprocessor. A world-city, a 21st century city on the move, where nature slips between the towers like a breath. There are crystal-clear greenhouses, bridges, slender buildings, streets lit like arteries.
At night, the panorama becomes a spectacle. The bar turns into a headland on a world of lights. The laser show, the shimmering bay, the reflections... each sip becomes contemplation. We don't talk anymore. Or in a low voice, like in a temple.
Because that is what Marina Bay Sands is all about. A modern sanctuary. A steel and glass cathedral dedicated to the beauty of the world as it is built today. You can feel the power of Asia, the momentum of the future, but also, in the calm of this 57th floor, an unexpected form of peace. The tumult stays down. Up there, the wind grazes faces, the lights flash in the distance, and we understand that traveling is sometimes rising to see better.

review_title: Superior experience at Marina Bay Sands
review_text:
Visiting Marina Bay Sands had always been a lifelong dream of mine – and I finally made it!
Everything was beyond my imagination. I especially loved the infinity pool, the breathtaking view from my room, and the gym! Although the gym has moved from the 55th floor to the third floor of the convention center, it was still an amazing facility.

They had not only treadmills but also a wide variety of weight machines. Since I prefer weight training over running, it perfectly matched my expectations.

I was also incredibly grateful for the support from two lovely staff members, Chanok and Roselyn. They were so kind and helpful – thank you both so much! (Safe travels to Japan!)

Some people might think it’s strange to have a training session in the middle of the day at Marina Bay Sands, but because I truly love working out, having a session in such a special place was unforgettable. I’d definitely love to come back again in the future.

By the way, the scent at the entrance of Marina Bay Sands was absolutely amazing. I’d love to enjoy that same fragrance at home. If any staff member happens to see this and can share the name of the fragrance or perfume used, I’d really appreciate it!

Breakfast at Rise was delicious with so many choices! The rooftop pool was relaxing with the best view! Make sure to go up at Sunset & Sunrise! We chose the garden view room which did not disappoint! He is an asset to Marina Bay Sands & we hope you have the pleasure of his services! We would recommend a stay at MBS to everyone for an experience of a lifetime!

review_text:
Coincided our stay with a trip to the theatre, so location was excellent. Room amazing. Every convenience you can think of and then more. Dyson hairdryer, mobile charger plate, Jo Malone toiletries, Toto toilet, cocktail bar…. Balcony peaceful and private with wonderful views over the gardens and water beyond.
However, the arrival experience was really disappointing. The lobby isn’t really a lobby and is BUSY. You have to remember it’s part of a huge shopping/activity complex so there isn’t the usual relaxing lobby area where you can sit in comfy chairs with a drink and watch the world go by. There’s no separation between hotel guests and the general public. No doorman to greet us and take luggage. Check-in times strictly adhered to, so don’t turn up early. Our specified room wasn’t ready even after check-in time so we were compensated with a free breakfast, which was tasty but I would have still preferred the room to be ready.
Swimming pool is a unique selling point and had been on my bucket list for some time. But it’s BUSY. And whilst I managed a brief swim, most people are there to take selfies and look at the view (both of which I did too) but for extended periods of time, so don’t expect to be able to do lengths. Overall, for the price paid it was a little disappointing but we would stay again if visiting the theatre and wanted just to relax in the room/on the balcony.

review_text:
Absolutely amazing experience at Marine Bay Sounds Spa! My partner and I booked a couple massage with Nelly and Yaneli, and it was one of the best spa treatments we’ve ever had. From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed and made to feel relaxed and comfortable. The ambiance of the spa was tranquil and beautifully set up, creating the perfect environment to unwind.

Nelly and Yaneli are truly talented therapists. They were both incredibly professional, attentive, and skilled in their techniques. They tailored the massage to our individual needs while still maintaining a wonderful synchronized flow throughout the session. The pressure was just right, and they were very intuitive in targeting areas of tension. We left feeling refreshed, relaxed, and completely rejuvenated.

What really stood out was the genuine care and calm energy both Nelly and Yaneli brought to the experience. It didn’t feel rushed or routine — it felt personalized and intentional. I would highly recommend booking a couple massage with them if you’re in the area or staying nearby. We’ll definitely be returning on our next visit. Thank you both for such a memorable and restorative experience! This was five-star service all the way.

review_text:
There were some concerns about the mall/airport/casino/obnoxious influencer vibes that other visitors mentioned, but my party of five wasn't exactly looking for tranquility. With something for everyone, and proximity to the MRT, after some deliberation, I settled on MBS for our three night stay in Singapore.

We arrived well after the appointed check in time, but the room was not yet ready. The receptionist generously granted S$100 credit to use at any hotel restaurant for the delay. She asked if we were celebrating any special occasion. I mentioned it was a family reunion of sorts. She offered a room upgrade to what I think was the Paiza Signature Suite with City View, but our room was much larger than what is described on their website. Truth be told, I was reluctant at first, being that we had two rooms booked with a need for space, but she assured me that this would be special.

We headed off to RISE, and were seated right away. The buffet was outstanding (better than the breakfast), but to elaborate would require a separate review. Within ten minutes, I received a text that the room was ready, so she didn't really have to do all that for such a minor inconvenience, but she did, and hey, we were all better off for it.

Our suite was located in Tower 3. I did feel the airport vibe, but the lobby is just massive, so it's not as if you're maneuvering around people to get to where you're going. We finally got to our room, 4769, and our jaws just dropped. Gleaming marble floors, kitchen island, karaoke room, artwork, sculptures, dining room, living room, bathrooms, wardrobes, toilet seats that automatically go up when you open the door, it was just overwhelming. Words cannot describe. I took about four showers per day, not because I had to, but because I wanted to, and it had nothing to do with the Acqua di Parma toiletries.

The Infinity Pool (valid proper noun status) was downright relaxing, and never crowded. We ate Lavo twice, once dine-in, and once to go. Chilled a couple of times at Ce La Vie, which was ok, but you're better off getting your drink on poolside until 0000. Breakfast at RISE was very crowded. I would advise to get there early. I did check out the casino, but gambling is not my thing, and smoking is permitted, so that was a quick exit.

Admittedly, the fortunate upgrade enhanced my experience beyond all expectations, but in the end, we spent more time outside of the room than in it. The entire structure is impressive, you have the Supertree Grove in the back, fountain show at night, stunning skyline views, and the MRT to whisk you away for further exploration. Don't expect a cozy stay. This hotel is a destination on its own, with its stand tall, in your face, modern luxury amenities and design. To stay here is a treat to the senses.

review_title: A Dream Come True at Marina Bay Sands, Singapore
review_text:
Sometimes, there are hotels you dream of staying in, but they seem just out of reach. During our last vacation, we made one of those dreams a reality, even if just for one night. Our dream was to swim in the world-famous infinity pool on the 57th floor of the iconic Marina Bay Sands hotel. After taking the leap and making the significant investment to check off this bucket list item, our adventure at this remarkable hotel began.

Upon arrival, we were immediately struck by the incredible architecture and sheer scale of the hotel, which was overwhelming in the best way possible. However, due to its massive size, the check-in process felt more like checking in at an airport, with long queues and a less personal experience than we have had at other 5-star hotels. That being said, the reception staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. Our son was immediately offered a treat, and since we were celebrating our 11th wedding anniversary, we were upgraded to a high-floor room with a balcony facing Gardens by the Bay. This upgrade added an extra layer of luxury, as we were able to watch the nightly light show from the comfort of our own room. Additionally, we were given early access to our room before the official check-in time, which was highly convenient, especially when traveling with a small child.

Once we entered the room, we were simply blown away. We have stayed in many beautiful hotels, but the attention to detail in this room was unparalleled. Every inch was thoughtfully designed to exude luxury. The bed was enormous and fitted with exceptionally soft and high-quality linens. The minibar was uniquely integrated into a stunning Chinese-style tea cabinet, adding a touch of elegance. The bathroom was spacious, beautifully designed, and stocked with premium amenities from Jo Loves by Jo Malone—a brand we were unfamiliar with until we looked it up and were amazed by its exclusivity. The amenities even included a pillow mist for relaxation, a delightful touch.

Then came the highlight of our stay: the infinity pool. After taking two elevators to reach the top, we were warmly welcomed with complimentary water and towels. There was plenty of space around the pool, but one drawback was that many adults without children occupied the family-friendly section, making it uncomfortable for families with kids. Unfortunately, some of these guests seemed annoyed by the presence of children playing, despite there being a designated adults-only area, which, ironically, remained mostly empty. It was disappointing and frustrating, as proper signage was in place, but some guests clearly ignored it. Nevertheless, we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the pool, soaking in the breathtaking views. On our first day, with perfect weather, we could even see Malaysia and Indonesia in the distance.

For dining, we had both dinner and breakfast at Rise, the hotel’s restaurant located in the lobby. The dinner experience was excellent, while breakfast, though good, was quite crowded and felt a bit generic compared to other luxury hotels.

Overall, our stay at Marina Bay Sands was truly unforgettable. It was an expensive indulgence, but the experience was worth every penny. From the unparalleled views to the luxurious room and the iconic infinity pool, it was a dream come true. If you’re considering a stay, even for just one night, we highly recommend making it happen—it’s an experience you’ll cherish forever.

Thank you for the best memories.

Grandiose views over the Garden by the Bay and Singapore Strait. Top level service. Every day Resort Dollars credited in the app of Marina Bay Sands which I have been able to spend well by redemption. Lovely use of the infinity pool on top of the building with beautiful views over the Marina Bay, once it is dark fairy lit.

review_text:
It is a very luxurious hotel, but to my regret, there were many people in the hotel. The site is freely accessible to all but the upstairs pool. Even so, for dinner on the sites was crowded. When it came to breakfast, there was an infinite line and we had to wait 30 minutes to be able to have breakfast (that in a hotel of this calibre and having the Premium suite should not happen).

The staff took care of us very well, both waiters and building staff, and let us check out at 12.

The summary is that, if you go as a couple and want something intimate, you will not find it here (all crowded and easy accessibility).

review_title: Pleasantly surprised every step of my short stay
review_text:
Came here as the start to a bucket list solo trip with the infamous infinity pool being a big focus at first.

But that’s where I was surprised in a great way. From the moment I got out of my cab, staff was attentive and welcoming every part of the way.

As I was checking in, there was a minor quip of not having the room I booked available (balcony w Gardens by the Bay view) but it turned out for the better because they gave me a suite instead. Which to be quite honest was beyond my wildest expectations — complete with soaking tub, shower, living room, huge closet area, etc.

The morning after, I woke up early (easier to pull off due to my jet lag) to take advantage of the Infinity pool before sunrise and honestly, it was kind of surreal being nearly solo with that view. It’s also quite the scene to see at golden hour, but it’s definitely more crowded — not uncomfortably so but noticeable. You can also get free access to the SkyPark observation deck from the Tower 3 side if you’re looking for a different view.

The restaurants I went to were solid — both Spago Bar & Spago Dinjng Room, though I recommend booking ahead as slots fill up fast. The best way to describe both is blending European hits with local Singaporean flair.

As for the shops: if luxury is what you want, there’s no shortage there — bring your passport to take advantage of GST refunds.

There’s more I wanted to explore but given short period I stayed there (2 nights), I’ll just have to find my way back there soon.

review_title: Sound Meditation at Marina Bay Sands – A Deeply Resonant Experience
review_text:
I went to Marina Bay Sands early in the morning for a Sound Meditation session--absolutely gorgeous way to set a wonderful mood for the whole day. I found the experience to be one of simple pleasure and relaxation. It allowed me to shift my awareness from the outside world around me into great subtler textures within: calmness, quiet stillness deep inside myself.

The instruments used were handled with such sensitivity and purpose. It wasn’t just an auditory experience, it was something you could feel. The sounds led me right down into a Deep meditative state that felt both grounded and wide open.

If you are in Singapore and you want to experience an ancient teaching of the heart, then I can't speak highly enough about it. A beautiful offering for whomever seeks inward stillness or wants to connect themselves back with the world.

review_title: Morning Sound Meditation on the roof
review_text: I just had the most life altering mediation and sound bath experience on the sky deck led by Karu and Bala. The experience, intuition, and skill that these lovely people shared with us was unparalleled. Having done a few sound baths in my time, nothing has compared to this. I felt like I was going on an inner journey of self love and awareness. Vibrational sound touches your heart and soul in ways that are hard both hard to describe and hard to replicate in everyday life. I came out reminded that we are all so truly blessed to be living this life, in this moment. The universe conspires for our well being. Thank you for the reminder. And thank you Marina Bay Sands for facilitating such a unique and special experience.

review_title: Great hotel with wonderful people who make your stay unforgettable !
review_text:
We had booked a night before returning to Germany at this beautiful hotel. Thanks to a small mishap of the reception we received instead of two rooms a dreamlike beautifully decorated suite with two rooms, two bathrooms, two dressing rooms, shower, bathtub toilet and with an unforgettable view of the Singapore skyline in Tower 3 on the 32nd floor.
WOW ! We were overwhelmed!
The suitcases were brought to the room by Ray, the super friendly and helpful Guest Services agent. He explained everything to us and also gave us some tips for our stay at the hotel.
Thank you Ray for your open-minded and friendly nature !
We will never forget this stay, the great breakfast the next morning and can highly recommend the MBS with its friendly and courteous staff.

review_text:
We booked the most basic room (given the cost), for one night only, for my husbands birthday. We arrived around 11am, and were allowed to access the pool area before our room was ready. At around 1pm we had a text asking us to make our way back to reception as our room was ready. To our amazement, they had upgraded us to an enormous suite, because it was my husband's birthday!

The room had a balcony overlooking the Gardens by the Bay and the sea beyond. It had a huge lounge and a huge bedroom, a walk in wardrobe, a huge bathroom. The room had so many features - things you didn't know you needed until you had them! Two robes each (one thick, one thin), slippers, heated loo seat, walk in shower, chargers built into the bedside tables. Just UNREAL. I worked out that the room we stayed in would have cost us about £1200 a night, had we been paying, and do you know what, I'd say it was actually worth that. Sublime luxury on so many levels. There was a cocktail stand with everything you needed to make several cocktails and so many snacks too. We didn't use these as they were chargeable. They also delivered a cake to the room!

We went to the pool and stayed there for a few hours. The infinity pool is amazing. Also, the beds mostly were double cabana type beds with sunshades which were really comfy. We both had burger and chips at the pool and 2 bottles of wine to share - all very reasonably priced given the location. We had planned to stay at the pool until it closed, but the room was so amazing that we wanted to spend time in it, so we went back there earlier than planned.

Loads of lovely restaurants at the hotel, but we didn't eat at any, because we ate at the pool.

Vast shopping mall underground : beware there is nowhere to sit if you get tired easily. The food mall is good.

Thank you to the hotel for our amazing upgrade!!

review_title: The best hotel I've ever stayed in!
review_text:
Wow wow wow, what an unbelievable experience. We stayed at the hotel recently for 2 nights as part of a holiday.
We arrived into Singapore around 8.30am and although we were not expecting our room to be ready, we were given a key to a shower suite to Freshen up and our luggage was stored for us. We were also given temporary keys in order for us to access the pool and the observation deck.
Both of these were incredible.
The hotel took our details and emailed when the room was ready. The room did not disappoint. A perfect view of the gardens by the bay and everything in the room was spectacular.
The bed was comfy. The room was spotless. The finer details out of this world. And staff who couldn't do enough to help.
Breakfast was included in our stay and the options were plentiful and delicious.
Overall an incredible hotel, would stay again and would recommend to everyone I know. There's a reason it's one of the best in the world and it didn't disappoint. An incredible start to our holiday!

The ambiance of the spa was serene and calming, with soft music and a soothing aroma that immediately set the tone for relaxation. Lisa and Wai Ling was incredibly skilled, attentive to my needs, and made sure to adjust the pressure just right throughout the session. Every knot and tension melted away, and I walked out feeling like a brand-new person. I can't recommend this place enough for anyone in need of some quality self-care and relaxation. I'll definitely be returning soon!"

Receptionist Silver and Avril was very warm and welcoming ! They knowledgeable on what type of service suits me.

review_title: Awesome Room and Amazing Staff Made
review_text:
I admit it... I'm frugal and I mostly stay at inexpensive hotels. My wife, bless her, usually doesn't complain (as long as she doesn't see rodents).

I made an exception for Marina Bay Sands. It was the final night of a three-month tour of Southeast Asia, and I wanted to splurge. I wanted the most iconic building in Singapore. I wanted a view of the Gardens. And I really wanted to swim in the pool from the movie Crazy Rich Asians. This was kind of a "bucket list" item for me.

From the moment we were dropped off, the service was impeccable and exceeded every expectation. Nirmal didn't just help with our bags -- he gave us a suggested itinerary for the evening. Raguvaaran didn't just deliver our bags, he gave us a thorough tour of our room (more on that later) and answered every question. At registration, Ruchelle didn't simply welcome us - she went out of her way to ensure our stay would be memorable. I can't thank her enough.

We were expecting a mini-suite, but our room was larger and nicer than any I've ever experienced: a large living area with a balcony overlooking the Gardens, a huge bedroom with its own balcony, a massive bathroom and a separate vanity. I don't design hotel rooms for a living, but if I did, this is how I'd do it. The attention to detail was evident everywhere: tasteful decoration, flower boxes on the balconies, wireless device charging, a proper bidet, great coffee and tea, delicious chocolates, drapes that automatically open when you enter the room, etc. And the shower was so large, you could have a meeting in there. (Not sure what kind of meeting you'd have in a shower, but still... it was big.)

And yes, we did make it the pool that night after dinner, and the views of the evening city skyline were spectacular. Thanks to the MBS staff -- and especially Ruchelle -- we will never forget our stay. I eagerly look forward to coming back one day.

review_title: Review for Marina Bay Sands Spa – A Truly Rejuvenating Experience
review_text:
My visit to the Marina Bay Sands Spa was absolutely incredible. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted by May, the sweetest and funniest receptionist, who made me feel so welcome. The spa itself exudes luxury and tranquility, with a peaceful ambience that immediately put me at ease.

I had the Thai body massage with Crystal, and she was simply amazing! Her skill, precision, and thoughtfulness made the entire experience deeply relaxing and therapeutic. She knew exactly how to relieve tension while ensuring my comfort throughout the session. I left feeling completely refreshed, both physically and mentally.

Everything about this spa—the impeccable service, the serene atmosphere, and the professionalism of the staff—was top-tier. It was truly one of the best spa experiences I’ve ever had. If you’re looking for a place to unwind and be pampered, I highly recommend the Marina Bay Sands Spa. I will definitely be returning!

review_text:
The iconic Hotel symbol of Singapore, I tell you mine.
Let’s start from the cost , now staying with less than 600 € per night is practically impossible .. I at the time not even five years ago booked with less than half the price ..
The hotel is gigantic are three inhuman towers with attached and connected any type of structure , to be clear there is a shopping center so luxurious and so large that ours in Italy in comparison are closets😂, the thing that struck me is the impressive casino the volume of people entering already from the afternoon at 18 ..
The pool on the 59th floor is only accessible for us or guests and honestly I was a bit disappointed. I imagined more luxury ..
The room is nothing that breakfast I did not use and the bridge desk on the 60th floor is great for an aperitif (50 € upwards) but in the end it is all scene this hotel
Great location in front of the gardens next to the museum and certainly in the most beautiful area of Singapore
Completely touristy

review_text:
WOW!!! just go here....nowhere else will compare. Yes all the hype and the price is so worth it. We stayed for 2 nights and firstly the room facing the Gardens by the Bay was breathtaking. The bathroom is fully equipped with everything you need, robes, slippers (luxury), huge bath with bath salts, all the sanitary items are in abundance, separate shower with huge overhead shower and also a separate hand held shower head. The toilet is top spec and it opens, flushes and closes automatically.
We had an upgraded room with a huge TV, cocktail cabinet, two huge beds and a balcony area to sit at and watch the light show.
There are built in charging plates at the side of the bed for your phone and the curtains open and close at the touch of a switch.
Our luggage was brought to our room and we just had to ring reception when we needed the bellboy to bring our luggage to check out when we were leaving.
Breakfast in the Mitchelin star restaurant Spago was excellent each morning. This was A La Carte service and the eggs and coffee were on point.
The infinity pool was breathtaking and the service given by the staff was 5 star and above!
Don't hesitate to book!

review_title: You will have the best experience of your life!
review_text:
We stayed here for one night on February 13, 2025 to celebrate my daughter's employment.

I am very satisfied.

I was impressed by the wonderful view and hospitality. It was the most memorable place and experience in Singapore.

The front desk recognized that it was a job celebration and tried to provide a room as comfortable as possible on the spot. As a result, we were assigned a wonderful room on a high floor. My daughter was very happy, and I was also impressed by the front desk's response.

We also enjoyed the legendary infinity pool. I was excited to be able to see a magnificent view from any spot in the pool.

I ordered room service in the evening. The quality of the food was very satisfactory. I was also impressed by the polite and prompt service of the staff who served the food.

I stayed here for about 10 days to visit Singapore, and my stay here was the best memory.

I would like to visit again with my wife next time. Thank you very much.

review_text:
We booked one night in Singapore at the end of our trip around Asia as a special treat before returning home. On arrival we were made to feel very welcome. On discovering this was the last night of our trip the member of staff on Reception, Alex, very kindly looked through the system and arranged for us to receive a courtesy upgrade. Upon arriving in our room we were blown away to discover we were in fact in one of the very best suites on the 54th floor in tower one! I have never seen or stayed in a hotel room as luxurious as this ever! It wasn’t just a room it was the size of an apartment.

Everywhere we went within the hotel we were made to feel respected and special and we also received a celebration cake delivered to our room. It really did make for an amazing ending to a special trip celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary.

Thank you so much Alex and Marina Bay Sands, it is an experience we will never forget.

review_title: Singapore well worth going back to.
review_text:
Staying at the MBS hotel is a must when visiting Singapore. It's close to many attractions including the biggest shopping I have come across to date. Complimentary breakfast at the Rise and afternoon Teas at the Club are all good experiences in flavouring different types of foods. I enjoyed the infinity pool at the top with the hot jacuzzi to relax my muscles after sightseeing all day. Sentosa Island is worth visiting on the Cable Car. A couple round trip is around £42. Taxis around the island will be no mare than £15. I booked the Garden Bay room with 2 balconies and the views were lovely. The room itself was very spacious with a relaxing lounge area.
I will be vising Singapore again, probably next year!

review_text:
My stay at Marina Bay Sands was nothing short of exceptional. It’s difficult to fully capture just how outstanding this hotel is—truly a 10 out of 10. From the impeccable service and warm welcome to the exquisite dining options, every aspect of my experience exceeded expectations.

I opted for the transportation service to and from the airport, which was superb. Our driver not only ensured a smooth and comfortable ride but also shared fascinating bits of history about the city. Upon arrival, our premium service host greeted us with a genuine smile and escorted us to our stunning room, offering a breathtaking view of the city. She took the time to thoroughly explain all the room’s features and the hotel’s amenities.

Every experience, from the iconic Infinity Pool to the exceptional dining, was flawless. The staff went above and beyond to make me feel special, especially since I was celebrating a birthday, and I truly felt treated like royalty.

For anyone visiting Singapore, Marina Bay Sands is the ultimate place to stay. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a luxury experience.

review_text:
This was our 2nd time at MBS and it doesn’t disappoint in the slightest. From the luxurious rooms with killer views of Gardens By The Bay to the magnificent Infinity Pool on the roof to the incredible service, this is the place we’ll keep coming back to in Singapore.

Absolutely nothing is too hard for a guest. All staff go above and beyond. However, we must signal out Nur Bella, the concierge, who spent literally hours trying to find just the right charm for my wife’s charm bracelet. Now, that’s terrific service. Thank you so very much Bella.

We’ll be in Singapore soon and as far as we’re concerned, there’s nowhere else to stay.

review_title: Marina Bay Sands of Good and Bad...
review_text:
The room was in perfect condition.

When I used the pool in the middle of the night, my hands became greasy and sticky from the moment I got into the water, but the next morning the water quality was amazingly improved and I was able to swim very comfortably

I was relieved to learn that there was a Japanese staff member after I had done some rough errands at the check-in of Tower 1, and at the same time I felt that from the beginning it would have been nice if there was enough service for Japanese tourists to be attended to by a Japanese staff.

I asked for a return airport because it was a plan with a transfer, but I was surprised to find 90S��� on the slip at checkout

I explained it to the Singlish staff, who had difficulty hearing, and the staff checked with their boss several times, and I was relieved when I finally signed it

Also, I was allowed to use the infinity pool again with a temporary card after checkout, but there was only one shower in one corner of the toilet where everything would get wet, and there was no place to dress or change
Others were encouraged by the cleaning staff to change in the toilets, and I felt sorry for them.

I was disappointed in the hospitality that the name of the five-star hotel cries for.

review_text:
We celebrated our anniversary at this hotel. Everything but really everything about this hotel is extra category! The service, quality, rooms are phenomenal. What a pleasure to be allowed to stay in such a hotel. We said it was our anniversary and we got a room like we've never experienced before with a fantastic view of Gardens by the Bay.
The pool on the top floor is more and better than you can imagine. And breakfast.. Never seen so much fresh and good quality stuff put together.
And then the service, extremely friendly.
It is not your standard hotel in terms of price but you get an absolutely unique experience in return.

review_title: A night to have experienced it once
review_text:
We stayed here for one night and had booked a Deluxe Room with balcony overlooking Garden of the Bay. Our room was in Tower 1, on the 31. Floor very large and very, very nice and top furnished. We were very positively surprised. The pool is of course the place to be here and open from 06.00-00.00. There is an only adults area where it is much quieter. The water temperature is very cool, the view of course phenomenal. We ate dinner in the restaurant Ce la vie that food and service here were phenomenal.
Check in and check out - queuing in long line as at the airport for such a hotel very inappropriate. Service in the restaurant in the pool area and at the Italian significantly expandable in friendliness and speed.
All in all - it was a very nice day here, one night was enough for us, then it was experienced and seen.

review_text:
The whole Marina Bay Sands complex is huge, we visited the shopping centre and observation deck. The shopping centre has a wide range of shops and excellent food court. We bought tickets in advance for the observation deck, but the staff were very helpful and let us up early as we'd arrived before our time slot. The views over Singapore were amazing!
I would recommend visiting early in the morning or in the evening as there isn't any shade unless you have access to the pool area or eat in the restaurant.

review_title: The best hotel I’ve ever stayed at.
review_text: Absolutely the best/ most luxurious hotel we’ve ever stayed in ( 2 adults x 1 child). We had Eunice guide us to our room and give us a run through all the features of our stay, she was so sweet and even sang us a lovely song. I even had a lovely surprise bouquet of flowers and wine delivered to my room for my birthday all organised by Eunice, the nicest surprise I’ve ever received. We only stayed there for 2 nights but I wish it was for my whole 8 days in Singapore. Everywhere we looked it was new surprises and features of the hotel and room we didn’t see earlier. I can’t fit all my amazements into a review, it would go on forever. I highly recommend staying here if you can afford the splurge. The buffet breakfast at the Rise, had all the options you could want (bacon, eggs, cereal, yoghurts, fruits and international styles of food too, Arabic, Chinese and Indian). The restaurant we ate dinner at was Lavo (Italian) book in advance, it was delicious, my husband’s Italian and he was very pleased with the lasagne. Again I could go on and on. Special thanks to Eunice for making our family stay the best we’ve ever had.

review_title: Best massage I have ever received
review_text:
Here’s a more elaborate version of your review:

This was, without a doubt, the best massage I have ever received! From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and at ease. Wai Ling took exceptional care of me, ensuring that every detail was perfect. Her technique was nothing short of extraordinary—every movement was intentional, every touch was soothing, and she seemed to know exactly what my body needed.

I have never felt such deep relaxation before. It was as if all the tension I had been carrying melted away with each passing minute. The pressure was perfect, the ambiance was serene, and the entire experience felt like a true escape from reality.

By the time the session ended, I could hardly believe how rejuvenated I felt. It was pure bliss from start to finish. If you’re looking for a massage that transcends expectations and leaves you feeling completely renewed, I cannot recommend Wai Ling enough. Absolutely incredible!

review_title: Luxury for those who need it :)
review_text:
This is an excellent hotel for those wishing a premium hotel experience. Our family was lucky enough to score a free upgrade from our original 2 rooms we booked, to a Paiza Signature Suite (2-Bedroom) - City View in Tower 3. This was really a next-level experience for us.
The attention to detail was fantastic in this room, as well as the shear sqm on offer. 2 bedrooms with ensuites, huge living area with lounge and dining and kitchen facilities. The massage chair was also a hit after a long day seeing the sights. We didn't use the separate audiovisual room with the karaoke machine, but I would imagine some people would.
If you have a lot of money burning a hole in your pocket that you simply must relieve yourself of, then the boutique shopping of the Marina Bay Sands "Shoppes" is within a 10 minute walk and you can find yourself most anything you would like. But this is not a "budget" shopping experience.
The hotel is also very close to the Marina Bay Gardens.
But for us, the best part of this hotel was the unfettered access you have to the roof top infinity pool. Lounging in and by this pool and its heated Jacuzzis scatted around the deck, brings home the engineering marvel this building is. A superb surreal experience.

review_title: The best hotel we have stayed in
review_text:
This hotel is absolutely amazing and we both agreed it was the best room we have ever stayed in. We booked one night here as it’s expensive and we wanted to tick it off the bucket list. We paid £400 for the one night which was the cheapest room. We arrived quite early as our plan was to drop our bags and do the cloud forest / flower dome whilst we waited to check in however they congratulated us on our honeymoon and allowed us to check in straight away . I believe we got an upgrade as we had gardens by the bay view and a cake was sent to our room also. Lovely gestures by the hotel. The room was stunning with a huge bed and HUGE tv. There was beautiful pink flowers growing on the balcony . We weren’t that high up so we had a pretty direct view of gardens by the bay right outside the window. The mini bar was stocked with complimentary drinks. We spent the majority of the time at the pool which is incredible. I stayed there until it closed at midnight and got back up for the pool opening at 6am where I watched the sunrise and had breakfast . I would love to come back and stay for longer.
We booked directly with the hotel which gives you back some resort dollars which I then used to buy things in the bath and body works downstairs in the mall area.

review_title: Thoughtful luxury in the most fabulous location!
review_text: I debated long and hard to splurge on a stay at MBS - so glad I did!! We arrived in Singapore from the US in the morning and were able to drop our bags off the hotel and hit the ground running! Location, location, location! So close to Gardens by the Bay, the MRT, shops, restaurants. Lau Pa Sat and Merlion Park are 10-15 min walks. It made it so easy not to have to sort out details on jet lag and little sleep. The stay was the start of our trip to celebrate our daughter’s college graduation and my husband’s 70th birthday. The hotel kindly and thoughtfully upgraded us to a view of the GBTB and left a birthday cake in our room! We loved seeing the light show up-close at the park and then from our room. The room itself is really wonderfully designed, the curtains open when you walk in, the bathroom is spacious, smart lighting guides you at night to the WC. We had access to the pool (and went both days) without needing to make a reservation (perhaps b/c it was rainy season??) and it wasn’t crowded at all. We had delicious cocktails and appetizers at Spago (all the employees we asked recommended Spago over Ce La Vie) and you feel like one of the beautiful people (JK!). Do make a reservation. The staff was kind and helpful. Be sure to sign up for the VIP program for discounts back. I wouldn’t go into debt to stay here, but if you can afford it, it really is lovely and memorable and helps maximize enjoyment of a quick visit to Singapore.

Life should stay overnight.

Breakfast we had in the roof terrace restaurant. We had reservations. Unfortunately we had to queue like everyone else (without reservation). There is only one queue, which I just overtook.
A breakfast à l carte for 120.- francs / euro, we also never had. And for example, the orange juice was not of good quality and was still stretched with ice. The other was good, unfortunately did not come together, but was ok.
There is taxi rank in front of the hotel, with queue. Since we had to get to the airport, we took Uber as there was no happy taxi for 15 minutes. Thanks to the nice concierge who organized this for us.
Attention: organize the transfer early.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands was the place we chose to spend our last three days after our wonderful vacation in Bali. And once again, I congratulate myself on this choice.
Needless to say, the hotel's architecture is impressive. But that would be nothing compared to the impeccable service provided by the people who bring it to life.

The most unexpected and pleasant surprise we experienced was an upgrade to an incredible suite in Tower 2, recently renovated, all because our room wasn’t ready yet, even though it was past 4 PM. The moment we stepped into the suite, any trace of fatigue disappeared. Everything is tastefully decorated, the spaces are extremely generous, and the view from the windows is breathtaking—you truly feel like a VIP.

The food served in the hotel's restaurants is delicious and diverse, catering to all tastes.

Gardens by the Bay is an irresistible attraction, accessible right from the hotel lobby.

The pool on the 57th floor is truly a place where you are treated at the highest level—both literally and figuratively.

I don’t think we could have ended a memorable vacation in a better way than by choosing Marina Bay Sands.

review_title: Why did you delete my review? And good facilities but bad services
review_text:
My friend and I were staying for 3 nights in this hotel to attend an activity nearby in Nov 2022. At first we were fascinated by how modern and grand everything in this hotel looked, but its services later turned out to be a real nightmare.

The first night started with a disturbing sound from 2:30am for every 5-minute interval arising by the pressure from the pipe system. After 15-20 minutes we could not stand with the noise and decided to call for a check. A technician then came to our room, inspected and asked if we want a room change we should call the front desk on our own, so we explained everything to the reception, but we were offered a downgrade without any compensation or had to wait until the morning for their management team to get back to work. We turned down this unacceptable offer and asked them to reply as soon as possible BUT NOT UNTIL THE MORNING. Half an hour later we were given a same grade of room, with card keys delivered to our new room and our stay extended to 2pm on our last day. Why would such a 5-star hotel have no 24-hour management for emergency situations?

On the next day we were pleasantly surprised they delivered some great truffle chocolates and a bottle of champagne for the inconvenience caused. However on the last day, after we finished relaxing at the fascinating infinity pool on the top floor at 12pm, our card keys stopped working, and after lining up at the lobby with our swimwear to find out what happened, we figured out the card keys worked until 12pm but not 2 as promised. The reception lady named Adele claimed we should approach them for an extension. How in the world will the customers understand THE WAY YOUR SYSTEM WORKS?????? Why are not the card keys being delivered to our room???? Or a note saying our cards should be replaced????

By the time we checked in, we were told that the amounts we spent in Marina Bay Sands hotel mall could be accumulated as points, which can be used to reduce our room price when we check out. However by the checkout time, the same lady Adele decided to settle the payment as quick as she could without even bother asking whether we had any points available. It was not until we raised out how our points could be utilized, she then realized we had points to use. She even urged us to spend more on the hotel shops before even trying to void the invoice so that, we believe, she did not bear any responsibility for her mistakes. However we of course refused to spend further and eventually got our points deducted from the room price by her manager with the previous settlement voided.

We had to say the facilities in the hotels are awesome, including the gym, sauna, steam bath, restaurants, and especially the infinity pool. The rooms are flawlessly clean. However we were very disappointed with this terrible experience happening in a 5-star hotel as an icon of Singapore. The services seriously need intense improvement.

P.S. I am reposting this review now after being horrified by the fact that this review has been deleted by the request of this hotel, when I believe this review should stay to have the management reflect what they are doing.

However I found the bed too soft, and the aircon too drying, but just a personal preference.

The fitness centre is at the convention centre and is very spacious and well equipped. I had a wonderful time there, and headphones were provided too, that can be paired with the machines for various workout sessions. The 2 staff on duty at about 6pm were very friendly and helpful. One of them helped me connect the headphones which had a bit of an issue.
The free beverages provided were wonderful too; coffee and tea, fruit infused water and green apples. Personal trainer available upon request at $120/hr. The view while working out was good too.

The hotel offers all amenities and luxury. The rooms are decorated in a British-conservative style, paying attention to the small details.
The service is accordingly professional. The location is very good. The hotel and surroundings are basically its own neighborhood with park and shopping mall, restaurants and casino.
It is about 800-1000 meters on foot to the city center, so about 15 minutes walk along the promenade of the marina.

review_text:
What a magnificent Hotel. Such Opulence!!
We stayed 2 magical nights!
During our stay, there were renovations in our tower, which disrupted our peace, we mentioned this to the Concierge/Manager who immediately m8ved us to a room that the disruptions were minimal. She also offered complimentary breakfast & dinner for our inconvenience. Wow that's wonderful service & very kind and it made our stay even more brilliant.
This Hotel oozes opulence, it's classy, tasteful & glamorous!
We overlooked the Gardens & the views were beautiful!
The staff were amazing, very friendly & accommodating.
Yes the pool area is beyond magnificent & breathtaking!!!
We swam at 5am and had the pool & views to ourselves. First guests started arriving around 5.30am/6am. Those first 30mins were out of this world, like a dream, like floating in the sky!!
The rooftop viewing area is stunning!
Breakfast buffet options were absolutely delicious & dinner too.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, it was a splurge worth every single cent!!

review_title: Terrible experience by staff at the pool
review_text:
We spent 4 days 3 nights at Mbs from 24th Dec.
Rooms as usual were amazing, counter staff were all courteous and polite.
We were fortunate to attend 2 yoga classes by Bala in the morning and we highly recommend it. He is super passionate and we could feel it it's infectious. If I could rate the experience with Bala its a solid 10/10.

Very unfortunately our entire experience was let down at the pool on 26th morning.
On the 25th morning we went to the pool as quite a big group (we had 4 rooms) and only a few of us tapped in with no issues.
On the 26th , we were stopped by Sandra and her colleague. My sister and a few went ahead first and when I reached with my baby and helper, along with my family. I tapped in my card wanting to enter but was stopped because we were told guests strictly require a card each to enter. What went horribly wrong and distasteful was how this message was delivered. In fact Sandra asked us ' who let you all in yesterday?' I of course couldn't remember who would. When I told her I couldn't she went on asking ' what is their name.. is it one man one woman or 2 women..' a few times... Seriously is it my responsibility to remember who let us in the day before? I felt I was being interrogated??? Ironically in a 5 star hotel. She was exceptionally rude, along with the aunty colleague. My sister who was helplessly standing said when she tried to explain they added a bed so they only had 2 cards instead of 3. The aunty told her ' add bed is bed add card is card'

Objectively speaking, Sandra and aunty did a great job upholding the hotel policy but we are not objects. If the delivery was done better we understand. We truly respect the policy. But not in a tone where we were being doubted like overstayer or non hotel guests!

Can you imagine going to a Michelin restaurant served a wonderful dish but you spotted a fly in it. The whole experience was entirely ruined.

I remember Sandra kept asking for her colleagues names but I recommend your team to check cctv. Also, thanks to her, I only remember names who provided excellent and atrocious service.

review_title: A Once-in-a-Lifetime Stay at Marina Bay Sands – More Than Just Luxury, It’s the People That Make It Special.
review_text:
Our visit to Marina Bay Sands Singapore was meant to be a special trip for our beloved Dad’s 77th birthday—a celebration we had saved up for as a simple, middle-class family wanting to give him an unforgettable experience. We arrived in Singapore excited but never imagined the overwhelming kindness and generosity that would come our way.

From the moment we stepped out of our cab, we were greeted by warm smiles from the doormen and porters, instantly making us feel welcome. However, what truly left us speechless was Khai at the front desk, who, with kindness and generosity, upgraded us from a suite to the stunning Merlion Suite. We were already feeling a little out of place in such a luxurious setting, but his hospitality and grace reassured us that we were valued guests.

Then came Robby from Premium Services—a man with wit, intellect, kindness, and a heart of gold. He not only ensured we had access to every incredible perk of the Merlion Suite—from indulgent breakfasts and delightful lunches to afternoon cocktails—but also went the extra mile to arrange two limousines to take our entire family (and our many bags) to the airport. His generosity and warmth left us humbled and, at times, even embarrassed by the sheer level of attention we received.

And then there were Justine and Arabella, who truly made us feel like VIPs. Not only did they escort us through check-in at the airport, but they also stayed with us until every bag was checked, every detail was taken care of, and our flights were confirmed. Their level of dedication was something we had never experienced before, and it was done with genuine kindness and care.

We came for the pool, like many do, but we left knowing that the greatest strength of Marina Bay Sands isn’t just its world-class amenities—it’s its people. Every member of the team we encountered was meticulously screened and trained, yet it was their genuine warmth and sincerity that made all the difference.

We never expected to be treated like royalty—we felt out of place, undeserving, and overwhelmed—but the entire staff at MBS treated us with such care and respect that we will forever be grateful. This trip was supposed to be a gift for our Dad, but in the end, we were the ones who received a gift—the experience of a lifetime, filled with kindness, generosity, and memories we will cherish forever.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you, Marina Bay Sands, for making us feel like we belonged, even when we thought we didn’t. We will never forget this.

review_title: Outstanding Gym with great view in MBS
review_text:
Gym Review

This gym is truly outstanding! It’s exceptionally clean and well-maintained, providing a welcoming environment for all fitness enthusiasts. The equipment is of the highest quality, catering to both cardio and strength training needs.

They offer a great variety of machines and free weights, along with TRX equipment for functional training. For recovery, they even provide massage guns, which is such a thoughtful addition.

Overall, it’s a fantastic place to work out with everything you need for a complete fitness experience. Highly recommended!

Uma was a Great Host.

As soon as we used the sink everything was clogged, we warned and they fixed it.
Then we took advantage of the shower , unfortunately the room was completely flooded .
Enraged we went down to the lobby to make our due representations.
For these mishaps we were upgraded in the attic on the top floor.
A pool table 2 jacuzzis , a printed 5 televisions , 3 double beds , we found ourselves catapulted into a room (apartment) of a thousand one nights , with a breathtaking view .
Sometimes bad luck serves to appreciate even more beautiful things.

All in all, the kids and adults were very happy to stay at Marina Bay Sands and we missed her already before we left! Great food and beautiful people! Regret only booking one night! But we'll definitely be back!

I also got upgraded to a garden view and a higher up room so to say I was excited is an understatement. The room was of course amazing. The only issue was the bath water was cold and wouldn't run warm. However, I didn't contact the staff as I was only there one night and it was already quite late.

review_text: I surprised my husband with a sunrise sound meditation experience on the top of the Marina Bay Sands with Karu and Bala. We had such an incredible grounding meditation with the guided breathwork and the sounds played. Karu and Bala hold a wealth of knowledge about sound, and how we can use its vibrations to ground ourselves from our busy daily lives. After the session, we both felt ourselves feeling more connected and in-tune with ourselves and our surroundings. They offered to teach us more about their plethora of instruments after the session and gave everyone a sound bath as well. The frequencies, vibrations and tones were felt throughout our nervous system, promoting improved moods and relaxed bodies. It was such a perfect morning, and it was even more special that we were able to do this at the top of the beautiful Marina Bay Sands.

One thing I would suggest is that if there would be 2 staff in a room, they should both know the language the customer is more comfortable speaking. Sherly was very polite and kind as well. Although she didn’t know Chinese, it was still so fun to go through this experience with her. Helping my mom go through this amazing experience as well.
Thank you for providing us with snacks! I love them! 😍

We recently stayed at MBS and it was spectacular. The room, the staff, the views, the infinity pool.. truly exceptional and a total dream come true!

This hotel is incomparable.

Of course the premesis is amazing. But beyond that, so are the staff.

Jason at checkin treated us like family and was so kind. He did such a fantastic job and secured a gorgeous suite for our stay and we were all beyond delighted by the extremely luxe experience!

Ryan at the pool was so friendly and welcoming and looked out for me and my energetic boys. Very enjoyable chatting with him.

We dined poolside the first night and the food and drinks were terrific, while we enjoyed the view/ambiance as the sun set.

I highly recommend this property and our stay here was truly the highlight of our Singapore trip! Definitely a core memory for me and my family. So grateful to everyone there who created this exceptional unparalleled experience for us!

The staff were attentive and went above and beyond at every opportunity. The dining at the resort is terrific, having been in Asia two weeks before we got to Marina Bay Sands the cafe Origin + Bloom was terrific for coffee and a snack, easily the best coffee I had in Asia, tip for those from Melbourne Australia, the piccolo on the menu is essentially a double shot latter, was extraordinarily good.
We will be back without a doubt.

review_text:
If you’re looking for a yoga session that combines serenity, expert guidance, and a stunning backdrop, this is it! Highly recommended for the best experience, this yoga session truly stands out. From the moment you arrive, the breathtaking view sets the tone for a deeply rejuvenating practice. Whether it’s a sunrise session with warm golden rays or an evening class under a sky painted with hues of orange and purple, the scenery elevates the experience to a whole new level.

The instructor Mr.Bala is incredibly skilled, ensuring a session that caters to all levels, whether you’re a beginner or an advanced practitioner. Their calming demeanor and precise instructions make it easy to connect with your breath and body while soaking in the beauty around you.

What makes this experience truly unique is how the surroundings complement the practice. The natural beauty provides a sense of calm and inspiration that enhances mindfulness and relaxation. You leave the session feeling not only physically stretched and strengthened but also mentally refreshed and at peace.

If you’re seeking a yoga experience that nourishes both the mind and body, look no further. This is an unforgettable blend of movement, mindfulness, and nature’s beauty. Highly recommended!

review_title: Best Family Suite in the World
review_text: Family of 4 (2 young kids) stayed during 1 night layover in Singapore. Beautiful hotel and the newly renovated 2 bedroom Paiza Family Suite we stayed in was truly incredible!! The nicest suite we’ve ever stayed in during all of our travels around the world. They thought of everything! Everything from a Nintendo Switch in the kids bunk room to a full body massage chair in the private office off the master bedroom. We mentioned during booking that it was our anniversary and they unexpectedly delivered a chocolate cake to us in the evening. The rooftop pool lives up to its reputation and didn’t seem crowded due to its huge size. We went in the day and night and both unique memorable experiences. Perfect water temperature. And s few hot tubs as well if you get cold in the evening. Will be difficult for us to ever top our experience at the Marina Bay Sands!

review_text:
This hotel is of course iconic due to the fantastic rooftops and infinity pool. The location is nice and the surroundings are spectacular.
With 2000 rooms this is a factory, but quite frankly, basic some hotel services are not great. Check-in takes too long and was a hassle, while for breakfast I found myself in a line every morning. The procedure to be seated is strangely bureaucratic and is guest unfriendly. This can be much better for this hotel.
Restaurants are good but overpriced. You pay for the view, rather than the food itself. CeLaVi was for us the best.
Rooms are honestly great, everything you can wish for is available. Design is good and super efficiently organized. The bed and mattress are excellent. So I have mixed feelings after this stay.

review_text:
What can I say about Marina Bay Sands that hasn’t already been said. Although I am going back a while now, I still remember our stay there as clear as yesterday.
We walked into a very busy hotel lobby and were immediately checked in. The staff from beginning to end were exceptionally helpful and polite. We did not have to queue as we were given a private room to check in and have our bags taken up. Effortless! The staff seemed to add lots of little details as I had made them aware it was my partners birthday. The room was immaculate, comfortable and very very clean. The bathroom was clean and the shower was…….fun!
The views over the bay and city were breathtaking through the floor to ceiling windows. You really could not ask for more especially when the light and firework show came on over the bay.
The infinity pool on the top floor is obviously a sight, but I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to get a lounger. Singapore is very humid, so I was expecting the pool to be busy in a Saturday night but it’s huge so there really is plenty of room for all.
The Marina Bay Sands hotel is an experience. It throws lavishness and opulence at you without any grace or style. That’s not a bad thing. It’s the type of place that looks great for influencers and the YouTube generation which is where we are now. There is no space for toning things down. If you’ve just got the money and want to impress a first weekend date, this place is ostentatious enough to fully meet your needs.
It scores a top spot for us because we only wanted to stay here a couple of nights to end our 2 week holiday in opulence. And for those 2 nights it was perfect.

review_title: Amazing Staff & Top Notch Hotel Amenities
review_text:
Our family of 6 was fortunate enough to stay at the amazing 2 bedroom suite which offered views of the city and Gardens by the Bay. The suite was perfect and felt like it came out of a dream! Every detail was masterfully designed in our room! The Tea settings, spa bath supplies, endless supply of Voss water, various choices of tea, coffee and all other cocktail & alcohol we can think of. We chose to buy a selection of food items at the MBS Food Hall and eat dinner at the fully appointed dining room in our suite. We had all the supplies needed for a dinner party and all was perfect. The Guest Services team provided everything we needed within 5- 10 minutes of us requesting.

Fitness Services : It rained lightly in the morning so our Meditation class was cancelled. Although they were delayed in communicating the class status with us, the MBS Personal Trainer, Oddie, was kind enough to bring us to the Sky Deck for pictures. It would be great if MBS could have alternate venues for their Meditation Class - somewhere indoors in the hotel to allow guests to still get this activity done.

Since we were checking out that day, Paula, from the front desk arranged for our shower room later in the day and gave us clear instructions on how to get the best out of our pool day.

Juan from the Bell Desk took care of our arrival & departure needs and made sure our 14 bags got to where they needed to be. The Paiza residence experience is unreal! We still dream about Marina Bay Sands and look forward to returning for the 4th time!!!
