review_title: A unique experience at Marina Bay Sands: the ultimate in luxury and charm
review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is, without doubt, the most beautiful and suggestive hotel I have ever stayed in. Aesthetically wonderful and majestic, it manages to perfectly combine its imposing size with an impeccable organization.
The room was spacious, elegant, bright and equipped with every possible comfort. From breathtaking views to details such as full toiletries (toothbrush, soaps, shampoos, creams, bathrobe, slippers, etc.), to luxury amenities: a 75-inch TV, wireless charger, coffee machine, minibar and cocktails available, snacks, and even a heated toilet with automatic bidet. Nothing was missing.
The infinity pool on the 57th floor is the flagship of the hotel: indescribable, exciting, breathtaking. An experience that alone is worth the stay.
All the operators were extremely kind and professional, and the reception was always helpful and efficient, despite the management of over 2000 rooms.
The hotel is also home to several top-notch restaurants, offering a variety of options that complement the luxury experience.
What about it? It was a 10 and praise experience. Yes, it is an expensive hotel, but for such a unique stay it is absolutely worth it. Hope to return soon!

review_text:
Great experience. Instructor Vikram is great. Very helpful and experienced . I can confidently say he is one of the best yoga instructors I've ever come across. His deep knowledge of yoga practices, combined with a compassionate and tailored approach, creates an enriching and transformative experience for every student.

He emphasises proper alignment and breathing techniques, which not only enhance the practice but also significantly improve overall well-being.
Their classes strike a perfect balance between physical challenge and mental relaxation. He takes the time to understand individual goals and limitations, offering modifications and encouragement to help everyone progress at their own pace.

review_text:
Many choose the Sands for its iconic statue, a chance to take a dip in the infinity pool, easy access to Garden by and Bay and of course, high end shopping, and we are no exception. One can easily mistaken for a hotel in Vegas when stepping into the lobby (and, within the shopping mall) , but those looking for tranquility would probably not select the Sands. The newly renovated premiere suite offers a stunning view over the bay and the Straits. The room is beautifully laid out and appointed, and the state of the art Television can be addictive for bedtime watching. The suite is spacious, airy and brightly lit, with 2 lovely balconies adjacent to the living room and the bedroom. All the modern amenities associated with a 5 star hotel are presented.
The premiere suite comes with premium services that include transfer to and from the hotel, meet and greet on arrival and departure, check in and out are administered in the suite which were highly helpful considering the crowds arriving and departing. The premiere suite also allows access to the club (similar to executive lounge) which, was probably the most disappointing aspect of the stay, as on the 2 occasions that we tried to gain entry (one at around 5pm and the other at around 0930 am), the wait time has been more than one hour, and for anyone trying to have breakfast, make sure that you get in before 8am, otherwise, the wait can easily be anytime between 60-90 minutes. Our stay was over the weekend so perhaps that could be a contributing reason for such long wait, in the end, we did not manage to get any breakfast nor access to the lounge. The other slightly annoying factor is that the hotel lobby provides access to the mall, skypark, and Garden by the Bay (and of course the Casino), so it is swamped by visitors, therefore trying to get help from the staff in the lobby can be tricky, as they cannot differentiate between hotel guests or visitors. All being said, it is nonetheless a worthy stay.

review_title: Truly a home away from home
review_text:
A BIG BIG thank you to Charmaine and her teammates for making our stay totally AWESOME!!!!

They have worked tirelessly to ensure everything went smoothly and as requested…. Going way out to get a gift for our little boy who turned 4 on 27th Nov. 😀

The rooms and amenities were fabulous… beds were luscious to sleep in… and the birthday boy had a wonderful time playing in the bath tub…

Special mention to Pauline who welcomed us and suggested to have a baby crib put into our room so our 4mth old baby could have a gd nites rest instead of squeezing with us on the king bed 😆

And special mention to the team at premium services that responded on time every time they were texted with an enquiry.

Such response time and service is intimate and made all of us feel welcomed in our home away from home.

This experience you’ve given our family was once in a lifetime and have raised the bar in terms of expectations when I next travel and visit other hotels in the world.

MBS with your team will always remain the benchmark of service I will expect in future from other hoteliers 👍👍

I only have praises for your team and you may share this with them to let them know they have done well and to keep it up 👍👍

review_text:
By any standard, this is an exceptional five star experience. From the moment we were collected at the airport by MBS limo and dropped back off there, everything in between was absolutely superb.

From the rooms - absolute and complete luxury, with every possible considered little touch - to the fantastic pool, an excellent breakfast at Rise each morning, we were thrilled that MBS lived up go - and surpassed - our expectations at every opportunity.

Shout out to April in Premium Services for going above and beyond to make our trip extra special. We are very thankful!

We have been to many, many five star hotels around the globe but MBS has to sit at the top for us. Unrivalled luxury and bespoke service. We can’t wait to return at some point when we’re next in Singapore!

review_text:
We stayed in the Family Suite at Marina Bay Sands for our 16th wedding anniversary, and it was a celebration to remember. The suite was spacious, luxurious, and perfect for families, with entertainment for the kids and stunning views of Gardens by the Bay.

The infinity pool was a highlight—floating above the city skyline with panoramic views was simply breathtaking. The buffet breakfast was equally impressive, offering the largest and most diverse selection of food we’ve ever seen.

A special mention goes to Pauline from the Premium Services team, who made our stay extraordinary. From arranging anniversary surprises to dinner reservations and transfers, her thoughtful service made us feel so celebrated.

This was an unforgettable experience, and we can’t wait to return. Highly recommended for anyone seeking luxury and exceptional service!

review_title: Holiday we didn't want to end
review_text:
The service at Marina Bay Sands was second to none, from the airport pickup, check in at our suite to express check out
and complimentary transfer return to airport. MBS staff met us at the airport and on return helped our check-in and showed us how to get to the Jewel. The hotel is stunning, the room was spotless and the service provided was flawless, the bed was comfortable, the breakfast had an amazing selection. The infinity pool is beautiful with stunning views as well as the jacuzzis. We were not ready to come home. Singapore is an amazing country, the hospitality is unrivalled and I have never felt safer when travelling. We can't wait to return to MBS and Singapore.

review_title: A few days at the Marina Bay Sands
review_text:
Wow wow wow!!
We arrived knowing that this was going to be a special trip, to an amazing hotel and we were not disappointed. When asked on arrival why we had chosen the Marina, I said it was for my wife’s 50th birthday and our 30th wedding anniversary, and she had always wanted to stay here. Unfortunately our room was not quite ready so we popped off to the shopping mall, grabbed a coffee, and soon after got an email to say room was ready and good to check in.
Check in presented us with an upgrade on behalf of the hotel for my wife…….to a palacial suite, one of their new renovated suites, which was lovely to hear and we thanked them accordingly.
The room we entered was unbelievable, we have both never seen anything like this and were just in awe, the views of the city, the gizmos and gadgets, the attention to detail was just mind blowing.
Our 2 nights were awesome, everything was great superb staff, awesome walks out into the city, food at every point was great, the gardens were superb to visit and it was just perfect, it genuinely couldn’t have been any better!!!

review_title: I'm an icon of Singapore after all
review_text:
I stayed many times before the coronavirus, but it was the first time I stayed after the coronavirus.

When I used Banyan Tree at the spa the year before after COVID-19, I showed my passport and became a member because I got a membership status of Sands Rewards member Prestige, 10% off meals and accommodation, etc., for a limited time if I showed my Japanese passport.

When the trip in March 2024 was approaching, I wanted to check something out, so I confirmed the reservation by phone from Marina Bay Sands website, where I could also call from Japan, and was surprised to hear that the deadline for Prestige membership had passed, so it would be charged at the rate of the day I arrived.

When I asked if there was a way to retain Prestige members, I was in a hurry to create an SMBC crèca when I heard that if I had some kind of card for the campaign I was running, I could.

When I took a breather and called to confirm at a later date, they told me this time that I could only use the Prestige membership benefits once in the campaign, and that if I made a new card to keep that Prestige membership, it would be ok, otherwise it would be the rate of arrival on the day, but they were wrong, and said they wouldn't worry as the 10% off room rate booked when they were Prestige members would still apply. So, I made a credit card without meaning, but anyway, I avoided the worst of it, which was the accommodation rate on the day.

Safe and checked in on the day. The waiting line is long, but the counter is also full of staff, so we proceed quickly. They hand out water along the way and use the VIP check-in at the back more sometimes, so there is no discomfort. We were lucky enough to be led to a VIP check-in, where we sat on the sofa and checked in.

I definitely wanted a bathtub in the room, so I booked a city view in the Premier Room. It happened to be a corner room, and the harbor view was a bit visible from the bathroom. However, please note that this bathroom is fully visible from the hallway, so if you do not use a roll curtain when using the bathroom, you can see it from the hallway.

The price was higher than before the coronavirus, but it was renovated and the room was easier to use than before.

The bath used to have just a bowl-like bath, but after the renovation, a square-shaped, stable bathtub was fine.

It was fun and nice to have a separate shelf with coffee and tea and chocolate.

You can choose where to have breakfast, but again I had it in the spago on the top floor for the view and the sense of freedom. It's crowded, so it's better to book breakfast as well. Reservations can be made through the WEB .

Be careful not to enter the observation deck at certain times.

Before my stay, I had to deal with a lot of things about the price, but they were kind to me every time I called. However, no offense, but it was a bit difficult because the information was not thorough enough and varied from person to person.

But if you stay, the view is spectacular. And the room was clean, and it was nice to see the housekeeping staff really smiling and welcoming when we passed each other down the hall.

Taxis are also easy to catch in front of the hotel, and there are many hotels where you have to wait a long time to get a taxi, so it's easy to get a taxi, and close to Marina Bay Sands shopping centre and MRT station.

The status of the Sands Rewards Prestige member can also be extended again with this stay, and I have accumulated points (resort dollars), so I want to stay again next time.

review_title: Worst Hotel Experience I’ve Ever Had
review_text:
Extremely disappointed with my stay at Marina Bay Sands. I was placed in a room in tower 3 currently undergoing renovation which was unbearably loud and the jack hammer drilling lasted for the majority of the day. When I asked to move to a different location away from the renovation I was asked to pay an additional S$200 p/n. I had paid a lot of money for this hotel to begin with and it is the worst hotel stay I have ever experienced. I had a bad migraine and was unable to leave my room and the ridiculously loud construction work made me feel more unwell. I am shocked that anyone would be placed in a room near the construction with the extreme noise and disturbance. Especially considering the price! I complained several times and asked to speak to the general manager who told me there were no other rooms available in the whole hotel and was offered credit for some food to be sent to my noisy room which was unbearable.

The construction noise is unbearable and there is loud drilling for the majority of the day. I am extremely disappointed with my stay and am shocked that you would expect guests to stay here under these conditions, especially considering the price!

review_text:
This is our final stop in Singapore before we flew back home. The place is amazing and the looks and feel of it was very nice. The stay in Marina Bay Sands was good, new looking rooms, and everything is technology advance compared to our other hotels we stay in Singapore.

When we checked in, everyone was very smiling and so welcoming. When Sandy knew we are celebrating our anniversary, the two staff beside her also wished us happy anniversary! That is very sweet!

The staff in Marina Bay Sands are just amazing. We met a staff name Charmaine Ho she directed us to go to Gardens By The Bay and gave us tips on what to do next.

We also meet another staff name Victor Mai when we ask for directions on how to go to LAVO, what's more he offered to walked us to the restaurant and waited in line with us until we were seated down. I have never come across any hotel staff who would do this and our conversations while waiting in line made it as if we were not waiting at all.

Thank you Marina Bay Sands for making this an amazing time for my wife and I. We will be back to celebrate our 15 wedding anniversary.

review_text:
There are not enough superlatives to describe how amazing this place is. From my arrival at checkin, Sania went above and beyond to ensure my stay would be a memorable one and once again Sania, thank you so much!
I was staying in a Gardens by the Bay view suite. The attention to detail in the suite was impeccable. The balcony is the perfect place to watch the evening spectacular light show from the gardens. This place is a destination in itself and my one night stay, simply wasn’t long enough. The pool was the main reason I wanted to stay here and it did not disappoint. I’d recommend as I did, experiencing it at different times of the day. The night experience in particular is exceptionally memorable.. It is strictly for hotel guests only. You could stay here for a week and still not experience everting this amazing hotel has to offer. Get this on your bucket list now. Am already planning my next visit!

review_title: Nice hotel of a good standard - but not great.
review_text:
We stayed here for one night after a cruise. We had previously stayed in Singapore prior to our cruise at another top rated hotel and wanted to compare the two hotels. In the end, the other hotel won (RC).
When we first entered the hotel early morning we found ourselves in a long queue waiting to reach the check in desk. The check in area is very long with many desk clerks. When you reach the desk you are squeezed into a desk area of about 60cm ( it feels like that). I had difficulty maintaining my space as other people checking in kept pushing me. Our room was not ready so we organised to stow our bags and went to explore Singapore. When we arrived back at the hotel we discovered we had received an upgraded room. This was fantastic. We had a view directly on to the marina bay gardens and were level with the flower bombs. These flowers bombs have two shows of illumination per evening and luckily we were able to catch one display. Great display!
The breakfast was good, but not great. There was quite a good choice but we felt the quality of the western food was not up to the standard it should have been. We thought breakfast was included in our reservation details but apparently it wasn’t and that led to a slightly awkward discussion before we entered the restaurant.
The hotel has a wonderful infinity pool on the top floor, and some restaurants. Unfortunately these are not only for hotel guests. The hotel guests have guest only elevators to their rooms and up to the pool area. Somehow we found one person who did not have a room key card for the elevator and she managed to rise to the intermediate transfer level.
I guess this was reported as next day there were security staff checking room key cards at the lift entrances.
One thing we did not like compared to other Asian hotels we had been to was that there was absolutely no welcome greeting as you entered the hotel. The door staff do not care. We think the reason is that there are so many curious tourists entering the hotel that the staff just do not know who is a genuine guest and who is a casual sightseeing tourist. Maybe the hotel should issue the guests with a badge to wear to make it obvious who is a guest! Another problem in the hotel is that there are no seats to sit on in the ground floor area. That means if you have checked out and are waiting for transport or something, you can’t sit down! We asked about seats and were told to go to the roof area where the infinity pool is. The problem there is that there is no air conditioning so, as we were checked out and waiting 5 hours before our flight home, we had an uncomfortable day.
The hotel is certainly beautiful and in a great location, but we felt let down that the customer care normally associated with high standard hotels just did not exist.

review_title: Marina Bay in Singapore is a luxurious hub with iconic architecture, breathtaking gardens, and vibrant waterfront attrac
review_text:
Marina Bay is one of Singapore's most vibrant and visually stunning areas, known for its blend of cutting-edge architecture, luxurious hotels, and world-renowned attractions. This waterfront district, centered around Marina Bay Sands, offers a mix of cultural, recreational, and entertainment experiences, making it a must-visit for anyone exploring Singapore.

Highlights
Marina Bay Sands: This architectural marvel is the heart of Marina Bay. With its iconic SkyPark infinity pool, high-end shopping, and luxury accommodations, Marina Bay Sands is a symbol of modern Singapore. The SkyPark Observation Deck offers panoramic views of the city, especially breathtaking at sunset.
Gardens by the Bay: Adjacent to Marina Bay Sands, this lush, futuristic garden complex is famous for its Supertree Grove, Cloud Forest, and Flower Dome. The evening light show, Garden Rhapsody, is a must-see as the Supertrees come alive in a stunning display of light and music.
ArtScience Museum: Shaped like a lotus, the ArtScience Museum is both a visual and educational experience, featuring immersive exhibitions that explore the intersection of art, science, and technology.
Merlion Park: Home to Singapore's iconic half-lion, half-fish statue, Merlion Park offers a scenic view of Marina Bay Sands and is a popular spot for photos and city views.
The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands: This luxury shopping mall houses world-class designer boutiques, gourmet restaurants, and a Venetian-style canal with gondola rides, making it a unique shopping destination.
Marina Bay Waterfront Promenade: The promenade provides a scenic walking route along the bay, complete with views of the Singapore skyline, art installations, and the Helix Bridge, a striking double-helix structure that’s especially beautiful when illuminated at night.
Spectra Light and Water Show: This free nightly show in front of Marina Bay Sands features a captivating display of water, lights, and music, illuminating the bay in a dazzling spectacle.
Pros
Stunning Architecture and Scenery: Marina Bay is visually impressive, with unique architecture, beautifully landscaped gardens, and dramatic skyline views.
Diverse Attractions: From gardens and museums to luxury shopping and entertainment, there’s something for everyone.
Easily Accessible: The area is well-connected via MRT, buses, and pedestrian pathways, making it easy to explore.
Nighttime Atmosphere: Marina Bay truly comes alive at night, with light shows, illuminated buildings, and waterfront dining options.
Cons
High Costs: Many attractions, dining, and shopping options are high-end, making Marina Bay one of the pricier areas in Singapore.
Crowds: Due to its popularity, Marina Bay can be crowded, particularly around Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the Bay, and during evening events.
Limited Budget Options: Affordable food and shopping choices are limited, as the area caters mainly to luxury tourism.
Ideal For
Marina Bay is perfect for travelers seeking luxury, families looking for engaging activities, and anyone interested in architecture, design, or experiencing Singapore’s urban beauty. Whether for a quick photo stop or a full day of exploration, Marina Bay offers an impressive mix of Singapore’s best.

Travel Tips
Visit in the Late Afternoon: Arriving in the late afternoon allows you to see Marina Bay by day and then watch as it transforms at night.
Book in Advance for Marina Bay Sands SkyPark: If you plan to visit the SkyPark Observation Deck, booking tickets online in advance can save you time.
Catch the Free Light Shows: Both the Spectra Light and Water Show and Garden Rhapsody are free and highly recommended for a memorable night experience.

review_text: The hotel itself is excellent, the rooms or should I say suites are really good, comfortable and full of technology. Among the best I have been a guest in. We stayed in 2018 and I now refresh my review due to refurbishment. We weren’t impressed with the check-in which should have been earlier due to our type of booking however, when we arrived, the private check in was in disarray and unorganised. However, on arrival in our suite, we were not disappointed. We ate in the Lavo Italian restaurant, which stated it had a dress code. This was not adhered to and we found our selves in amongst women in jeans and men in shorts. It was quite pricey and the food quality was disappointing. This did take away from the enjoyment of the hotel, however,the access to the rooftop pool and the comfort and excellence of the room & breakfast delivered to our dining area made up for this. We paid a hefty £595 GBP for our one night treat we felt this could have been a lot less due to the check-in and restaurant.

review_text:
I stayed here for 2 nights to celebrate our anniversary.

This is truly a bucket list hotel and even though we had high expectations, they were SURPASSED! This is the best hotel I've stayed in my life including other luxury hotels like the Langham or St. Regis. Now every future hotel stay will be measured against MBS!

Of course the location is stunning and the access to the rooftop infinity pool is often cited as the main reason to choose MBS. However, the entire stay was incredible -- I would stay here even without the pool!

The design, attention to detail and amenities are wonderful but what really makes MBS stand out is how well-trained and consistently great the staff are. They are helpful without being intrusive and always kind and courteous, even if we aren't high rollers who stay at these kind of hotels very often. Sometimes in fancier hotels it can feel stuffy or snobby, but here I felt they treated everyone well, whether you are wearing designer clothes or you're like me in your Uniqlo gear :P

Room:
We got upgraded to a suite - maybe because we said it's our anniversary or because they are doing construction on tower 1. They also surprised us with a chocolate cake in our room with "Happy Anniversary".

The room was huge with a nice city view, impeccably clean, cozy design (I wish my living room looked like this), everything you could possible need. Smart lighting and temperature adjustment. Smart TV. Waffle AND terry cloth robes. Slippers of different sizes (as a woman with small feet, I usually never use hotel slippers as they are one size and usually way too big). Bath tub with a tray to hold your phone etc and bath bomb AND bath salts. Jo Malone toiletries. Toto toilet. Dyson hair dryer. Speaker in the bathroom so you can listen to music/TV while in the bath. Jewelry box. Chocolate truffles. TWG teas. In room pre-mixed cocktails (extra cost but very reasonable, like $19 each). Super cozy bed with nice linens. Nice design-y coffee table books. Free MBS postcards. Thoughtful turndown service -- they noticed I was using a ratty old movie ticket as a bookmark and stuck a beautiful MBS bookmark in my book!! Like COME ON, talk about attention!! If your charger is really long, they will wind it up and clip it in place. It's basically like being at home but BETTER.

Wellness:
The spa is sadly closed at this time. But I took advantage of the free access to wellness classes for hotel guests (normally around $30 for the general public). I did the morning sound bath on the observation ticket. What a magical and unique experience! So relaxing and peaceful. I also signed up for the morning pilates class but it was raining so it was cancelled. Instead I went to the gym. For the past year the gym has moved to a different building but it is attached to the hotel via underground and you can walk there in 5 mins, passing by the casino. The gym has state of the art equipment and everything you would expect including cardio machines, free weights plus extra like that mirror fitness app (you do classes using the app), massage gun, fruit infused water, coffee/tea, lockers for your valuables and headphones in case you forgot your own. There is a change room attached as well, in case you already checked out of the hotel and need a place to freshen up. Arif and Lucy were very kind and helpful in orienting me to the gym area.

Food:
We didn't eat at any of the restaurants except for breakfast at Origin & Bloom (casual grab & go cafe in the lobby) one day. Great cappuccino and breakfast sandwiches, reasonably priced. The food court at the Shoppes @ MBS is really nice and has great variety.

Pool:
Amazing. Be sure to visit during the day and at night for different vibes. I was worried it would be crowded since it is such a famous pool. But it is really long, so even when it is busy, there is no problem finding your own space in the pool and getting lounge chairs. There are always staff around to help you get a towel. There's also a free sunscreen dispenser, so smart. Keep in mind there is not a lot of shade in the lounge area (no umbrellas), so sun protection is a must. The pool itself is shallow and I swam around a bit, but it's more of a pool to relax in rather than to swim laps.

There is a professional photographer going around in the pool and taking photos that you can buy later, but we chose to just take our own photos (bring a waterproof phone cover - or buy one from the gift shop). They have discounted drinks at night (I forgot what time but it is 2 for 1). It's easy to miss the jacuzzis which are facing the opposite direction as the infinity pool. Those are really nice at night!

Check-in/check-out:
Smooth and efficient. They collect your luggage right away from your taxi/car and tag them so that by the time you are checked in and go to your room, your luggage is there waiting for you. Express check out was easily done online and then you just drop your keys at the desk.

Overall, so impressed with this hotel. It's basically flawless and lived up to the hype. Would stay here again when in Singapore.

There is a professional photographer going around in the pool and taking photos that you can buy later, but we chose to just take our own photos (bring a waterproof phone cover - or buy one from the gift shop). They have discounted drinks at night (I forgot what time but it is 2 for 1). It's easy to miss the jacuzzis which are facing the opposite direction as the infinity pool. Those are really nice at night!

Check-in/check-out:
Smooth and efficient. They collect your luggage right away from your taxi/car and tag them so that by the time you are checked in and go to your room, your luggage is there waiting for you. Express check out was easily done online and then you just drop your keys at the desk.

Overall, so impressed with this hotel. It's basically flawless and lived up to the hype. Would stay here again when in Singapore.

review_text: This is a perfect 10 experience! My favorite hotel from now on. From Best customer service, to the wonderful amenities and hotel surroundings. We love our view: the beautiful lights of Gardens by the Bay! Our family suite is just perfect. Just what we wanted: with kitchen and washer dryer, modern Japanese Bidet toilet. Not all rooms have these, but so surprised when the selection opened up. All the finest things are in there- from the Jo Malone soaps and lotion to the best TWG tea flavors! The service is just way and above expectations: the welcome chocolates are so good and other treats are so fancy! I am really impressed on how they show their gesture of hospitality. They even gave a cute, Marina Bay Sands Lego set that my son was eyeing on for his birthday. Too many nice things to mention, but specially the warmest welcome and service we got from the time we were picked up from our previous hotel...riding their Limo Van really made us all feel so VIP, up to the private check in process by Ms. Glaiza and Ms. Julie (both charming and very warm and very accommodating ) , up to the concierge - Leo really explained all the good places to visit, complete with different maps and illustrations. They know how to treat their guests here. Nothing bad to say about this hotel, all are above super special only. The pool is the best in the world, by the way, and the view up there is just spectacular. One should expect though, that this is a luxury hotel, and it does not come cheap, but it's just so worth it. People save up for a good vacation, I would say, it's the same as this experience. Would definitely return to MBS when in Singapore!

review_text:
I booked this hotel for our 2 night stopover in Singapore as I wanted to see the iconic pool plus I wanted to visit Gardens by the Bay so it made sense to book here. We arrived early in the morning & unfortunately our room wasn't available but we were allowed to access the infinity pool. We had packed our swimming costumes in our hand luggage so we could enjoy the pool for several hours until our room was ready. The pool area was almost empty so it was a real treat (especially when we visited early evening and saw how busy it was). My only criticism is that it would have been nice if just one section of the huge pool area didn't have the constant beat of bass 'music'. That apart, I loved the pool & we enjoyed having it almost to ourselves. Reception emailed me when our room was ready & we were delighted when we saw our beautiful newly refurbished room on level 21 of Tower 1. Spacious & tasteful. The bed & bedding were so luxurious & comfortable. Bath, separate shower & toto toilet, double sinks, espresso machine, enormous Samsung tv & 2 armchairs fronting a superb view over the river. (We were told that soft drinks in the minibar were complimentary but on check out we discovered that wasn't the case.) The room was so quiet. We never had any sound from neighbours or from outside. We only had breakfast one morning as we checked out early the 2nd morning. There was a very small wait to be seated but the efficency of service, choice & quality of buffet were impressive.

It's a short easy walk to Gardens by the Bay. We also decided to do a river boat cruise & again it was just a short stroll to boat terminal outside the mall.

Hotel was a great choice for us in terms of location, quality & relaxation. We had dinner at Lavo (separate review to follow).

We arrived early in the morning & unfortunately our room wasn't available but we were allowed to access the infinity pool. We had packed our swimming costumes in our hand luggage so we could enjoy the pool for several hours until our room was ready. The pool area was almost empty so it was a real treat (especially when we visited early evening and saw how busy it was). My only criticism is that it would have been nice if just one section of the huge pool area didn't have the constant beat of bass 'music'. That apart, I loved the pool & we enjoyed having it almost to ourselves. Reception emailed me when our room was ready & we were delighted when we saw our beautiful newly refurbished room on level 21 of Tower 1. Spacious & tasteful. The bed & bedding were so luxurious & comfortable. Bath, separate shower & toto toilet, double sinks, espresso machine, enormous Samsung tv & 2 armchairs fronting a superb view over the river. (We were told that soft drinks in the minibar were complimentary but on check out we discovered that wasn't the case.) The room was so quiet. We never had any sound from neighbours or from outside. We only had breakfast one morning as we checked out early the 2nd morning. There was a very small wait to be seated but the efficency of service, choice & quality of buffet were impressive.

It's a short easy walk to Gardens by the Bay. We also decided to do a river boat cruise & again it was just a short stroll to boat terminal outside the mall.

Hotel was a great choice for us in terms of location, quality & relaxation. We had dinner at Lavo (separate review to follow).

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is a must when in Singapore. The hotel it self is stunning and the rooms are currently in the process of being updated, they are doing an exceptional job updating the rooms whilst minimizing the impact on guests stays.
the roof top pool is a must on anyone’s bucket list, the restaurants on the roof top and back down on ground level are simply exceptional, there is something for everyone.
however the #1 asset of this hotel is its staff, from the doorman at the front doors, through to checkin staff, concierge, house keeping, kitchen, pool staff, VIP staff, etc, they make this hotel what it is and they all make you feel like you belong and nothing is a problem, they will all go above and beyond to make your stay a memorable experience. Can’t wait until we next return!

review_title: A perfect stay in a perfect hotel.
review_text:
We booked a Gardens by the Bay view suite for five nights. A couple of days before we were due to arrive, we were contacted by the Premium Services team to ask if we wished to have a complimentary car pick us up. We took advantage of their offer. A driver was waiting for us at Changi airport and got us to the hotel. When we arrived, Frina, our private checkin person, was awaiting us along with a bellman to get our bags. We were whisked up to our suite (upgraded to the Paiza residences!) and we did the checkin inside the room. Frina could not have been friendlier or more professional. She is a great ambassador for the hotel. Once all that was taken care of, we enjoyed our five nights.
It's a hotel and mall complex, right next to Gardens by the Bay. So, if you don't want to leave the complex, you have all the food and shopping you need. If you do want to explore what Singapore has to offer (and of course you do!), you are really close to a metro station and you can go anywhere you want.
You're right next to Gardens By the Bay, so visiting it is really easy and convenient.
We had a buffet breakfast included in our meal; Rise is where the buffet is, and it has a great deal of various breakfast options for your dining needs. The lunch buffet is in the same place and has just as many options, including seafood.
Your room key gets you free anytime access to the observation deck and infinity pool on the 57th floors. Take advantage of this; get on up there and enjoy the views. We hit the pool in the afternoon and found it easy to get a lounge. There are also jacuzzis up there.
The suite was spectacular; every modern convenience. The end tables had wireless charging units built in plus USB plugs. The bathroom has a bidet operated by a keypad. The shower has regular showerhead, horizontal showerheads and the rainfall showerhead. Jacuzzi bathtub, of course.
Gigantic TV in living room and smaller one in bedroom. Curtains (sheers and blackouts) operated by wall switches.
The staff; friendly, professional, courteous. Uniformly; every single staff member we encountered was excellent.
Seriously, this was one of the best hotel experiencs we've ever had, and we would love to return to Singapore and stay here.

review_text: We stayed at Marina Bay Sands from September 17th to 19th. The 2 nights and 3 days at Sands Premier Suite, Gardens by the Bay View (King Bed) was really great, and I definitely want to come back again. During our trip with a 7 month old and a 27 month old, the Marina Bay Sands team was very considerate, which made our trip a happy one. On the last day, while going to the airport using the limousine service, we realized that we had left our first little boy's favorite pillow behind. When we were about to give up, the hotel delivered only the pillow through another vehicle, and thanks to that, our child was able to successfully complete the 7-hour flight. I can't forget the look of happiness on my son's face when he saw his pillow at the airport. I sincerely thank you for protecting my child's innocence and making good memories for our family. In particular, Jevic Navidad, who took care of our family at the airport and saw us off, and the driver (I don't know his name..) who contacted the hotel and worked hard to get us to the airport and receive the pillow, thank you very much. We made good memories, and we will definitely visit again. Thank you.

review_text:
I never expected that this hotel would live up to the hype, but actually..it did better than expected.
The hotel is just stunning..grounds, views, infinity pool, restaurant, breakfast..can't really find any flaws. Yes, it comes with a hefty price tag, but it delivers.
Our experience begins at an extremely busy lobby, that somehow runs like a well oiled machine and we were speaking with reception staff within 2 minutes. We had the pleasure to be checked in by Katie (catiee ?) who I believe was on her first day at the job on 18/10/24. I hope this message reaches her, when we say that she was an absolute delight, really polite and really elevated our experience from the beginning.
We were then shown to our paiza deluxe suite on the 47th floor, and dear me...the room, the size, the design, the feel was just 6* experience. Everything in the room makes sense. Special things that were really standing out: 1. DIY tea ritual with high quality teas provided 2. high tech room controlled by tablet 3. smart TV in the bathtub room.
All in all, a hefty price tag, but definitely delivers in quality.
We would definitely return to stay, when back in Singapore !

review_title: Marina Bay Sands world famous and one of a kind amazing hotel
review_text:
In April of 2024, we visited the beautiful country of Singapore. We stayed at Marina Bay Sands and experienced their luxurious expansive resort for the first time.

From the moment we checked in, their outstanding staff fulfilled every request from assisting with dinner reservations, city tours and even transportation to the airport. Marina Bay Sands’ exceptional service indulged our whims, surrounded us in tranquility, and provided us with endless opportunities to explore their magical one-of-a-kind world-famous hotel at our leisure.

Their attention to every detail ensured we experienced unparalleled comfort during our stay at this incredible haven of luxury, filled with stunning décor, and elegantly furnished rooms. Their infinity pool was sublime, with spectacular views of the city, and their restaurants' meals were decadent.

Kind regards to the dedicated staff that made our stay memorable, and a special thanks to; Victor Alexander Mai and Jeevan Rao, who were our first contacts with MBS staff and greeted us at check in. Victor also secured our dinner reservations at Spago, their rooftop restaurant, and escorted us to our table. Daniel Tuang, also greeted us at check in and provided us with a wealth of premium services information. Charmaine Ho had a lovely array of fruit, with champagne and an assortment of delicious chocolates awaiting us in our room. Aaron, one of the pool lifeguards, was kind enough to provide us with historical city information, and Mark scheduled our airport transportation and secured our luggage. Erica Gonzales met us at the departure exit to thank us and give us a warm farewell on behalf of MBS. Johnny, our friendly airport chauffeur, got us safely to the airport and radioed ahead so the amazing duo of Justine and Eric would be awaiting us curbside at the airport’s international terminal. They unloaded our luggage onto airport dollies, wheeled them to the baggage counter and escorted us to the VAT counter for our tax refunds.

In addition, the dynamic and kind team members from MBS’s housekeeping, restaurants and even the elevator operator, a friendly gentleman who whisked us to the front of the line when he saw that we were MBS guests, provided us with every conceivable comfort during our stay. Marina Bay Sands is rated as a 5-star hotel, but we wholeheartedly believe it should be a 10-star rating. Marina Bay Sands left us with beautiful memories, a deep appreciation for their incomparable superior devotion to excellence, and an embedded desire to return again and again.

review_text:
From even before my arrival in Singapore to the moment I departed, Marina Bay Sands provided an exceptional stay and experience. My room was large with excellent amenities and had a beautiful view of Gardens by the Bay. The infinity pool is stunning and I found myself watching the sunset from the pool every night. Daily breakfasts at the Rise restaurant were of high quality with many options across a variety of cuisines. And my jaw dropped the first time I entered the casino floor - it felt like I was in an opera house.

I would particularly like to thank David and the entire Premium Services team for their care in assisting with my stay. I was surprised and delighted to have them organize airport transfers for me, and additionally received a bottle of champagne in my room upon check-in to celebrate my birthday. I have often said that the best level of service is when you are attended to without needing to ask. David and the MBS team truly lived up to that standard during my stay. I can't wait to come back here!

The building itself is an architectural marvel and every touch point has been considered. The stars aligned and we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Family Suite that had just been renovated. Needless to say our minds were blown! The views from the 47th floor were beyond spectacular and the suite was breathtaking. Every convenience was at our fingertips and the staff were so accommodating that they seemed to know what we wanted before we even wanted it! The rooftop pool is something everyone should experience at least once in their lifetime. It is truly like swimming in the sky. The pool staff were friendly, helpful and only too happy to go above and beyond to make our time as enjoyable as it could be. Spargo was fabulous and we enjoyed sun downers before heading back to our suite to watch the Gardens by the Bay light show. The buffet breakfast has to be seen to be believed - it was enormous and offered everything our hearts desired. We ventured into the shopping complex which was beyond my expectations. The food, the shops, the fabulous people wandering around were all so deliciously sumptuous. This truly is how the other half live! Thank you MBS for a life changing experience - it was everything and then some. A special shoutout to John and Charmaine from Premium Services who looked after us so wonderfully well. We are so grateful and thankful for everything you did to make our stay something we will remember forever!

review_text: Recently stayed for one night at Marina Bay Sands and was greeted by the most incredible staff member, wish I could remember her name as her service was incredible. There's aren't enough words to explain the luxury and extravagance of this suite. Water & city views overlooking the amazing light show at night, it was absolutely incredible. The shopping centre next to MBS is an experience in itself and everyone has to go there at least once. Highly recommend everyone spends the extra $$$ and upgrades to a Paiza Collection room - it's worth it! review_title: A luxurious, once in a lifetime, experience!
review_text: We visited Singapore for a 2 night stopover after our fortnight of travelling around Lombok on a family holiday to celebrate my BIG birthday in August. As a surprise for everyone, I booked Marina Bay Sands, and it definitely did not disappoint. I booked 2 Sands Premier King rooms (one was upgraded free of charge to a suite for my partner and I), the newly renovated ones, and they were absolutely stunning. The attention to detail blew us all away, from the curtains opening automatically when the door to the room is opened, to the heated toilet seat and integrated bidet with warm water, the cocktails in the room, 2 huge TVs in our suite, fabulous views of the Gardens, the most comfortable bed we've EVER slept in, dressing area with lovely lighting, deep bath complete with bath salts and bath bombs...honestly, the list is endless. This was sheer luxury and we loved every minute of it. Despite there being renovation works at the hotel, we didn't hear anything, our room was really peaceful and we slept well. We spent a few hours by the iconic infinity pool, which really is stunning; we took advantage of the cocktails and snacks by the bar. This was a once in a lifetime experience for us and we absolutely loved it. The staff are superb, couldn't do enough for us. The only downside was the length of time we had to wait to check in at the desk. I'd tried to check in online, but the system didn't like 2 of our (older) UK passports. In no way, however, did this detract from the experience we had at Marina Bay Sands.

review_title: Rooftop pool area evacuated during quick storm, lost phone
review_text:
Storm came over and rooftop pool area evacuated, which wasn’t their fault however my phone was trapped up there and they wouldn’t reopen it even after the storm had passed and I was leaving the next day. After two weeks of contacting them they finally said they had my phone, then it was extremely difficult to get them to post it back to me, it was as if they just did not care at all and it was just a big bother for them, this is not a place you go if you want good customer service

4werks later I still don’t have my phone

review_text:
My wife and I, over the last month stayed twice at MBS. 15th-18th Sept and then again from the 5th -9th Oct.

Ok it is not cheap compared with other hotels, but each time it was a pleasure. We loved the room, probably one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in. The infinity pool is always amazing, and the staff always provide very attentive service.

We are looking forward to our next stay.

Kind regards

Robert Patterson

review_text:
As a cabin crew member who gets to experience different hotel stays around the globe I decided to treat myself a one night stay at the Marina Bay Sands and it didn't disappoint in any way.
A personal big thank you to the upgrade and excellent staff in-particular Justin VIP check in desk, Rafeal infinity pool, Shivandasani infinity pool apologies if not spelt your name correctly and Madurai luggage.
From the moment I arrived getting my key, was fast and efficient, luggage already waiting in my room. My room was amazing with Marina Bay Views. The bed super comfy and pillows, nice amenity kits etc plenty of complimentary water in the room with teas and coffee.
Room was quiet and well insulated....
Infinity pool access with towels and water on hand. Staff really friendly and approachable used the outside jacuzzi eventually found the on button overlooking the Garden Bay ...
Enjoyed my buffet breakfast, especially the cooked gammon slices, plenty of choices at Rise got there early morning as was told can get really busy and im sure it could be rather chaotic after 8am, as I arrived at 06:45 the only hiccup is I ordered another coffee and waited a while and went to ask another attendant who served it straight away.
After checking out at 11 am I left my luggage whilst I did a bit of shopping MRT mega close by as shopping mall casino etc.
On checkout was giving a key to access the infinity pool which was nice.
All I can say from my own personal experience amazing 10/10 and the staff play a big part on first impressions and my overall experience was unforgettable, would return in the future
Thank you to all the staff and I appreciated my unexpected room upgrade... perferto!!!

review_title: Time to relax and enjoy the harmony of the sound
review_text: Our sun meditation experience at Marina Bay Sands was truly unforgettable. The session lasted an hour, guided by an exceptional professor who made us feel calm and centered from the start. The view from the venue was simply breathtaking—an expansive panorama that elevated the entire experience. Meditating with the sun rising over the bay added a serene and energizing atmosphere, making it the perfect way to start the day. It was a unique combination of expert instruction and an incredible setting. Highly recommended for anyone looking to reconnect and recharge!

I’m so grateful for the opportunity and highly recommend this to anyone looking for a moment of calm and tranquility in their busy lives

review_text:
Wow where to begin. Booked this back in may for my honeymoon.
First issue it's getting renovated so it's half a building site and you can tell from the outside and the inside it's not subtle ( I checked beforehand).
I booked a premium room with bespoke cocktails. Waited and waited for them to contact me regarding what I wanted in the armoire. Finally contacted them to find that this is now apparently an extra service fee on top of the room cost. Nothing but coffee is included. I spoke to lucas who told me I was paying for the convenience of the room. Well duh that's what rooms are for but I've never stayed in a suite or premium room where every facility given was then charged as extra.
I then see that the price on the website is less than I paid way back in may. They wouldn't even take the difference off the room cost. No gesture of goodwill given.
The check in process is basically a circus we already gave our passport details but we're then warned there would be a huge queue which may take an hr or more. To check in! As a premium customer folks not the basic room. I then got warned of restricted pool times where u are counted in and queue again if it's full. So basically I decided I didn't want to stay in a hotel that was prepared to give me a sub par service add on costs and a them park style stay to possibly swim in the sky for 700 quid. So I cancelled and they waved the late cancellation fee tye only decent thing they could have done. I'm begging you do not wate a day of your life and your gard earned money on this cash cow it's not worth it !!! Stay anywhere else it will be better they will treat you nicer I promise

review_text:
I stayed with my husband at Marina Bay Sands. We were welcomed by a very sweet lady. Her name is KC. Big smiles and wonderful welcome.

KC told us about the renovation noise and we were shock! How can hotels do renovation in the middle of the day! Do not book this Deluxe Room! Too noisy! Just too noisy!

The manager Victor apologize to us and showed us a new room. We had to pay upgrade fee but the room was 10000000% better than the previous room. And we learn that this is not the best room Marina Bay Sands can offer!

Victor kept in contact with us during our stay and we are amazed with the hospitality which Marina Bay Sands has to offer. Marina Bay Sands was supposed to be our anniversary trip last spot before we flew back home, what we thought was going to be a nightmare became truly grand finale until the very end.

There was showering facilities available after check out which is good to have before our flight back.

We are still in touch with Victor and we are already planning for our trip back next year! Looking forward to have another grand time at Marina Bay Sands.

Service was impeccable.

The stand out feature is, of course, the swimming pool. Amazing, brilliant and extremely well managed - as is the entire hotel.

This hotel was well worth the extra £££.

review_title: Exceptional service, futuristic rooms, luxurious amenities, and an iconic infinity pool make Marina Bay Sands the ultima
review_text:
**Review for Marina Bay Sands, Singapore**

Marina Bay Sands is, hands down, the best hotel I’ve ever stayed at! The service is impeccable—housekeeping is like magic; nothing is ever out of place, and the room is always spotless. It's like they sneak in and refresh everything without you even noticing! The rooms are fully equipped with everything you could possibly need, and the bed is extra comfy—you'll sleep like a baby.

The hotel itself is massive, and honestly, you never need to leave. It has everything—a huge mall, a casino, fantastic restaurants, and a sensational breakfast buffet that sets you up for the day. And of course, the highlight is the infinity pool. It's not only one of the best in the world, but also the largest. Taking a swim with a view like that is a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

Marina Bay Sands truly has it all, making it by far the best hotel I’ve ever visited. A perfect stay from start to finish!

review_text: Had a medical conference in Singapore last March and my friend and I decided to stay at Marina Bay Sands. It was busy… I suspected it is always busy. We were sent to Tower 3 to check in. The loveliest receptionist, Alice, treated us so well that we were sent back to Tower 1 for our room. The room was out of this world. Spectacular is an understatement. We started to regret our short stay at the hotel. We also, couldn’t decide whether to spend more time in the room or at the rooftop pool. We reluctantly went up and had the time of our lives. Even though the pool was busy, it was somehow relatively calm. The view was mesmerising. It was the best 48 hours I have ever spent in Singapore. Guna, who jovially helped us at the pool is worth mentioning. Would go again..

review_text: So I was really looking forward to visiting this hotel as the finale to the Gumball Rally event that I had been in for the past week. I’d heard good reviews but honestly I was so disappointed. £1200 a night I paid and after a long trip on the road I was presented with a mediocre room that wouldn’t be out of place in a Premier Inn. Supposedly a 5 star hotel, my mini bar had a can of coke and a can of sprite as well as juices - where was the beer or wine that most people look forward to consuming after a hard day and checking into a 5 star hotel. In addition, I was placed next to a busy road with no balcony and woken in the morning by drilling from the renovation works that were being carried out in the rooms above. The wider facility is impressive but there was no breakfast included and we had to walk across two towers to get to a facility that did serve it at $75 additional. Very disappointing and a real let down from the previous week and hotel standards.

review_text:
We stayed one night in Marina Bay, as the end of our holiday, the visit was in May 2023, so it was a bit behind.
The hotel is a different league, starting on arrival. There are countless employees and everyone is well trained.
We don’t have to say anything about the rooftop pool, it’s looking for competition all over the world. Worth mentioning are the lifeguards, who do their job with a smile and joy, TOP.
However, we would not go back to the hotel either, hence the review.
We have a room on the 2nd floor. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful. In the room it smelled funny of drain and felt every 2 minutes there was a problem with the electricity (contact of the room card). We only used the room for sleeping, so we didn't intervene.
We then went to the roof, briefly enjoyed the spectacular view and wanted to reserve a table in the bar, but this was not possible with the staff on site. Later in the evening we learned at the bar that we could have made reservations online, which was not mentioned in the afternoon. Fortunately, we still found a table.
The next morning at sunrise by the pool there were still glasses from the previous day on the ground, which is definitely not befitting for a 5* hotel. For the first impression, the location and ultimately the price, you can expect more perfection.
Conclusion: spectacular hotel, with insane pool but "the devil hides detail".

review_text:
Thank you all so much for your kind and attentive care during our stay at Marina Bay Sands, you and your wonderful colleagues made our little stop over the main attraction of our entire holiday!

We were so happy with the Family room that overlooked Gardens by the Bay (room 10899 on level 8) and it was worth every dollar spent. The kids went crazy for the bunk beds and the nintendo switch.. and I really appreciated the washing machine and baby plates & cutlery - it will be ever so hard to top this hotel ❤️

The food at Rise was amazing 🤩 we thought the Epicurean at the Crown in Sydney was an amazing buffet, but Rise had the best foods by far!

The shopping centre and MRT just below the hotel is so convenient and practical for tourists..

Look forward to returning again soon!

review_title: Second return visit, and again great beyond all expectations.
review_text:
My sister and I returned to Singapore and Marina Bay Sands again this year, after the great visit last year, and this time for three days at the end of last August.
If last year I defined the hotel, and the experience of staying at the hotel, as a "MUST DO" when in Singapore, this time it can be doubled at least twice.
From the moment we arrived at the hotel, to check-in, we were greeted by the wonderful ANDY Front Desk, Check-in, who did everything in his power, and even managed to upgrade the room we ordered (at an extra cost of course), so that we got a great room with a great view of the city on the 38th floor.
The room was very large with huge and luxurious beds that gave us a perfect and luxurious sleep.
AGAIN, the bathroom was very spacious, with all the ordinary bathroom amenities, like toothbrush, toothpaste, etc. but in an enlarged size and branded for the Marina Bay.
The rooftop pool - the Infinity Pool - as usual is stunning in its beauty, and especially the view from it. This time unlike last year, and due to the extra time we spent at the hotel, we were able to take advantage and spend more time in the pool. Just pure pleasure.
Breakfast at the RISE restaurant is a delight, with endless options. Starting with Chinese, Western, Indian cuisine and more. Simply suitable for every taste, in unusual abundance, and all in a pleasant atmosphere.
I must mention Mrs. YIN LAY - the ROOM STYLIST, who took care of every shortage and every request we made to her. Just fantastic.
Also Mrs. TAN YA TING - Duty Manager, Front Office, who solved a problem that arose during check-out, quickly (so quickly, that I was amazed - even before we took off back from Changi) and efficiently, and all this in a humane and welcoming manner.
Hope, hope to come back soon again.

review_title: Marina Bay Sands and the MBS Premium Services team are WONDERFUL
review_text:
My family and I were the beneficiaries of unbelievably wonderful service from MBS Premium Services. They met us at the airport and had a car waiting for us, then escorted us to our rooms upon arrival -- no waiting at a check-in desk.

Then, upon departure, they came to our room for check-out. After we stored our luggage with them and did some sight-seeing, they were waiting for us at the entrance to the hotel with a car, our bags already loaded. They escorted us to the airport, through check-in for our flight, and then on to the Jewel for some more sightseeing.

This kind of service is unparalleled -- an incredible treat. Pauline Alcazar and Mariella Manalang headed up the team and could not have been better -- they are amazing people. I hope I will see them again on our next visit to Singapore.

And, of course, the Marina Bay Sands hotel itself is stunning. State of the art amenities, incredibly convenient, great room-service food, iconic rooftop pool.... Just a perfect hotel.

review_title: Bad experience despite being a Paiza member!
review_text: As a Paiza member, I am disappointed with the lack of prestige associated with the membership. I arrived at MBS at 11:30 AM and was not able to check in until 4:00 PM, despite the hotel's policy stating that check-in begins at 3:00 PM. When I contacted the Paiza hotline, the staff simply reiterated the hotel's check-in policy without offering any assistance or resolution. This level of service is unacceptable and falls below the standards expected of a five-star hotel. I urge MBS to take immediate action to improve the check-in process and ensure that Paiza members receive the level of service they deserve.

review_title: Permanent construction noise due to a basic renovation
review_text: The infinity pool is certainly the absolute highlight of this hotel, but the permanent construction noise from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm in the morning is actually unbearable in the room and will certainly continue for several months due to a basic renovation. Of course, you spend most of your time in Singapore in the city, but sleeping out and a short rest during the day is not possible in these circumstances. We were alerted to construction work at the Check Inn but already had no option but to accept this. Our complaint was responded to in the expected friendliness and we received a voucher for lunch at the hotel, but this is not really in relation to the price of the overnight stay and the disruption.

review_text:
My wife and I both felt like I was in the Barbie movie, or you could call it the Marina Bay Sands movie. Everything was perfect. We honestly felt like this was a dream - was it all CGI??
We had plans to see and do more in Singapore, however after arrival at the Marina Bay Sands, we ended up staying either in the pool or in our beautiful and newly refurbished room and “living the dream”!

Interestingly, the TV screen in our room had the message, “Welcome to Marina bay Sands, where unparalleled luxury is matched by exceptional service. We hope you enjoy every minute.” This wasn’t just a meaningless message, this is actually what happened. Special thanks to Jael and the team. Our anniversary holiday experience will be remembered and talked about for ever.

If I could, I’d rate this way more than 5 stars.

I would have put this as a five but our room was not great for the price we paid. On arrival we were told there was building work going on in the tower we stayed in. This was quite noisy and if I’d of known about this before hand, I might have tempted to upgrade my room to another tower. We were on the sixth floor and our room was next to the very busy road next to us. Very noisy. The air con in the room is also very loud. The bath room door is a sliding door and that clicks when you open it which disturbs the other person in the room. Whilst these are very minor things in an otherwise great hotel, it did affect our overall experience. If the room had been half the cost, I would not have been bothered but for the cost, I was a little disappointed. Overall though….very good

review_title: Amazing hotel, be careful with your belongings.
review_text:
The hotel and pool has been on our families bucket list for many years, when we booked our Asia tour this summer, this hotel was top of the list.
The service is second to none and we were looked after incredibly well by premium guest services, we were met on our arrival and the check in took place in our room. We were celebrating our daughter’s birthday and a cake and birthday gift were organised for us, which was appreciated.
On departure we were given a complementary limo to our next destination and a late check out.
We had breakfast in Rise, which had an incredible choice.
The pool is everything you imagine it to be and more, the only down side to our stay was we left our room key and a watch on our sunbed while we were in the pool. Unfortunately when we got back to the sunbeds these were missing, the hotel did try and locate the watch but this was not found. It’s quite sad that someone would feel the need to take something that doesn’t belong to them, it just shows that even in a premius setting, this can still happen.

We requested a gardens by the bay view so we would watch the light show from the comfort out our room, this did not disappoint!

review_text:
We enjoyed an amazing few days at Marina Bay Sands at the start of the month which started before we arrived. Guest services organised our transfer from the city and when we arrived we were met by Eunice who took us straight to our room so that we could begin our journey. Eunice provided us with personalised check-in, very much appreciated and continued to provide welcome gifts throughout our stay. The pool is fabulous, hard to say anymore, and the poolside service is equally as good.

We dined both evenings at the roof top level, LAVO one evening and then Ce La Vi for the other evening. The total experience, food, service, and ambience are all superb. Although a totally different dining experience the breakfast in the morning was again fabulous.

We had thought that maybe Marina Bay Sands would be too opulent, however it was a super friendly experience. It is not the cheapest holiday that we have ever been on, but we recognise that it is a unique experience, particularly with the service provided by all staff, but we do need to mention Eunice who made our stay so match more enjoyable.

review_title: Lack of Information / Failed to Deliver
review_text:
First thing first. This hotel is amazing and the facilities was excellent. What I do not understand is their claim that information of the renovation in the hotel is "widely known" and "Highly advertised".

I mean like I have made my reservation for this hotel about one year ago and it was a big anticipated trip. with all the lights and hype going on. KC handled our check in and being nice. She informed us about the renovation works which caught us off guard. Renovation time is from 8am to 9pm!!!! I am here on a holiday not for a sound therapy which does not provide therapy or to be disturbed.

Needless to say we raised our concerns and a manager spoke with us and apologize saying that it was placed on Booking.com and on their website. I mean like when we booked it one year ago where was this placed? where was this mentioned? it was certainly not on the email confirmation we received and all the emails we have received from the hotel team. All they mentioned is we are all excited to welcome you for your stay with not one word of the renovation. We showed them all the emails and they agreed with us! This manager had the cheek to tell me there is nothing we can do as we are fully booked?!

We left the front desk unsatisfied and our room was under whelming apart from the wonderful view of Gardens by the Bay. We reasoned ourselves the mood was killed from our renovation surprise. The renovation works was tremendously impactful. It also shows that there are no sound absorbing layers between floors. Another manager call to apologize again and told us again there was no other room to change. This manager offered us SGD100 credits to offset our bill. We were insulted. The manager offered us SGD 100 for a 3 night stay here in this hotel. That was a joke.

At check out, we once again mentioned our situation and wanted them to proof where did they mentioned in the correspondence with us about the renovation works. They were unable to proof and only could show the current website information before anyone makes a reservation.

We have also written in provided this information on their hotel survey but there was no response from them. How typical. At least other hotels would have the courtesy to reach out to me.

But this is just my sharing. Good luck to all you folks out there and I bet you no one is going to respond to this. Share more and spread the word!

review_text:
When it comes to luxury, this hotel certainly delivers. Although we experienced some miscommunication with a few staff members, Ms. Valerie from customer relations addressed our concerns effectively, making it likely that we'll return in the future.

However, one aspect that needs urgent attention is the hotel's use of plastic water bottles. It's alarming to consider the environmental impact, with potentially thousands of bottles being discarded daily, forming what could be a literal mountain of waste. The justification that plastic bottles are the most practical solution is simply not acceptable, especially when other luxury hotels have successfully transitioned away from them without compromising their reputation or guest satisfaction. Given the premium rates this hotel charges, investing in more sustainable practices should be a priority.

Due to this issue, I’m inclined to rate the hotel at one or even zero for now. Hopefully, they will reconsider their practices to align with the expectations of environmentally conscious guests.

However no hotel can be amazing without the sterling service of the staff. Yve the person who assisted us when we arrived was very accommodating and assured us of so many things given it was our first time in Singapore. Everyone else was always willing to assist and make your stay comfortable which was amazingly refreshing. At the infinity pool, which on its own is amazing, the staff was on point with everything. The gym was awesome and professional and so was the staff. I would go back anytime.

review_text:
Visiting Singapore and staying at Marina Bay Sands has been on our bucket list for a few years now. We recently visited and we can say honestly that it did not disappoint. We love this hotel. Went with our two teen-age daughters. We had a beautiful view of the fountains and Burj Khalifa from our 17th floor balcony. Room accomdations were luxurious and roomy. We felt no detail was missed. Loved the comfiness of the beds, top notch linens and pillows. The Joe Malone co-branded toiletries were superb. The recent renovation came out really nice. We had a smart commode in our room that made even the "daily duty" a luxurious experience !!!! We ate at Spago up on the roof, both poolside and in the restaurant. Food was great - loved the spring rolls. The pool is the star of the show. A professional photographer appeared and offered to take some candids and we were glad we did! Another great thing about the hotel is location. You are right in the middle of the Marina section of downtown, making it walkable to the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, the Super Tree Grove, Art/Science Center, and Lau Pa Sat (the oldest Hawker center in the city). Plus you have a world class mall attached to the hotel. The scents permeated throughout the hotel and with a perfect amount of balance.

My wife and I enjoy playing poker recreationally. I have never played poker in a casino so I thought I would it try it for the first time at this casino. It is a small casino, which for me was a great thing. If you are looking to play your first hand of poker in a casino I believe the last thing I needed was an intimidating casino floor. It is layed out with a nice flow - you cannot get lost in there - and the dealer who handled my table was a true professional who patiently got me up to speed on the difference between casino Texas Hold'em and the typical tournament style most people play at home. I was at a table with 3 Chinese nationals and they were a lot of fun to play with, everyone cheering each other on. I had a great experience in the casino.

We also ate at RISE for the buffet. This was a neat cultural experience as well. The food choices cover multiple culinary cultural specialities and all of the choices were a bit overwhelming. It does feel very busy in there. That being said, the staff was attentive there and the food was really good.

We absolutely will stay here again.. Primarily for the quality of the accommodations (post-renovation), location, the iconic pool (of course), the many dining options, and the luxurious feel of the entire experience there.

review_text:
I had the pleasure of experiencing exceptional customer service at Marina Bay Sands Hotel, thanks to Pauline from the premium team.From the moment I arrived, Pauline's warmth and professionalism stood out. She greeted me with a genuine smile and went above and beyond to ensure my stay was perfect.

Pauline’s attention to detail was remarkable. She anticipated my needs before I even voiced them and provided insightful recommendations that truly enhanced my visit. Her knowledge of the hotel's amenities and the local area was impressive, and her personalized touch made me feel like a valued guest rather than just another customer.

Whether it was arranging a last-minute reservation or offering a thoughtful gesture, Pauline's dedication to excellence was evident. She embodies the high standards of Marina Bay Sands, turning a regular stay into a memorable experience. Her commitment to outstanding service sets a benchmark for what hospitality should be.

Thank you, Pauline, for making my stay unforgettable. Your exceptional service is a testament to the quality of Marina Bay Sands Hotel.

review_title: Are you willing to pay the bucks?
review_text:
Staying here was a tough decision for us. It was our 40th wedding anniversary and we had stayed at MBS for one night 6 years ago. My wife and I were dazzled by the experience and so when we decided to celebrate our anniversary in Singapore, we wanted that same experience. However, the price had doubled since our last stay to nearly $1000 a night, so a three night stay would be nearly $3k!!

But the lure of the world's highest infinity pool and a huge room on the 57th floor like we had last time led us to book our stay. I made it a point to ask for a city view room on a high floor, but when we showed up, all they would do for us was a garden view on the 14th floor. Major disappointment! The front desk clerk took a whole half hour trying to search for different combinations, but unless I was willing to pony up another $9,000 a night, there was nothing she could (or would) do for us. We are not rich people but will splurge occasionally for something like MBS.
Other than our disappointment, our stay was fine. The hotel is amazing. We spent much time in the pool and were able to watch the National Day celebration from the edge of the pool. So the decision is up to you, if you don't mind spending a lot of money for a unique, one of a kind experience, then this is the place to go.

Everything else in this hotel is having nothing similar with the meaning of being LUXURY
Service is just horrible… but it is hard to expect anything else due to staying is such a large hotel
Of course that I would came back as there are no other option

review_text:
Our 2 night stay at Marina Bay Sands did not disappoint. It’s the hotel offers everything which makes the stay so easy and comfortable, there’s really no need to go very far as the hotel has it all. Great shopping, amazing restaurants, gardens by the bay. The service we experienced was great. We arrived early and left our bags to go exploring and they called us when our room was ready before the check in time.
The pool is the real highlight. The views are incredible. I wish they would section an area off as adults only though because there were children splashing around everywhere and it’s not what everyone wants. The pool area is so large they could easily have 2 separate areas. There is a separate children’s pool but the children were everywhere.
We stayed in tower 3. Our room was perfect, great view, luxury toiletries, cleaned really well. There are renovation works being carried out to tower 3 though so we were told there would be some noise in the day and we would need to access the pool from another tower. Accessing the pool from another tower was a bit of an inconvenience as we had to walk through the lobby in swimwear and go down to go back up etc. We were disappointed to be able to hear building works from our room as late as 8pm!! Whilst it didn’t ruin our stay the hotel could’ve done something to compensate for it such as a voucher towards drinks or a meal or something.

review_title: What an amazing experience! Definitely worth splashing out for.
review_text:
We stayed at Marina Bay Sands for the last night of our Singapore holiday as a treat. Wow! It was truly wonderful from start to finish. We didn’t leave the hotel for about 29 hours to make the most of it. Everything & all staff were 5 stars - from our very welcoming check in (with early check in!), pool wait staff, friendly life guards - all staff members. The rooftop pool was even better than we imagined and is open late for late night swim and more cocktails by the pool!
Our highlight was the sunrise Sound Meditation with Karu - this was one of our best experiences ever. Karu has the most beautiful presence and the meditation and location was almost magical.
We were given late check out and that included day pass for facilities and a reserved shower room for one hour prior to departure - This was a hotel room without a bed, so we had a full bathroom with all amenities and empty room with luggage stands to re-pack our bags.
I can’t say enough good things about our stay and will definitely be back again soon.

review_text:
Telling about Marina Bay is difficult, it must be tried. We stayed 2 nights from August 16 to 18, rooms on the 20th floor of tower 2.
The view from the rooms on the Garden By the Bay is incredible and allows you to see the light show from a private stage.
The structure is immense, in addition to the hotel there is also the shopping center with incredible shops, never seen a Rolex showcase with practically the entire collection. The most spectacular thing is of course the infinity pool on the 57th floor that allows you to see incredible sunsets with the Singapore Sky Line.
I had rewarded with breakfast option and I think it is the best thing, an incredible offer for all tastes and for all types of cuisine.
The rooms were very spacious, large bed, 100'' television, very large bathroom with huge bathtub shower and automatic bathroom!!!
In experience to try once in a lifetime given the fairly important cost!
