review_text:
We stayed here for one night to experience the iconic hotel and incredible pool and it was totally worth it. We would normally avoid hotels of this size at all costs, as they tend to lack the personal experience that smaller 5* hotels provide, but this couldn’t have been further from the Marina Bay Sands experience.

From the moment we walked in the doors to when we left the next morning it was wonderful. The staff are the key to this hotel’s success: everyone we spoke to was lovely, very friendly, and helpful. Of particular note were the doormen Johan and Clyde, Julie Ann and Han on reception, and Ravi by the pool - all wonderful assets to the hotel. The staff all seem to go out of their way to be friendly and it made it such a lovely experience. Our room was upgraded upon arrival and we were given a gorgeous big corner room, with a view of both the city and the gardens by the bay - it was truly stunning, and had a massive balcony. The property is truly immaculate and once you get in the lift and go any floor above the lobby it is very quiet and private.

Now for the pool - this is certainly the highlight, it is stunning, with very attentive staff. There are some stunning jacuzzis on the gardens by the bay side as well, and somehow the pool never feels too full of people. Overall, this hotel is worth the hype, and is totally worth the stay to have such a wonderful experience. An immaculate job has been done to create such a personal experience in such a large hotel, and I look forward to returning one day.

review_title: Sunset In The Sky experience - absolutely amazing!! 😃
review_text:
An absolutely enjoyable experience was had by us last night on the top of the Marina Bay Sands (MBS) hotel, tower 3

My wife was browsing for things to do while we were on a 4 night short stay in Singapore
She came across the Sunset In The Sky experience on the Sunset deck of MBS
The cost was $108 SGD each but don’t let that put you off of what it had to offer

We assembled at the lobby area of tower 3 then were met by Adam (who was our guide) explaining what the late afternoon & early evening entailed
He was very pleasant & relational making us feel quite at home
After waiting a short time we were met by another 2 couples who joined us & then we were escorted through the crowd into a very fast but smooth moving lift.. that was quite amazing in itself! 😊

We had chocolate (very tasty & smooth), champagne (Pipers Brook Tasmanian) included in the ticket plus an excellent view of Singapore harbour & further afield
Angel brought us the chocolates & wine making us feeling quite relaxed
We sat at a bar style round table watching the sunset then we were politely shown around the deck overlooking the Gardens By The Bay where a light show took place @ 7.45pm.

Emily was our guide working in tandem with Adam who pointed out particular landmarks as well as being able to see a small portion of Indonesia’s land mass etc.

As the sun started to drop it became comfortable as there was a gentle breeze blowing around us & at the same time, lights on buildings, structures etc. were starting to switch on

Our photographer (Amisur) (?)… sincerest apologize if I’ve miss spelt your name)) did a wonderful job taking pics & each of us received a mini album with different images to the other
24 hours later we will be able to see all the pics online in a dedicated web portal

For further enjoyment to our experience, we were able to pick from a menu some eats & more drinks (of which we did)
The 4 of us in our group simply watched the harbour view quietly for quite a long time making us feeling quite relaxed.. very enjoyable 

Adam said we could stay there right up to 10pm. if we wanted but as great as the light show was & the harbour view, we were all a little tired after arriving into Singapore on the same day leaving there @ 8.30pm.

Huge thanks again to Adam, Emily, Angel, Hooda & Amisir

Thoroughly recommend this experience when next in Singapore! 😊

review_text:
This place is not cheap but that’s ok. You pay and hope to have some sense of…. Something worth the price/some value? Great check in experience, but the pre-experience should’ve been the red light- this place just wants your money. Let me count thy ways:

1) When I booked the room, I paid the rate that would allow us to cancel. Then I got an email saying I couldn’t cancel. I screenshot what I saw and they screen shot the cancellation policy. Got it but they allowed me to book a room that says I could cancel.

2) We learned we would be there during Singapore National Day, same day as my son’s birthday. I asked if the pool would be open or if I needed to pay extra to be at the pool. No clear response but basically, the response suggested I needed to pay extra. I did- at Ce La Vi. Early bird special. Told my college-daughter about it (BTW- we were in Singapore because she was there on internship) and she told het college-friends so we got more tickets! We were told (website and the many people we asked), come early- first come first serve. Got there early and then were told we could be there until they can sell the table. Why am I paying more and getting there early?

Then, my kids were sent a different route and ended up at a different location, Observation Deck. They tried to order a drink and were told they couldn’t because they didn’t have the right ticket? What?! You directed us there!!!!

3) Talked to the manager- he tried to make it right. Asked us what drinks we wanted and then asked us for our drink coupons that came with the purchase of the ticket. What?! I am paying for your mistake?

Cool place, but US-capitalism at its best. Made for Crazy Rich Asian for sure….

review_text: Marina Bay Sands, a striking architectural marvel located in Singapore, is renowned for its iconic design and luxury offerings. The complex, which opened in 2010, features a three-tower structure connected by a stunning sky park that offers panoramic views of the city skyline. The resort includes a high-end hotel, a vast casino, an expansive shopping mall, and a diverse range of dining options. Its infinity pool, perched on the 57th floor, is one of the highest in the world and provides a breathtaking vantage point over the city. Marina Bay Sands has become a symbol of modern Singapore, blending cutting-edge design with world-class hospitality and entertainment.

review_text:
I was really looking forward to staying at this hotel after seeing all the pictures online and advertisements over the years. I arrived at 3pm which was check in time and there was no room ready for us. After waiting in line for 10 minutes and then waiting another 35 minutes finally the customer services staff at the check in desk found a room for us. I was disappointed and frustrated that the room was not available at their advertised check in time.

When we finally arrived at the room, the room smelled like a mix of perfume and cigarette smoke. I called front desk and asked for a room change but they said they will send housekeeping . Housekeeping came over with a machine that sprays perfume. I kindly informed the staff I don’t want more perfume. I don’t like the smell of perfume. I want a room that doesn’t smell like perfume covered smoke.

Needless to say this was a very disappointing experience after traveling 8 hours to get here to not have our room ready as advertised, and then worse to be stuck with a smokey room. This hotel is too big and not managed well based on my experience. It doesn’t live up to its hype or reputation to even provide the basic expectations of a clean smoke free timely delivered room. I would suggest staying at a different establishment.

Of the onsite restaurants we tried Koma and Mott 32 and both were amazing.

We were just overlooking the Gardens by the Bay and had a huge balcony perfect for morning coffee.
The swimming pool is stunning with great city views. Having this in mind I highly recommend the garden view for your room so you can get the best of both worlds.
the CeLaVi bar and restaurant are excellent and the views are again stunning!
It is pricey but if you can afford at least for one night, it’s worth it!

review_text:
Pros:

- Super convenient location. Walking distance (w/o leaving the hotel) to The Shoppes mall, Art & Science museum, Garden by the Bay. Amazing restaurants are at The Shoppe that we frequented daily - Ding Tai Fung, Yardbird, Milos, Toast Box to name a few. The hawker center was filled with amazing local foods & desserts.

- Wonderful daily breakfast spot right by the MBS rooftop infinity pool. Free access to the observation deck.

- The Sands family suite comes with unlimited free tickets to the Art & Science museum, sampan rides at the mall, digital light canvas etc. The kids room is equiped with a bunk bed, tv, magical wallpaper, books, backpacks & accesories, that kept our 2 & 6 yr old contented for the week.

- To top it off, the Premium Services team, especially Charmaine was amazing and made our stay at MBS pretty amazing! She took the time to show us different room options that we could upgrade to, addressed any concerns that we had, and came up with a curated list of kid friendly spots for our kids to visit, made the time to have a friendly chat with us about living in Singapore as we chatted about how culturally different our countries were. Charmaine definitely made our family feel well cared for during our stay at MBS.

review_title: Amazing stay, thank you to all the MBS staff 😍
review_text:
I never usually write reviews but felt I had to after our stay at marina bay sands.

What can I say other than this place is amazing and we were so well looked after.

We arrived early at 10.40 and from the start we were treated like royalty, our doors to taxi were opened and our luggage swiftly taken away and looked after until our rooms were ready. We were there shown to the front desk to check in.

We stood in a very short queue to check in, and a kind gentleman (I’m sorry I can’t remember his name) took us to the vip booth, where we were given premium treatment, and check in was quick and they found us a room that was ready, so we could take advantage of the facilities sooner. We were shown to our room by frina who was so kind, and welcoming. She showed us to our room and explained how everything worked, she asked us if we were celebrating anything special and I told her we were celebrating my son’s 16th birthday.

10 minutes after she left we received a call from her, to let us know that she had arranged afternoon tea, which was complimentary and had also arranged for a complimentary transfer to the airport when we check out in three days time. This was so thoughtful, so imagine my surprise when after a swim we returned to our room and there was a plate of chocolates and balloons, we are not used to this kind of treatment and were really taken aback and we felt so special.

The hotel itself is nothing short of amazing, our room overlooked the gardens of the bay and we saw the light show every night. We had robes and slippers and lots of bathroom essentials. The bed was comfy and we also had a put up bed for our son and still had lots of room. The mini bar was stocked with soft drinks and snacks and replenished daily.

We had access via wats app to frina who booked restaurants for us and was accessible for all of our other needs.

We had breakfast every day at origin and bloom which is the coffee bar and Jon was an absolute sweetheart, he remembered all of our names and our orders including how I liked just a dash of milk in my tea. This was very impressive and it’s little touches like this that make you feel special.

Now on to the best bit, the infinity pool is the main reason we splashed out on this hotel, it did not disappoint. It is magnificent and the view is outstanding, it wasn’t too busy and we spent a lot of time here. You do not need to worry about towels, suncream or water as it’s all provided as you walk in. There are plenty of beds around the pool, not once did we ever have to get up early and reserve a bed like we have in previous hotels. There are poolside waiters who bring you drinks, a big shout out to Chenna, like Jon he remembered the drinks we liked and our names 😊

Our flight was not until 11pm, so I enquired about a late check out and we were able to stay until 1pm which again was complimentary, so we spent the morning making use of the pool. When we then had transport back to the airport, Charlie was our driver he was hilarious and made the sad journey to the airport (we didn’t want to leave) funny. We were then greeted by a lovely lady (again sorry can’t remember her name) who took use through the airport and helped with checking in and taking us the the correct terminal.

We are a normal family, who work hard, we are not used to staying at luxurious hotels and saved up for a long time to stay at MBS and I have to say it’s one of the most memorable experiences at a hotel and it was worth every single penny. Thank you to all of the staff at MBS for making us feel special and making our stay one of a lifetime.

If you are thinking of staying do not hesitate to book, you will not regret it 😊

review_text:
My husband and I visited Singapore and decided to stay at Marina Bay Sands, and boy, our stay did not disappoint! The highlight of our stay was the infinity pool on the 57th floor of the hotel. It was amazing! Even though the hotel itself has a staggering 2,600 guest rooms, we
did not feel that it was crowded. We had enough space to swim and lounge around. And another thing, we did not have to go far to explore our “must-see” attractions list during our stay since the hotel was centrally located. Gardens by the Bay nightly light show was just around the corner from the hotel, as well as the Art Science Museum. The hotel staff was also wonderful and friendly.
The only negative experience I had was at the Food Hall in The Shoppes of the hotel. I ordered food at Rasapura food court, and I had to question my bill with the cashier because she was overcharging what I ordered. She knew I was not a local resident and overcharged me.
Overall, my hotel stay was excellent and I would stay here again on my next visit to Singapore.
review_translated:
My husband and I visited Singapore and decided to stay at Marina Bay Sands, and boy, our stay did not disappoint! The highlight of our stay was the infinity pool on the 57th floor of the hotel. It was amazing! Even though the hotel itself has a staggering 2,600 guest rooms, we
did not feel that it was crowded. We had enough space to swim and lounge around. And another thing, we did not have to go far to explore our “must-see” attractions list during our stay since the hotel was centrally located. Gardens by the Bay nightly light show was just around the corner from the hotel, as well as the Art Science Museum. The hotel staff was also wonderful and friendly.
The only negative experience I had was at the Food Hall in The Shoppes of the hotel. I ordered food at Rasapura food court, and I had to question my bill with the cashier because she was overcharging what I ordered. She knew I was not a local resident and overcharged me.
Overall, my hotel stay was excellent and I would stay here again on my next visit to Singapore.

review_text:
We cannot thank the staff of MBS enough for the overwhelming experience we had. From the moment we were picked up by the hotel transfer, to the time we were dropped back to the airport, our experience transcended expectations.

Our trip was for our 20-year anniversary which was a very special event in our lives. The MBS staff made the stay so memorable and extremely romantic. From the decadent food to the alluring cocktails, the staff’s attention to detail and willingness to proactively plan events to enhance an array of unforgettable moments cannot be understated.

A special thank you to Paul and Danial from the butler team who made our stay so pleasurable. They catered to our every need and made our special anniversary trip opulent and sublime. Both Paul and Danial extended us every bit of courtesy, care and customisation to make the holiday distinct.

Sue in the Sky Residence took very good care of us during our dining experiences. In fact, Daniel and his entire team in the Sky Residence were a delight and treated us like family.

Carmichael is a master of cocktails and an artist when it comes to bartending. His magnificent imagination and creativity in making creative cocktails was only matched by his kindness and friendly nature.

The massages with Jane and Lisa were heavenly. A thank you to Shirely for the amazing poolside service. Robby was wonderful with assisting us at the airport.

Truly, every staff member we came in contact with was fantastic. You have such a remarkable team, and we cannot wait to return. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The staff have truly created an immeasurable experience for us and lifelong unbeatable memories.

Other notable staff included Grace, Audrey, Joel, Vella, Ella, Anthony, Camilla and Hua Yi. Thank you all once again. We look forward to another trip to MBS in the near future.

review_title: Exceeded Expectations By a Country Mile
review_text:
Only booked here for a recent three day stay in beautiful and clean Singapore because my wife insisted. I was sure this was an overpriced tourist trap, based solely on word of mouth. Boy was I wrong.

First, we booked the Sands Premier Room with breakfast, which I fully expected to be on a low floor with a view of a retaining wall, but imagine my surprise when we arrived at fabulous Changi and upon clearing customs, were greeted with a person with my name on a sign. Turns out the hotel had arranged a complimentary car service for us to the hotel. Wow.

Upon arrival at the hotel (which is as dramatic a building as you will ever see), we had a personal greeter to give us in room check-in services, Double wow. Upon entering the room, we found it was on about the 23rd floor as I recall, facing Gardens by the Bay (which I actually prefer), with a view extending on to the Straits of Malacca, and had a wonderful veranda with beautiful vegetation and a large sitting area. Also welcoming us were a bouquet of flowers, chilled bottle of champagne (which we didnt drink) and chocolates and fruit. All because I had mentioned at booking that it was our anniversary. I’m nobody special either, but I truly appreciate the unbelievable hospitality we were shown. Triple and Quadruple wow.

The room itself was stunning. In Tower 1 so I cannot speak to the ongoing construction that may affect Tower 3 where the entry level rooms are but ours was obviously renovated and had an outstanding bath, with double vanity and a comfortable bed along with a free rollaway bed for our son. Total luxury all around, including automatic curtains, japanese toilet, bath salts for the luxurious tub, amazing bath robes and a leather covered safe.

I was leery about the rooftop pool as I thought it would be an overcrowded nightmare, but contrary to that belief, it was incredibly manageable, especially in the mornings when there were very few people there. I note that Tower 1 entry to the rooftop pool uses the Lavo elevator bank whereas I believe Tower 2 and 3 use the opposite side of the hotel’s elevator banks so the Tower 2 and 3 side seemed more crowded when we were there. Also, Spago sort of cuts the pool area in half so people tend to stay on their side of the rooftop pool.

The breakfast at Spago on the roof was ok, not great. Limited options but the service was friendly and nice and the atmosphere and views cant be beat. That rooftop is just plain gobsmacking all around. The breakfast service at Rise on the ground floor, however, which we sadly tried only once was nothing short of fantastic.
Perhaps the best breakfast buffet I have ever seen outside Italy. Amazing, fantastic and exceptional.

The hotel is attached to an incredible mall and also has a casino. Also has great access to the MRT and from our balcony we watched the GBTB light show. Just a one of a kind experience and I was truly amazed to find that all my fears about being duped into an overpriced hotel were so far from reality that I felt embarrassed that I ever thought that. This is one of those hotel experiences that you just dont care about what you spent because it is truly that, an experience. Thank you Marina Bay Sands staff for being so kind and exceptional.

I've been inquiring from time to time for quite some time about staying in a good room, and I felt like the Paiza room at the top was quite controlled, like it was for big guests in a casino. (The reservation people were going to check with someone and didn't give an immediate answer about their availability. We were not casino guests, we just wanted to stay.)

In May (not Golden Week), the three of us stayed four nights in a dual view room with two bedrooms and two baths, which cost around ¥740,000 a day, including the paiza sky residence. Around 5 years ago the orchid suite dual view (which at the time had lounge access in this class) was around 230,000 per night (although it was a bit lower than the paiza floor and a one-bedroom suite), so I thought it was quite expensive. It was a double punch of inflation & yen depreciation.

In the lounge, food used to be snacks like sandwiches and canapés, but in the evening, the food is authentic and becomes a proper dinner. On the other hand, the afnun is fixed, so I get tired of being the same every day.
The seats were more spacious than before, and I felt like I could take my time.
It is now only available to people in paiza rooms.

I wasn't sure if it was for heavy guests at the casino, or if it would automatically follow me if I stayed in my paiza room, but there was a private immigration service at Changi Airport called Jet Quay that put it on for me (they told me it was going to be made or I couldn't, but it did eventually). When we get off the plane, the buggy will be waiting for us and it will take us to a different place from the other guests and we have our own immigration officer. I checked in with zero wait time and was relaxing in the lounge, and someone had saved my luggage for me, and Alphard was waiting right outside the lounge (the fat guest was apparently a Rolls-Royce) and the attendant put my luggage in Alphard. Total stress zero. I went there by ANA, but a lot of other passengers kept coming down from the gates around me, and I wondered what would have happened if I had just gone through immigration normally. Even on the way back, the ANA gate was the furthest away, and they took me to the gate in a buggy, which helped a lot. (They said I could apply directly, maybe $350 per person.) By the way, if you want to see jewel falls, JAL is probably closer.

The paiza room comes with a butler, and I thought it might be good if people wanted us to serve them in a variety of ways, but the sense of distance and communication was difficult. The official language seems to be English, but I don't feel very native, and there have been a few occasions where I've been frustrated by not being able to get it across, depending on the person (we've lived in the US in the past). But I felt a willingness to cover my mistakes.
I was making a Reservation for breakfast at 8 o'clock and got a phone call at about 7:35, and I was like, I'm coming to pick you up, and I'm kind of hectic right now. If you are someone who can do a lot of things on your own to a certain extent, I think there are moments when you feel a little unnecessary.
If you ask them, they make tea for you and put hot water in your bath.

The infinity pool was so crowded that there were cabana seats reserved for paiza, which was great, but the rest of us wandered around looking for seats.

The room was great to see both sides of the city and sea, and the shows on both sides, including the Garden by the Bay side.
It was convenient to just put the iPhone on the side table and charge it (maybe just paiza). Karaoke was included.
Cleaning was normal, but there were three TVs and one remote was out of battery.
The phones were all cordless, and when I talked to Mr. Butler for a long time, the battery seemed to run out, but the hotel said they wanted to do something about it.
I asked for a turndown and they did it normally (though I didn't really need one).
Cleaning clothes comes with two free clothes a day.
You can also have three meals if you substitute Afnun for lunch,
Including the above airport transfer and private entry and exit services
Overall, I didn't think it was really expensive.
In Japan, for example, at the Bougari Hotel, it might be cheap to watch a small room cost 300,000 yen a night, or a two-bedroom room cost 1.2 million yen just to stay.

They made restaurant Reservations, but they also made Reservations for TWG Gardens, which they said were not normally available.

On the way home, I think it was between 7am and 7am.
There were about 30 people, butlers lined up, waiting for the big guests to arrive and it was spectacular. It was like coming in a big Rolls Royce.

Even in Japan, there is the idea of a casino, but Japan has a poor or petty side to everything, and there is a strange tendency to seek equality, so I thought, can we provide a service that satisfies VIPs around the world? (I don't think it's easy to have an immigration office like Haneda Airport where only rich people can go first.)

I hear that a fourth building will be built next to MBS, which may change the landscape. I think he said there were about 500 rooms all in suites.

Does communication happen sometimes? It was good except for this.

review_title: Construction not declared at time of payment
review_text:
Booked and paid $1000 per night 3 months prior. Allocated a 26 story room in tower 3. About 8 floors above major reconstruction that wasn’t advised prior. Second day raining and couldn’t stay in our room due to hours 6+ of continual jack-hammers. They work to 9pm. Hotel only allowed after our request, $100 credit off our additional onsite spending. Real cost about $10 I guess?
Excessive charges on all things and not honest to pre-declare the construction.
Never again.

review_title: Excellent stay in an iconic hotel
review_text: Loved this iconic hotel! We had a 13th floor premier two queen bed room with a Gardens by the Bay view. It was a perfect floor to be on because the view of the gardens was fantastic. The amenities in the room were wonderful (iron, steamer on request, and all of the toiletries one could want). The pool made the process of the stay worth it because being able to relax and swim at the top of MBS was a bucket list item for us. The staff was very helpful and the hotel didn’t feel overly crowded. The gym was also very nice and one of the nicer hotel gyms I have seen. Highly recommend and definitely recommend booking a room with a garden view.

review_text:
“Just Wow!”
Stayed for one night at the Marina Bay Sands. Here is a summary of our experience: We were welcomed right when we stepped out of our ride by Jet. JET was so welcoming and friendly. He took our luggage and asked if this was our first visit to the hotel. He gave us a mini verbal tour as he lead us to the reception area where we were welcomed by Patrick. PATRICK (he calls himself trouble. Lol!) made sure we weren’t bored as we waited our turn to check in at the front. He was amusingly entertaining and kind. He lead us over to Nicole. NICOLE was so pleasant and made suggestions as to what we can do for the evening and explained where all the facilities around the hotel were. We got an unexpected upgrade to a higher floor! Thanks Nicole! We did a little walkabout before we headed to our room which was spectacular! Our view was the waterfront and the light show. Amazing! YEZAR brought our luggage up and you can tell that he’s a “people person.” Such a pleasant man and let us know that if there was anything we needed to just contact him. The infinity pool up on the 57th floor is nothing like what we’ve experienced! Just fantastic! Service all around was outstanding. We weren’t sure what to expect from this hotel. Staying at the Marina Bay Sands was part of our bucket list but I think we are ready to go back again for a longer period. All the hype about this hotel is more than expected! Thank you to the staff! Can’t wait to visit again!
06 Jul 2024

review_title: Wedding Celebration at Marina Bay Sands
review_text:
My wife and I had our wedding party at Sands Expo and Convention Center during the end of June.

Marina Bay Sands was our top choice for location, status, service and quality. But the winning factor to make it the top event location in Singapore is their service team, especially when we were assisted by events executive, Suhana Sudil.

We did not had an easy start as the previous event manager left the team and her service quality was honestly, not the best. Basically, it was hard to talk to her after we signed the contract (a nightmare for all wedding couples). But Suhana turned the tables around.

Suhana was very understanding to our needs to help make our event a unique one for not only us, the couple, but the guests as well. As newly weds, we do not know what to expect, weeks before the wedding, she went the extra mile to explain to us what to expect and run us through the event. She couple easily point out the blind spots we missed out and help to fill in the gaps perfectly.

Personally, i've ran events in many Singapore event spaces and hotels due to my work requirements and i know what it is typically like to run an event. However, the intangible service quality she delivers is a rare gem to find.

Other than her own delivery, she is able to concert the entire team, including security and banquet to help out. This is true leadership at display.

My wife and I were overwhelmed by the praises of the event space and this has to be the best effort of Suhana and her team. We would like to sincerely thank Su and her team in making our wedding a memorable one.

Thank you,
Ryan

review_text:
My family and I have been fortunate to stay in many fine hotels in many different countries.

While certainly our room was extremely beautiful and the hotel and paiza sky residence were amazing It is the hotel staff and in particular the Butler staff that made our time at MBS the best hotel resort stay that we have ever had.

The butler staff attention to every detail, their friendliness and professionalism cannot be overstated and was simply the best customer service that we have ever experienced

While we were simply on a family holiday and not “highrollers“ we were treated as if we were the most important people in the hotel by the Butler staff.

They were incredible and we will be back to stay at Marina Bay Sands soon because of the butler staff more than any other reason

I would single out Max in particular however that is only because we spent more time with him than we did with the other staff. Each and every one of the Butler staff was truly outstanding.

Thank you for making such a memorable vacation for us and we look forward to seeing you soon

review_title: Exceptional Hotel with Exceptional Staff and Facilities
review_text:
I booked a King Deluxe room with the Gardens by the Bay view which is one of the standard type rooms at the hotel. Check in was 3pm but we arrived at 2pm and reception provided two temporary passes to access the facilities at the hotel such as the Infinity Pool on Level 57, which is only accessible for hotel guests.

Reception then emailed us just before 3pm to inform us that the room was ready and surprisingly, upgraded us to a suite in Tower 3. The room was stunning, with 2 balconies, one with seating for 4 the other with seating for 8. A large living area and entrance hallway. Bathroom had a shower, bath tub and his/hers sink along with branded toiletries. The minibar is stocked and replenished daily free of charge and the hotel also provided us with 8 bottles of water.

With a birthday celebration planned, the hotel left an individual cake in the room which was a brilliant gesture. The cake was delicious as well!

We visited the infinity pool each morning at 6am to take in the sunrise and enjoy the pool whilst it had fewer patrons. Towels are provided when you access the pool and sun beds are on a first come first served basis (same for day beds although premium guests can reserve these I believe).

The hotel staff are all pleasant and polite in every aspect and this clear that this is a professionally run hotel with a passion for quality and standards. The hotel lobby is close to the Bayfront MRT station and the Shoppes at MB are easily accessible as it is adjacent to the hotel.

Overall a fantastic first time visit and one that we have every intention of making again soon.

Thank you MBS for a memorable stay!

review_title: Say Hello to Moe and you’ll never look back! Great hotel!
review_text:
Have stayed at MBS 8 times now, and what keeps me coming back is the staff. Sure the hotels nice and the rooms are incredible (not to mention the view) but it’s the team members who really make MBS special and unlike any other.

And that’s everyone, right down to the lifeguards like Moe who always make our visits special. He goes above and beyond every time and makes the SkyPool an unforgettable experience.

So thank you Moe and and the other team members I’ve run into at MBS (and been lucky enough to meet), it’s you who’ll keep me coming back for life.

review_title: Disappointing. Condescension. Stay at Oasia Downtown Instead
review_text:
I stayed in Singapore for four nights. My friends and I flew from America and South Korea to reunite (a 22 hour flight for me). We stayed our first three nights at Oasia Downtown (which was phenomenal) and splurged for a room at Marina Bay Sands on our final night.

I upgraded our room to premier specifically for the view—paying around $1500.00 for what was supposed to be a special night with friends. Unfortunately, my stay at MBS was the worst lodging experience we had while in Singapore.

Upon arrival, an employee of the hotel by the check-in line asked me and my friends if we were Deluxe (the cheapest rooms) or Premier. I told him, “I’m pretty sure we’re Premier, but I’ll check my reservation.” His response, “I’m pretty sure you’re Deluxe.” I showed him my reservation confirmation, Premier. He said he was sorry and walked away from the area before I could catch his name. This man made a value judgement upon looking at us, and it was insulting.

Then, our room was not ready at 3:30pm (30 minutes after check-in). We asked the hotel to store my friend’s insulin in a refrigerator until our room was ready as this was time sensitive—and keeping her insulin cool a must. We were told our only option was to accept a room on the 8th floor if we needed to store the insulin right away. We had no choice.

The view was not what we payed for, and it was extremely disappointing. Additionally, guests at the hotel made status judgements of me when getting off at the 8th floor. I was literally called poor. For $1500 for one night, we were looked down upon by guests and staff alike.

I messaged the hotel, and I did not hear back from them until late at night, saying our room was technically premier (in spite of being on one of the lowest floors). While they admitted they handled the situation poorly, they did nothing to rectify the situation.

Was the view from the pool nice? Sure. Was the hospitality of the staff or the accommodations worth $1500? No. Marina Bay Sands is all hype. Save your money. I highly recommend Oasia Downtown, where staff are friendly and accommodating.

review_text:
Honeymoon Heaven at Banyan Tree Spa
Celebrating our honeymoon at Banyan Tree Spa was the perfect choice. The luxurious ambiance and attentive staff instantly put us at ease. We opted for the Deep Tissue Massage, hoping to release travel-induced tension.
The skilled therapist worked their magic, targeting our knots and tight muscles with expert precision. The pressure was firm yet soothing, melting away our stress with each stroke. We both felt incredibly relaxed and rejuvenated afterwards.
Beyond the massage, the spa's facilities were equally impressive. The tranquil relaxation area, complete with plush loungers and soothing music, was the perfect place to unwind before and after our treatments.
Overall, our Banyan Tree Spa experience was an unforgettable part of our honeymoon. The combination of exceptional service, skilled therapists, and luxurious facilities made it a true oasis of tranquility. We highly recommend it for any couple seeking a romantic and rejuvenating escape.

review_text: This review is for the Marina Bay Sands gym. Firstly, I must say wow! The service they provide is genuinely first-class. The gym is a good-sized hotel gym with ample cardio equipment, machines, and free weights. It is spacious, clean, and well-equipped with towels and disinfectants. The bathroom and changing area is cleaner than my own bathroom (which is saying something). They offer complimentary amenities to freshen up. Lastly, the staff were incredibly helpful and attentive throughout my visit. They offered to get me water, make me coffee, and even provided a mat for me. A big thank you to Oddie, Uma, and Lucy for making this trip to the gym so memorable. For those staying at Marina Bay Sands, free classes are available on the observation deck in the mornings. Marina Bay Sands

review_title: Paying for the view, name and location
review_text:
Think this is overhyped, especially given the high price. Don't think it started off well with a long 30-45 minute wait to check in. Then they seem to have lost my request on room location not to be near an elevator despite being on one of the upper floors, which meant I was paying quite a lot. On top of this, there was constant drilling from construction work during the day which I only found about upon arrival. Really think they should have offered a discount as a result.

Room was nice with a great view of the city below. And the hotel staff were polite and the cleaning staff were generous with amenities.

Will admit the place is modern and convenient with the mall & ability to access to the roof. The infinity pool is nice and exclusive to guests

Think it's worth spending one night but not 2 like I did

review_title: One of the best experiences of your life
review_text: This is a once in a lifetime experience - I mean, I've done it more than once - but this place is so surreal, that it needs to be on your bucket list. From the immaculate check-in experience, to the beauty of walking into your room 40+ stories high.... the Infinity Pool is a moment, setting up on a deckchair, ordering cocktails and food... enjoying the pool itself. Can also highly recommend Lavo - amazing seafood buffet. Also - as it was honeymoon they gifted us cake and champagne. Impeccable.

review_title: Exemplary service- truly a bucket list experience!
review_text:
The experience we had staying at the Marina Bay Sands was like no other experience we have ever had.

The team truly do go above and beyond to make your stay as memorable as possible. We received a message from the Premium Service Team on the morning of check-in. They arranged a complimentary pick-up service, and upon check-in we were told that we had been upgraded. As it was our honeymoon the team had left a bouquet of flowers, balloons, a cake and bottle of wine in our room to celebrate!

They made the stay feel so incredibly special and we can’t thank the team (especially Eunice) enough for helping make our stay so memorable.

Aside from the exemplary service, the room was spacious and packed with amenities that just made us feel at home. Finally the pool is soo incredibly special. The views are stunning and we happily spent most of the day soaking in the sights and relaxing.

The Marina Bay Sands is iconic and staying exceeded all our expectations.

review_text:
The Marina Bay Sands is not just a hotel, but an experience and a tourist magnet. The room furnishings and especially the size of the room (approx. 47 sqm) is phenomenal. The view of the port of Singapore and the “Garden by the Bay” is sensational. There is even a small balcony on the 44th floor. A huge flat screen TV in the room. It was the biggest I have ever seen in a hotel room. We didn’t use it though, there is so much else to see.
The design throughout the hotel is an eye-catcher.
Countless restaurants in the lobby but also in the mall on the lower floor. The shops there are all luxury brands and therefore expensive. There is a casino, a small waterway where you can sail in a gondola and of course endless opportunities to invest your money in luxury labels.
The hotel also has its own “MRT” station and you can walk directly from the hotel to the Gardens by the Bay. The hotel is very spacious but there are hardly any stairs, so it is very suitable for people with limited mobility.
Our "check-in" was by far the best I have ever experienced in a hotel. Although we were not VIPs, we were taken from the "normal" check-in queue to a VIP check-in lounge and were served by a wonderfully friendly employee.
Service is impeccable and always very friendly in all 5* hotels in Singapore. The Marina Bay Sands is no exception. Then of course there is the spectacular pool that you can hardly get enough of. And right next to the pool are various "Spago" restaurants and a bar that is more casual.
As the hotel is an attraction in Singapore, there are a lot of people there who want to admire this attraction and use the restaurants even if they are not hotel guests. This leads to very impersonal mass processing and limited times for a stay in the restaurant (max 1 hour in the bar with drinks and food).
The rush of tourists probably just cannot be managed any other way.

The lobby is also incredibly busy and is more reminiscent of a shopping center (which actually starts one floor below) than a hotel lobby. We had booked without breakfast and when I went to the lobby the next day, there was a long line in front of the restaurant, everyone waiting for breakfast. I was glad that I didn't have to wait another hour for my breakfast for the price of €50 per breakfast.
All in all, the Marina Bay Sands is an experience and if you are in Singapore and have the opportunity, I would definitely recommend it for one or two nights. Actually a bit of a "must have" in Singapore but you should be aware of what you are letting yourself in for.
If you prefer a more personal atmosphere, you should stay somewhere else. Pretty much everything in the complex is also very expensive. Except for the "MRT" station.

review_title: Many nice places in Singapore with great service but this is just better
review_text:
Spectacular place to visit. We have stayed at other venues in Singapore that have great venues and service and I struggle to fault them. However Marina Bay Sands just seems to do it even better. Classy rooms, great pool, awesome personal service. I can’t wait to come back (i have actually changed my next holiday to stay here again on my next holiday in 2024).

Consider upgrading to a better room/suite and getting free breakfast, afternoon tea (2pm – 4pm) and canapes/drinks (5pm – 7pm).

Thank you Marina Bay staff for making our stay so enjoyable and enabling our family to celebrate a special milestone at such an enjoyable location. We look forward to returning one day soon

HOTEL WAS UNREAL

Hotel - 5* very much so. Service very good.

Drinks and food also very reasonably priced.

We had a great room. However in tower 3 was construction work. When we checked in they said, “you are aware of construction arent you” like they had pre-warned or emailed yet they had not. None the less just made it awkward to get to the pool - maybe a cocktail or breakfast would have been nice as a gesture.

The disappointing part is a top went missing on my stay. It was white t-shirt but expensive, i emailed twice to see if it was taken with towels by mistake or if it was left in room. No reply to both emails.

review_title: Really great hotel and helpful staff here
review_text:
Just come back from Singapore past few days ago, been stayed in Marina Bay Sands. It is a very nice hotel that I ever stayed at. Every staff here was so polite and helpful.

It is a very big hotel that I always lost to going somewhere. The staff here was so helpful to show me the way to my desired location whenever I am lost

I was stayed in Paisa suite during the stay. The room is so comfortable and luxury!!! The view there is really wonderful.

Been to the Sky Residence that told by my butler. It was a newly renovated Lounge for my room type. Had my breakfast and the evening cocktail there at that few day. I would like to give the compliment to KoKo, Jac, Anthony for the great service during my meal at the Sky Residence. Hopefully I didn't spell your name wrongly. Thank you for taking care me and my family. We are very happy to have you to take care us. Your attentive and care in details make us very comfortable. I personally owned a restaurant in my hometown, and I really hope that my restaurant would have the staff like you to take care of my guest. I feel very proud and lucky for your manager to have such as great team here.

Overall, I love Marina Bay Sans and Singapore. I will definitely come back again with my family.

Thank you Marina Bay Sands for making my family trip that wonderful!!s

review_text:
Lucy and Roselyn. Both are incredibly knowledgeable, professional, and dedicated to their clients' success.

Lucy brings a wealth of experience and an infectious energy to every session. Her ability to tailor workouts to individual needs and goals is outstanding. She’s always encouraging, pushing you to reach new limits while ensuring proper form and technique.

Roselyn, on the other hand, is a powerhouse of motivation and positivity. Her enthusiasm is contagious, and she has a unique talent for making even the toughest workouts enjoyable. Her expertise in various fitness disciplines has helped me diversify my routine and achieve a well-rounded fitness regimen.

Together, Lucy and Roselyn create a welcoming and supportive environment that makes every visit to the gym a pleasure. Their dedication to their clients is evident in every interaction, and their passion for fitness is truly inspiring. I highly recommend both of them to anyone looking to improve their health and fitness.

review_title: Amazing views from roof top pool
review_text:
A very big hotel, we chose a room overlooking the city, probably overlooking the bay may have been more spectacular, but the amount of time spent in the room, it doesn't really matter.
The roof top bar and infinity pool is amazing, high prices for food and drink, but if your looking to book here, you will know it's not the cheapest of hotels.
The pool is only available to hotel guests.
Big queues at the roof top bar.
The evening sunset is unforgettable.
Clean and tidy.
Within easy walking distance of the main city, great views of the F1 track.
We did a pedal bike guided tour, worth every penny as they take you through the back streets.
Would stay again.

review_text:
We were there as a family in April. The hotel is very impressive, but despite the many guests, everything is fairly well organized.
We found it very disappointing that we didn't get the rooms that we had booked through Booking.com and paid significantly more for. We really wanted to be on the 40th floor, but we were booked on the 18th floor because there was no other option.
The rooms themselves were very nice.
Breakfast was an additional 50 euros per person, it was very plentiful, but the price was still excessive.
The pool on the roof was breathtaking, the view was unique!!!
For dinner, there was a buffet in the main restaurant for 130 euros (!!) per person, which the four of us didn't spend. The restaurant situation in the hotel was a bit difficult overall, so we always ate outside in the evenings.
Overall, it was nice to have seen the hotel!!

review_text:
The hotel is a landmark in Singapore. You end up seeing it from everywhere and you can look everywhere from it.
The rooms are “smart” even a little bit too much as you can end up turning involuntarily on the light in the bathroom if you turn yourself too bluntly while in bed.
The sight from the pool is stunning as expected, maybe it must be shared with too many other guests.
The reason why I didn’t give five stars is the reception.
It is completely understaffed. Either the processes are too cumbersome or the staff is very slow but it takes ages for everything. The net result are tens of minutes spent queuing, I experienced it myself, with just two employees at the desk and two people ahead of me.

review_title: Marina Bay Sands definitely worth staying here!
review_text: Marina Bay Sands Wow! Staying on the city view side was just delightful. The view looking over the Marina Bay and the skyline of Singapore was just something to behold day and night. We stayed in a Sands Premier Suite City View, (tower 2 in the middle). The Suites are incredible, so beautifully designed, so much space, attention to detail with class and luxury while remaining comfortable cosy and homely. Staying at Marina Bay Sands also affords you the ability to use that glorious roof top pool while sipping on drinks and eating food. The staff are beautifully friendly and just complement the building and surroundings. The shopping below is fantastic and so are the many many restaurant options. We ate at KOMA and thoroughly enjoyed every flavor presented. We also enjoyed sunset at the Cé La Vi Skybar. Spago and Lavo are also on the rooftop and look amazing so we will be dining there next time. Having the Marina Bay Gardens on the other side of the hotel is super convenient. After visiting the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome you can catch the Supergrove Rhapsody light show and then head back to the city side and watch the Spectra light and water show and when the legs are weary just head upstairs to your room. Marina Bay Sands is definitely a place we hope to come back to.

review_text:
Hi Marina Bay Sands!

Greetings!

First of all, I would like to thank the following people for a warm and accommodating gesture they had given us during our stay:

Senior man at the check in/out counter - I really can't forgive myself for not asking his name or even looked at his name plate. But he was the one who assisted us from the queue (even called my daughter Cinderella). He advised us to proceed to the office to assist us with our check-in.

Jason - didn't get the chance to ask for his surname but he was the one who assisted us on our check-in. He explained clearly all the things that we need to know that would help us to have a comforting stay.

A very warm and kind lady - while I was talking to Jason, this fine lady accommodated us specially my daughter and even gave her a coke and lollipop. It really made my daughter's mood up high. Not because of the sweets though, :) but because of the kindness that this fine lady gave her. Maybe Jason can give her name :)

Hill - when it was our time to get our key cards, she was the one who assisted us. She was warm and all smiles while completing our check-in procedure.

Raymond (GSA - Bell) - upon our checkout, we left our luggage at the storage and Raymond warmly helped us with it.

In general, everyone was very accommodating and warm. From the time we arrived up until we left. It was really a memorable and the happiest vacation me and my daughter had.

Everything inside the room exceeded our expectations: space, bed, complimentary stuff, bathroom, powder, TV... EVERYTHING!

I'd like to end this email with a huge thanks for upgrading our room. It doubled the fun and happiness of my daughter. Many many thanks and hope to stay with you again.

More power!

review_text:
Not much more to say about this place that hasn't been said - but it truly is the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. We got one of the newly renovated rooms in the Sands collection and it was fabulous. The room amenities are so well thought out ( lots of water, coffee pods, Dyson hair dryer, comfy bed) and the view of the Gardens by the Bay off the balcony was beautiful.

The rooftop pool is spectacular and was somehow never crowded. We arrived at the hotel at 8 am from an early flight and were allowed to go straight up to the pool which was great. Our room was ready by 12 and our bags were already in the room when we arrived. The service in general is impeccable and everyone is so nice!

I can't wait to come back and stay again. This is definitely a splurge, but one I will never forget!

review_title: To stay or not to stay?
review_text:
To stay or not to stay? Let’s check it out!

For no doubt, Marina Bay Sand Hotel is not only one of the most famous hotels in the world, but also an iconic landmark of Singapore. The innovative design of the three extraordinary towers combined with the infinity long pool makes the hotel a very impressive architecture — a true futuristic theme which epitomizes Singapore’s modern elegance and sophistication. The magnificent pool which stands on the 57th floor is what the hotel known for. It’s renowned for the stunning and phenomenal views which your excitement has no end in sight. I started my day early morning there to enjoy the urban oasis of tranquility (for check-in guests only).

On the other hand, the prime location and the hotel amenities make Marina Bay Sand Hotel a perfect place for a vibrant city life and the legendary nightlife. The hotel is accessed to the lobby with all luxury shopping brands, a 24-hr casino, an exclusive nightclub and Bayfront MRT station — everything metropolitans call for.

The greenery Gardens by the Bay (my favorite place in Singapore— a sanctuary of the bustling part of the city), which is just right behind the hotel, is my another reason to stick with MBS. The observation deck and the roof bar in the hotel brought me mind-blowing experiences by overlooking some of Singapore’s most captivating views and the stunning light shows. They are just breathtaking and panoramic!

Back to square one, to stay or not to stay at Marina Bay Sand Hotel? The main reason for most visitors to choose this hotel is because of the most incredible swimming pool in the world and which makes everything worth. You can simply make your reservation for just a day and make a balance by having cheap eat or finger food since food in Singapore is mouthwatering! However, if you’re not a swimming person you can totally skip it. You can easily buy a ticket to the observation deck or enjoy drinks in the roof bar without spending a fortune. Still, top-notch ambiance!

I’ll come back again :)

review_title: Amazing and unforgettable! ( May 9 to May 12)
review_text:
Our stay at the Marina Bay Sands was a memorable experience because of the exceptional individuals who went above and beyond to make our time marvellous.
From the moment we arrived at the hotel entrance, we were greeted with warmth, kindness and hospitality by Ms. EUNICE MARASIGAN . Her attention to detail , her genuine passion, enthusiasm, and her professionalism truly exceeded our expectations. We felt welcomed and valued as guests. Our suite was impeccably clean, and every detail was carefully curated to ensure highest comfort and relaxation thanks to the hard work and dedication of Ms. LAI POH.
Throughout our stay, the entire client experience team demonstrated professionalism and efficiency. The team takes great pride in providing excellent service from restaurant recommendations to arranging transportation. We truly felt well taken care of. We were very touched by the gift and the beautiful handwriting thank you card from Ms. EUNICE when we checked-out.
Unlike most hotels, the excellent service didn’t stop once we left the Marina Bay Sands. We appreciated their final touch service transportation to Changi airport. Mr. FRANCIS was booked for driving us. He was extremely polite, wonderful and friendly. When we got there, we met Mr. ROBBY who helped us with luggage as well as registration at the ticketing counter. He did not leave our side until we were all checked in and ready to leave. Now that’s service!
We thank EUNICE, LAI, FRANCIS and ROBBY for making our time in Singapore absolutely unforgettable. Our stay at the Marina Bay Sands was extraordinary and we cannot wait to return.

review_text:
We stayed at MBS for 4 nights to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. We arrived mid morning and received a warm welcome. Our luggage was securely stored and we were given a pass for the pool so we could use it straight away. When our room was ready we were sent an email to let us know. We had a room overlooking the Gardens by the Bay and the Harbour, which was a spectacular view. The hotel sent up a birthday cake to our room, and we had another birthday cake when we ate at Lavo.

Every member of hotel staff greeted us warmly and the housekeeping is the best we've ever encountered. Every day our room was tidied including our cables being stowed away with MBS cable ties!

We had breakfast every morning at the roof top restaurant which was lovely. The food was good and the view outstanding.

The only slight niggle was when we went up late evening to the roof top bars for our last night and found it packed with non residents, meaning we had to queue to get a table. That said, when the staff recognised that we were residents we were seated more quickly than non residents. A minor frustration and to be expected in such a iconic hotel.

All in all a wonderful experience.

review_title: The MBS is worth a trip
review_text:
First of all, many thanks to the VIP service and the concierge service staff, who looked after us wonderfully over the three days.
We were among those who suffered most from the storm in Dubai and had to spend our stay at the MBS WITHOUT our suitcases.

We have already visited many first-class hotels, but even a comparison with the "Fairmont The Palm" is not accurate. The MBS is in a class of its own, especially with the pool.

Although we only got to the pool in the afternoon, we got loungers right by the pool. The "best" is the pool in the evening. Wonderful, lying in the water and looking out over the city.
The service at the pool is a bit slow, but that's OK. We are on vacation and not on the run.

The room - we were on the 18th floor, with a balcony and a view of the "metal forest" - was also amazing.
The room furnishings, especially with the bathroom, which is a bit old but very well maintained, the bar and also the cocktails in the room, are good. But chairs with a small table on the balcony would not be a bad idea.

In the evening we ate at the Italian restaurant, Lavo, with a view over Singapore, woh. The food is very varied and of high quality. The service is also very good.

As we were only at the MBS for three nights, we were unable to visit the other restaurants, we only went to Blossom, which is also recommended.

During the day, the lobby resembles an anthill. It only gets quieter from around 10 p.m. This is also the time when you can visit the "Renko Bar" without stress and noise. Here too, the service is very good. We drank several of the cocktails, not bad.

But there is also one point of criticism concerning the breakfast.
The breakfast is generally extensive and very good, but for guests who don't eat hot food for breakfast, it is a bit one-sided. Three types of cheese/sausage can be described as very straightforward.

What is also missing, and this is part of the package (at least for us) in a hotel of this class, is free sparkling wine/prosecco with breakfast. But that's complaining at a high level.

Since we couldn't really enjoy the holiday because of the missing luggage - we were then in Bali from April 22nd to May 2nd and the luggage didn't arrive until April 27th - we will do the trip again next year.

review_text:
Leaving Malaysia early in the morning, we arrived in Changi airport around 9am, and through the MRT, got to Marina Bay Sands Hotel's check in counter around 11am. Knowing that we were going to arrive early, we sent an email to the hotel a week early to see if there would be any opportunity for an early check-in. In the response, they mentioned the possibility subject to availability.

Upon arriving at the check-in desk at Tower 1, the atmosphere was quite a contrast from the friendly possibility conveyed in the email response. It first took us about 10 minutes of waiting, until someone approached us at the line. Before even looking at our booking, he told us promptly that check-in is not available until 3pm. I mentioned about the email corresspondence, and that is when he reluctantly took my reservation number, then told us to head down to Tower 3 and enquire there, since we would be staying at Tower 3. He also then said there will be a charge for early check-in if it is available.

When we got to Tower 3, the check-in counter had 2 people on staff. One was helping a customer while the other stood there and looked at the other person, walking back and forth. Including us, there were 4 more sets of guests waiting in line. It took 30 minutes, I'm not exaggerating here, until that person that was doing nothing, acknowledge the guests in front of us in the line to go talk to him. Then another staff waved us down to go to the check-out counter to help us. The first couple was still standing at the counter, 30 minutes after, talking to the first staff. While we were waiting, the 4 of us in line started talking about how this extreme wait in line seemed to be a tactic from the hotel to discourage anyone to attempt to have an early check-in. To be honest, all I wanted to do at that point was to drop off my luggages for storage so we could be on our way.

At the Check-out counter, the lady kindly let us know it's because it is around their check out time of 11am, so they are mostly busy with checking the guests out. After some discussions, she advises us that if the room is ready before 3pm for early check-in, they will send us an email. She then proceeds to tell us in great details of
all the fine-dining restaurants the hotel has to offer, including their multiple signature dishes from each restaurant. I then realized why it took so long for the preivouis guests. We wanted to get out of the hotel to go enjoy our day, so we wanted to leave. She then further informed us that there are renovations going on at Tower 3, and we are on the lower level. While the renovation is on the higher levels, we may still hear noises. I then asked if we could be moved to either Tower 1 or 2 to avoid the noises, she responded that our rate would not allow us to be in the nicer, newly renovated rooms of Tower 1 or 2, but she will do her best to give us the best room in the category in Tower 3. Considering the rate of booking this hotel was just shy of $1,000 SGD, I really didn't like hearing this information. Not only did MBS not inform us through email communication prior to our arrival, but the way the lady informed us the situation made us felt like we were some sort of poor guests that should've spend more to avoid noise inconvenience. We left the hotel a bit miffed, and went about our day. We were given temporary keys so we could access the rooftop pool, one of the main highlights of the hotel. We spent about an hour there before we left. It was nice, had a great view of the city, although a bit hot and smog. After the pool we went about our day.

We got the email notification that the room was ready at exactly 2:58pm. Once we checked into our room, my previous frustration with the frontline staff pretty much went away. The room was gorgeously appointed. The view to the Garden By The Bay (GBTB) was beautiful. The room itself was quite large, and the bathroom was
marbled throughout, nothing sort of a luxury hotel, and easily rivaled the Ritz or JW of the Marriott brands. The entire minibar was free as well. Shortly after our check-in, a gentleman arrived to provide some turndown service. He was quite eager to help, and provided us multiple bags of chips and more coffee and drinks.
I visited the pool at night for the second time, and this time I felt the magic of this rooftop infinity pool truly came alive. The lighting of the pool was a beautiful hue of turquoise. By now the city is lit up, the temperature dropped a bit, and people are clubbing in one of the rooftop bar with great music. Generally it had a great vibe. The view at night is nothing short of magical, and the pool wasn't very busy either so I never felt crowded. I ended up staying in the pool until it closed at midnight. This was one of the highlights of my Singapore visit.

The night view of GBTB from our room was even more beautiful than during the day. I took the opportunity and walked around the hotel, and all the way towards GBTB, pass 1am, and took in all its amazing architecture. This hotel is definitely an architectural and engineering masterpiece.

In the morning, the gentleman from the evening turndown service returned to offer more tea. I asked for his name this time. Chang Cheng was very courteous and we really appreciated his attententiveness during our stay.

Although we were offered a discount at their Rise restaurant for breakfast, we decided to go to the casino solely to have a lobster laksa noodle soup from the restaurant within. It was delicious. I also browsed the gift shop situated within the hotel, and bought a book that talked about how the MBS hotel was built.

Throughout our stay, we didn't hear the noise from renovation at all. And upon our check out, the frontline staff graciously offered us a 1-hour late check-out without any hesitation, which we really appreciated. As we called our grab to leave the hotel, the bell service staff checked our Grab details, invited us to wait inside the air-conditioned space, then queued us to head out as our Grab arrived, which we also very much appreciated their care in the service.

Overall I was quite satisfied from this stay, minus the initial impression during the arrival process. I recognize the staff warned us about the renovation noise to temper expectation, but perhaps the delivery could be better, and really don't let your guests wait in line for more than 10 minutes if possible. The hotel's hard
product is world class and top notch, while the soft product could use some improvement.

review_text:
A Phenomenal Stay at Marina Bay Sands

From the moment we arrived at Marina Bay Sands, we were immersed in an atmosphere of sheer luxury and unparalleled service. Our check-in experience was seamless, and we were thrilled to discover that we had been upgraded to a stunning suite on one of the higher floors, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city skyline and Marina Bay.

The suite was nothing short of extraordinary. It featured elegant, modern decor with expansive windows that allowed us to soak in the iconic views at any time of the day. The plush king-sized bed provided the utmost comfort, while the spacious living area and well-appointed bathroom with a deep soaking jacuzzi tub added to the overall opulence of our stay. The attention to detail was evident, from the high-end toiletries to the complimentary Nespresso coffee machine and a well-stocked minibar.

Of course, no visit to Marina Bay Sands would be complete without experiencing the world-renowned Infinity Pool. Floating on the edge of this architectural marvel, with the glittering cityscape stretching out before us, was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience. The pool area was impeccably maintained, and the poolside service was prompt and courteous.

Exploring the integrated resort was a delight, from the high-end shops at The Shoppes to the fascinating ArtScience Museum. The location is perfect for exploring Singapore, with major attractions just a short distance away.

Our stay at Marina Bay Sands was an unforgettable experience, made even more special by the upgrade to a suite and the exceptional service we received throughout. This hotel truly sets the standard for luxury and hospitality, and we can't wait to return for another extraordinary stay.

Marina Bay Sands certainly knows how to elevate the guest experience to extraordinary heights.

review_text:
Came to Singapore for a family trip and joined in for Monday's Hatta yoga with instructor Aida.

It is a cloudy and windy morning, we were worried that it might rain, but Aida comforted us, and we did a full hour solid session at ease.

She gave clear instruction, and over 20 of us were able to follow through with 50% of us are beginners. High recommend to try out her class if you're here in MBS.

review_title: The best service ever in MBS and any hotel around the world
review_text:
My recent stay in the newly renovated Marina Bay Sands suite have to ranked on top of the best stay ever there.

Their top notch service starts 3 days before my actual stay. I received a call from MBS premium service team, to personally ensure that everything I need for my stay is well taken care of before my arrival. And from the moment I dropped off my car at the valet , to my in room check in , everything was perfect . Eunice was processing my check in and after showing me the suite she even sang a celebratory song for me as I was there to attend a Gala dinner at night .
And throughout my stay the MBS premium service team was contactable via WhatsApp to all my needs. Seriously Eunice and the whole team have brought customer Service to a new level which I feel is hard to beat.

This level of service also apply to the house keeping team who made sure I had fresh towels , ice to chill and the best is always greeting us with a friendly smile

I love the little touches the resort have done to improve the deco of the rooms to the Sarini chocolate for the suite guest.

Their level of service even extended to after my check out. With Eunice and the MBS team ensuring my check out was smooth to even my drive home .

review_title: Great pool and view - but it is enough to stay there once - much too expensive
review_text:
We also had a stopover at the Marina Bay Sands. Like so many others, we wanted to spend the night here and experience the pool for ourselves. The staff were all very friendly - you can use the pool even before you get the official room key. Which is what we did. You can leave your suitcases at reception. We were lucky here and found a spot by the pool without any problems. However, there is no shade or parasols here, which bothered us a bit and we didn't want to get sunburnt on the first day of our vacation. Due to the construction site in Tower 3, we were upgraded to a suite and moved to Tower 2. We were very happy about the upgrade, although we are sure that the deluxe room would have been very nice too.
The hotel and pool are of course great and definitely worth a visit if you have never been there before. Personally, however, I think that staying there once is enough. The room prices are excessive and I would not be willing to spend that much money again. Next time we are in Singapore, we will look for another hotel. But to have been there once in your life was worth it. And I think that is ultimately what the hotel and its pricing policy are aiming for. You don't get to use the pool without staying overnight, and many people want to do that once in their life, which is why they can charge these prices. The hotel itself is friendly, but you have to be aware that you are just one guest among many. The hotel is simply far too big for that.  
What really bothered us was the rooftop bar CÉ LA VI. We wanted to have a drink/cocktail there in the evening. When you go there, the receptionist first checks whether you are even allowed in or whether your clothing is appropriate. Then you go in and just stand there lost. No member of staff looked after us. The music was also far too loud, so you couldn't or didn't want to sit inside. There are very few tables outside, some of them are cordoned off, and you don't really know where you are allowed or should go. We then simply left again - but here too the lady at the entrance was not surprised why we left more or less immediately. We had the feeling that we were not wanted here. The tables here are probably reserved for guests who eat in the restaurant beforehand, which not everyone can or wants to afford. We have seen much better rooftop bars in other 5* hotels in other big cities (e.g. Bangkok).

review_title: Not the experience I expected, so I checked out a night earlier
review_text:
I had a free 3-night stay in the deluxe Paiza room in Tower 2 which according to the hotel cost SGD 1,360+ per room night. Although the view from the room, the interior design of the room and room amenities were fantastic, guest service left much to be desired and the everywhere I went was so packed with people wanting bragging rights. Why was guest service not up to par for a high end luxury hotel?
1. The gym was located in a different building and I needed to walk through the shopping mall (The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands) among crowd.
2. I went to the front desk next to the concierge to ask for directions to the gym only to be told by the upstart that he wasn’t the concierge. I scolded him to go ask the concierge who was 10 metres away and on the same counter.
3. When I asked housekeeping to refill the coffee capsules for my Nespresso, she said it wasn’t her department and i had to dial “express service”.
4. I had to wait 10 minutes before I got through “express service”, and the person on the other end couldn’t understand English.
5. The breakfast place was so packed, even the “exclusive” Renku Club ran out of seating, so much so that the wait staff had trouble remembering my fresh juice.
6. The pool on the 57th floor, despite being for guests only, was crowded with guests taking photos for bragging rights.

If you are into crowd and don’t mind the below par guest service, but want bragging rights to stay in Singapore’s iconic hotel, then MBS is for you. If you want top-notch service, privacy away from wannabe fashionistas who strut loudly in their LV, Gucci, … then I will suggest better hotels like Shangri-la, Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons.

review_title: Great location, nice hotel, terrible front desk staff.
review_text:

When we arrived early in the morning we ware promised early check in as soon as the room was vacated (no later then 11:00) and expidited cleaning was done. When we returned at 11:30 we ware again promised a room would be ready soon. This continued for another 3 hours before we finally ware allowed to go to the room "early" at 14:45.

The second reason is the breakfast which will set you back S$ 65 per person. The breakfast at at lobby level was great, but on the pool level is just very basic. Consider it a ripoff at S$ 65 per person.

There's so plenty to do within like casino, mall, high end stores, night hawker restaurants, etc. MBS truly lives up to its iconic status.

review_text:
Fantastic 3 night stay. MBS is a stunning flagship for modern Singapore.
Our suite was exquisite. Huge, spotlessly clean, gorgeous design & great view of the bay, gardens and super trees music and light show. We didn't want to leave!
Particular thanks to Hill, on reception: she was brilliant. Professional, friendly and helpful and she made our stay extra-special. Thank you.
We stayed on 42nd floor, Tower 2, with a separate entrance and lifts to our room. Access to the pool was easy at any time. Our butler(!) reserved a pool cabana - just let them know when you'd like one.
Breakfast at Spago was relaxed and delicious, and we appreciated the afternoon tea and early evening champagne at Renku.
We loved sunrise sound meditation on the rooftop observation deck - an unforgettable experience. If you're there on a Tuesday or Thursday, I highly recommend it. There's no charge for guests but you must book in advance, or can pay to attend if you're staying elsewhere.
Overall, an an amazing stay.
The only things we'd change:
- 1 breakfast we chose to have at Rise. The choice of food was great, but it was more family-oriented, very noisy and busy.
- the tech in our suite was glitchy. Couldn't change volume on TV or turn it off. iPads didn't actually control anything, just showed the settings. I'm sure they would have sorted it if we'd asked, but we were enjoying the hotel too much to bother :)

review_title: A journey inward, through sound, on top of Singapore!
review_text:
Taking part in the Sound Bath Meditation led by Karu, is an experience you should not miss if you are staying at MBS or wanting to slow down in Sunny Singapore.

It starts with a beautiful sunrise on the sky deck of the 56th floor at 7:30am. You are greeted by a warm and friendly team in a breathtaking space where the city and the sea surround you, almost as if you are on a mountain top. As the facilitator warms up with his array of instruments, you find comfort on a mat that is provided for you (with water and a towel). A safe space to be held for everyone, Karu invites you to arrive, as yourself and fully present. It is not only a journey through the sounds which not only allow you to tune in to yourself but the pure joy of immersing in the auditory experience. This is not my first sound bath meditation with Karu, and I love how each time there is something for you to take home. The message today: You are responsible for your thoughts and feelings and it is important to accept and understand them first, before taking hold of them . ‘Do not outsource your happiness’.

This is a great activity to go alone or with your loved ones. No two activity is the same and I encourage you to try it out and see what it may bring you.

Thank you.
🙏🏼 ✨
