review_title: Impressive Service and Facilities! A Once-in-a-Lifetime Experience!
review_text:
My Uncle & I visited Singapore on a 2-day stop-over, on our way to Siem Reap, Cambodia. My Uncle hasn't been to Singapore in over 30 years, so I decided to stay splurge and stay for 2 nights at the most iconic hotel in Singapore. We arrived at the hotel by taxi from Changi airport at around 11.30am. The doormen helped us to take our luggage from the trunk of our taxi the minute our taxi pulled up at the front entrance of Tower 1. We were then escorted to the check-in counter and there wasn't any queue at all that morning! While we were in the process of checking in, a friendly staff member came around to offer all the arriving guests complimentary bottles of drinking water and Chuppa-chupps lollipops(a popular candy in Asia)! I have traveled around the world, never before has any hotel or resort ever offered their new guests Chuppa-chupps candy!!! As per our booking, we were allocated a twin-bed room on a high floor with a view of the Gardens by the Bay. The check-in process was completed in 7-minutes and our room was ready right away! No need to wait until 3pm like some other previous guests had lamented.

The room was magnificent, clean, comfortable and spacious, with all the amenities you would expect from a 5-star hotel, plus breathtaking views from the ENORMOUS balcony! This was the first time that we have seen a sofa set(a 3-seater & 2 single seaters) on a hotel room balcony!!! The room also included complimentary mini bar drinks and snacks, which will be replenished once a day during the housekeeping service. We could also request for additional bottles of drinking water, which we did, because we spent a fair bit of time walking around Singapore and the weather here is hot & humid.

The world-famous infinity edge swimming pool is as spectacular as all the photos on social media has portrayed! We were fortunate that on the day we took a dip in the iconic swimming pool, it wasn't overcrowded and we managed to get some great photos from this facility. Guests will be given 2 pool towels & a bottle of drinking water upon registering to enter the pool. IMPORTANT NOTE: Each guest has to hold 1 individual key card which was issued by the check-in counter upon checking into the hotel, in order to be allowed to enter and use the swimming pool. If you are a couple who are traveling together, both of you have to produce an in-house hotel room key card each, in order to enter the pool. The management has to be very stringent with everyone who wants to enter the swimming pool because in the past, some outsiders have tried various ways to sneak into the iconic swimming pool.

The famous botanical garden called Gardens By the Bay is connected to this hotel. We took a stroll to the Super Tree Grove to take some photos but we didn't enter the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome.

There is also a huge shopping mall with plenty of restaurants and a big food court featuring local delicacies, connected to this impressive hotel. The MRT station called Marina Bay is located in the basement of this hotel, enabling all visitors easy access to the very efficient and well-connected public transport network of Singapore.

The only drawback is: our room rates didn't include any complimentary breakfast despite our room costing USD850 per night! However, we did have dinner at RISE, the buffet restaurant located in the lobby of the ground floor of Tower 1, at our own expense and it was amazing! All-you-can-eat boiled Boston lobsters and Alaskan King Crab legs, plus a huge variety of Asian and Western dishes! The ice creams with local flavours were truly delicious! If you are staying at this hotel, you definitely should try the buffet dinner at RISE. The concierge can help you to make reservations for this restaurant the minute you check-in.

Overall, both of us enjoyed our stay at this hotel even though it is extremely expensive compared to other accommodation options around Singapore. I consider staying here to be a bucket-list, once-in-a-lifetime experience!

review_title: Tiny Beds- couples and big men, beware!
review_text: This hotel is an incredible feat of architecture with an unbelievable view and pool. It is just too giant for our taste. Our biggest complaint was that we got a room with what was supposed to be 2 double beds, but they were literally, slightly wide twins. There was no chance to upgrade as the hotel was apparently full. We were pretty miserable and hot every night. We stayed there for 4 nights. There were definite pluses, but if you don’t sleep, it’s hard to appreciate them. Pluses- excellent staff, amazing pool, stunning views, location. Negatives- tiny beds, food was very expensive, place was huge. But, if you want to go up to see the pool and observation deck, you need to be staying at the hotel, or arrange some kind of card with a dinner reservation I think. It’s one of those things where I’m glad we saw it, but I wish we’d been able to return to the Capitol Kempinski after one night, so that we would have gotten some decent sleep!

review_title: The pool is the star, the rest is average at best
review_text:
The hotelroom was decent, not spectacular.
We were on a very low floor (the 4th) although we had paid top dollar.
So there was no view, but also a very noisy environment in the corridor as hundreds of tourists pass the lobby just below the 4th floor, in one single open space.
(Our previous Singapore hotel oozed peace & quiet in the corridors, causing people to whisper.....not at Marina Bay Sands; it sounded more like a mall).

The balcony is ultra narrow, an obese person could not stand there with closed balcony doors.

2 problems in the room:
- A leaking toilet, which was fixed.
- A complete power cut at 01:00AM, which was also fixed by a technician.
Not nice to have a stranger walking around the room when you are trying to catch some rest in an ultra-expensive hotel.

review_title: Wow wow wow, this is THE place to stay
review_text:
Wow (and a lot of other wows) is how I would describe MBS. From the minute I walked in the door I received amazing service. I was taken in to a special room to complete the checkin process. My room was not ready (to be expected as I was checking it early to make the most of the facilities). Sheila was absolutely lovely and so friendly. The process was seamless and I received a temporary card so I could use the pool. I asked to receive an email when my room was ready (which I did receive in the afternoon). I was also asked if I specially wanted a twin room (which I had booked) and I said that I didn’t mind what room I had.

I headed straight up to the infinity pool and spent the day there. I luckily managed to snag a cabana seat in the adults only area. The pool (the bucket list reason for me wanting to stay at MBS) was amazing. The water was so nice and refreshing. Ordered a couple of cocktails and lunch by the pool. Not cheap, but it was nice to be able to relax.
Once I received an email to say that my room was ready I went back to the front desk to collect my room key. I was very excited to hear that I had been upgraded to a newly renovated king suite. It was the nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The bed was gigantic. Same with the TV. The bathroom was palatial and so well appointed. They even had Jo Malone shampoo, conditioner, body wash and lotion.
When I made my booking I also said that I was celebrating my birthday and I was blown away when I had a knock at the door, with the hotel delivering me a birthday cake.
After dinner in the MBS Mall, I returned to the pool. It was amazing to see Singapore lit up and night. Make sure you spend time in both the pool and the spa, as you can see Gardens by the Bay lit up from the spa.
I had heard mixed reviews about MBS, but I am so happy that I stayed here as I received the most amazing service from start to finish, and whilst it was not cheap, it was truly a memorable stay and bucket list experience for me!

review_text: This hotel is fantastic - completely lived up to our hopes. We had seen the BBC hotel programme and had to try and stay here. We stayed for three nights and had two rooms with balcony overlooking the gardens by the bay - I think a pretty good side as you spend a great deal of time in the pool looking at the city anyway! Our rooms in Tower 3 had not yet been refurbished but to ne honest most hotels would consider them excellent and they were very clean, tidy and did not look aged. The new rooms I think would be even better! The service was exceptional in all areas - I called about our A/C for one room as temp was too cold and could not seem to adjust it - a technician was with us within 5 minutes! The pool area is as great as you would hope and dont worry about loungers etc - there are plenty and they manage access very closely keeping to residents only - the busiest time was Saturday night but even then no real issue with finding space. Breakfast fine (slight queue) and the check in experience was faultless. We asked for an early check in to the rooms and got 12pm. All in all I can't fault it and what an amazing iconic building and location - do stay you wont regret it!

review_text:
Such an iconic building in Singapore, so we thought we should give it a try. A very modern hotels with lots of amenities, very close to Gardens by the Bay, shopping mall, food court. But it was extremely busy and crowded, I think it was a bit too crowded for us. It lacks the personal touch due to the size.

We wanted to see what the hype was about with the roof top infinity pool, the good news is that they are open from 6am to midnight. We went around 10pm to avoid too many people. The view was breathtaking but there were still a lot of people in the in the pool at 10pm, taking selfie and videos. There isn't much space to swim. Basically, it's a plunge pool for photo op. You also have a beautiful view of Gardens by the Bay from the room.

It's a lovely 5* hotel and we did have a lovely stayed, I think it one of those tick the box hotel just to see the hype. I am giving it a 5* for the amenities, service, and the beautiful renovated rooms, but it's not our type of hotels, unfortunately.

review_title: once in a lifetime experience !! The most amazing place I have ever seen
review_text:
From the moment we entered the spa to book a massage and met May I knew we had come to the right place. The place is at the highest level I have seen, May's service was amazing and unusual, she recommended us packages and answered all our questions patiently. She even shared with us that it pays to make a Marina Bay membership card and then get discounts and earn points.
After receiving great service, we arrived the next day for a massage...
Nely and wai lin are the ones who welcomed us, took pictures, pampered us, invested in a unique experience for our honeymoon.... We got everything from a robe to a room with an amazing view.
The experience of the massage, the place, the smells, the music, the atmosphere and the treatment left us speechless!
We have never had so much fun, the spa is worth every shekel and anyone who comes to Singapore (especially couples and especially honeymooners like us) must come to this spa! An amazing place and we know we will be back 😍

review_title: Chinese New Year 2024 year of the Wooden Dragon.
review_text:
Photographs well. Experience is something different. Let’s start with the obvious. This is a massive hotel with a cool rooftop. For a few nights in heart of everything tourists come to see, this is the place. We also must note, we stayed during Chinese lunar new year. Crowds were well above normal we were told. However, we came back a few weeks later. While the crowd was less horrendous, it was still very crowded

It’s very pricey and for what you get, which is a high volume theme park like queues everywhere you go. We felt more like cattle moving through a space. The mass of hotel guests and visitors means, a hotel guest has few to no options for restaurants as they are all always fully booked out. As others have mentioned, sizable minimums apply (the restaurant which did have availability had a $300 minimum per person, and a table was not guaranteed). At this restaurant, the hostess tugged at my sleeve to inform me of minimum, dress code, and other rules.

In other restaurants, they also charge for everything. Tap water - there’s a charge. A wet nap which they provided, there was a charge.

The staff is friendly enough, but not much in the way of service, more like moving people through. We sat at a restaurant for about fifteen minutes waiting for a server to take our order. A manager came by, pointed and tapped at her watch and said we needed to order as they were about to take the last order of the evening. We explained then she might want to have her server come by, or take the order herself.

The good, The bad and the ugly.

What we do like about this hotel is its location and views which can’t be beat. The photo op ready pool deck. Beware, like many similar travel photos, the pictures outshine the actual subject, but the day we spent poolside was worth it. We also had an incredible welcome by the transportation department at Changi the airport. The driver was great, and our check in experience was in room and very personal. The ability to connect with Guest Services at anytime through what’s app texting was great. A feature we like.

The rooms are dated, dirty carpets and paint coming off the walls like old Vegas style at least the room in the tower we got.

Housekeeping was excellent.

The Spago restaurant for breakfast, lunch, drinks and pool service. Was great. Excellent staff and management.

You are also deceptively close to the Gardens by the Bay, Marina Bay, and shopping. Unfortunately, due to how the hotel is designed, and security continually blocking entrances and exits (no reasons given) you often need to leave the hotel, circumnavigate the building (remember it’s huge), then find your way to the MRT tunnel to get to Gardens of the Bay. We once ended up in the shopping mall across the street, and could not find an entrance which let us back into the hotel. Literally one sign pointed in one direction to the hotel, only to walk about 50 meters to see another sign pointing us back in the direction we just came.

For us, this was a one and done. Maybe a person preference - too big, too crowded, too difficult. Who wants that on vacation.

The infinity pool was unbelievable and Mark E. at the poolside provided us with top class service each night we visited. He took the time to get to know us and gave us some excellent recommendations. review_text:
We stayed in the new sands premier suite and wow this room is stunning. These rooms have recently been revamped and they do feel so fresh and modern. The bed is luxuriously comfortable and huge. The television is ginormous. The bathroom has a shower that is big enough for a small family, a Japanese toilet, a full size bath and dual sinks with all the bathroom amenities you could think about needing. The dressing room has more storage than I have ever seen in a hotel room before. The lounge area can be converted into a sofa bed but note this is not particularly big. It was just about big enough for skinny 6 and 8 year olds, two older occupants would have required lots of snuggling. Plenty of water, chocolates and tea and coffee provided. We had two balconies overlooing the gardens and could watch the SuperTree Rhapsody from here. It wasn't wide enough for balcony furniture but I think this will depend on what level you get, lower down the balconies are wider but higher up there is a better view. City view there are no balconies. The room attendant did a thorough job each day and even coiled up or the wires for your electronics for you!

Clearly people stay here to use the pool, and it is stunning. There were plenty of loungers when we were there. It is surprisingly not that warm a pool, particularly when it has been overcast. Drinks by the pool come with the expected pricetag (one alcoholic and one non-alcoholic cocktail was almost 50 SGD (£29). Pool is only accessible to hotel guests; no cabana rental and I'd be surprised if people can "break in". There are staff at the entrance scanning keys and every person has to have a key, even children. So you can't book a room for 2 and 6 people enter the pool. Of course, this exclusivity means it is not too busy for guests. We watched the Spectra show from the pool, which I'd recommend. Pool was open 6am until midnight. Plenty of towels available. We had robes in our room which we wore to the pool.

Breakfasts is plentiful and delicious. So many options to chose from - western, Asian, Japanese.

Obviously the location is prime. We walked to gardens by the bay. Merlion park is around 20-30 mimutes walk taking in the helix bridge and the hawker market at Te La Pau is a similar distance. The airport was around 20 minutes in a taxi (which cost about 26-30 SGD) and the zoo is around 35 minutes drive. There is an MRT under the shopping centre but we did not use it.

We were well looked after by the premium team. Every member of staff we engaged with in the hotel (including club lounge, rise restaurant, pool, sands lifestyle team, front door team) was courteous and charming. In particular the staff at the tower 1 doors who would spontaneously offer tips on Singapore (I think one was called Mr Lo - he proudly was telling me of his son who is a medical student but also gave us several other tips), our wonderful happy limo driver and Arabella who assisted us as the airport. All the staff are an asset to this hotel and if you chose to engage with them, they will ensure you have a wonderful experience in Singapore.

We really hope to be able to come back, but for now, my children are so happy that they got to swim in the "Mariokart pool" - anyone who has raced Singapore Speedway on Mariokart will understand.

review_text:
My wife and I stayed at Marina Bay Sands for a part of our honeymoon and loved it. We cannot recommend this hotel enough. Prior to booking, we looked at a variety of hotels in Singapore and thought we would go with the hype of Marina Bay and it was definitely the best decision.

Where do I start? When we arrived at the hotel, the staff were so attentive. We were told at check-in that we were given a free upgrade to the Butler Suite. It was unbelievable! It wasn't just the room (which was incredible), we received all of the benefits alongside it. For example, afternoon tea with drinks (alcoholic if wanted) and food from 2:30-4:30, then more free food and drink 4:30-6:30pm with the late afternoon canapes. The food consisted of huge prawns, crab, lamb etc. As well as this, we had our reserved cabana every day which came with unlimited soft drinks and one alcoholic drink. This is just a couple of things that the Butler Suite came with and honestly, this gesture from the hotel just made a lovely ending to our honeymoon trip.

We stayed 4 nights in this luxury and didn't want to leave.

We live in Dubai and have experienced a number of amazing hotels but what we received at Marina Bay was on another level.

The breakfast had everything you could think of and catered for a variety of cultures. The 1 minute walk to the Marina Bay gardens which was beautiful was great. The tall iconic infinity pool was stunning and has an adult only section too as the huge pool is split into three sections. The staff from arrival to when we left were phenomenal.

Our butlers - Danial and Vince. I have to say, we were so lucky to have these two look after us on our whole stay at Marina Bay. They made our stay that bit more special that it already was. They both would pick us up from the gym and guide us to our tables and one thing which I will remember is that we asked Danial to recommend some restaurants to visit for dinner in the morning. By lunchtime, Danial had printed out a booklet (that he made by himself) with his top restaurant suggestions. It stated how many if there were few seats left as well as other specific details which I thought was just a lovely touch. Honestly, both Danial and Vince's service was impeccable and Marina Bay are very lucky to have two hardworking and attentive employees such as yourselves.

There is so many other elements that were great about Marina Bay. A hotel and package I would and will recommend to others.

What a hotel!

review_text:
We stayed 2 nights here on our way from the US to Bali and thought it was maybe a bit overpriced.
The staff was amazing and very attentive.
The rooftop pool is incredible and maybe that makes the entire stay worth it, but there was construction going on in the hotel, and we were informed when we checked in that our room was affected by the noise.
The construction started at 9 AM and went to 9 PM. Had we wanted to nap during the day it would have been impossible.
We felt that there should have been some type of a courtesy offered due to the inconvenience of the nearby construction.
Had we known there was going to be construction, we would have stayed elsewhere.
Our stay was April 5-7, 2024

review_title: A unique hotel with a somewhat difficult check-in.
review_text: This hotel is really something special. I would always book two nights so that you can explore and enjoy everything in peace. The rooftop pool is just awesome and I thought it was great that it was open until midnight. That way you can have a good time here even late in the evening. I actually thought the food by the pool was fairly priced. I would also always book a room on a higher floor. The relatively small surcharge is definitely worth it and you have a fantastic view. There are several options for breakfast. I would have breakfast downstairs on the ground floor, where you have the best and largest selection. I have never seen such a large buffet. I just thought the check-in was poorly organized, you have to be prepared to wait 20 minutes or more.

This is a lovely hotel but don’t stay here at present. Treated ourselves to a 2 night stay to complete our long awaited retirement trip in style and it lived up to expectations until lunch time today they are having major work done and in our room it’s like living in the middle of major road works. I feel so let down and disappointed. The sound of drilling is so load you can’t hear the television. We are told they are working 7 days a week and management appear unconcerned about the disruption. It’s not worth spending what is to most of us a lot of money to stay here, find somewhere with less noise.
Having watched the TV programme on this hotel which portrayed how caring the management was I am completely disappointed in their response I understand work has to be done but in woorking hours not at 4 pm on a Saturday afternoon.

review_title: Marina Bay Sands is a bucket-list Luxury Hotel with simply breathtaking views and incredible service.
review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is a bucket-list Luxury Hotel with simply breathtaking views and incredible service.

Having booked four rooms for our Family, I would say that from the very start, everything was a breeze and nothing was ever too much trouble.
The interaction via email and phone during the booking process with the staff was smooth and attentive.

Upon arrival, one of our family members was greeted by Apriel from the 'Premium Services' team and from there on in, the service provided during our stay to the entire family by Apriel (mainly) along with her colleague Shataz both in person and via the WhatsApp service they prodive during the stay, was just exceptional and first class.

The Hotel overall was as hoped :)
It was for our Mother's 70th and the attention to detail they went to and having a Birthday Cake delivered to her room on the day made it that much more special.

The 'Gardens by the Bay View' rooms were very luxurious, very well appointed, beautifully laid out & styled, very comfortable and had stunning views across Gardens By the Bay and beyond.
The 'Family Suite' that we had also organised, I've not seen such a well laid out and designed Family Room which had a double-bunk for the kids, seperate TV & Nintendo Switch along with thoughful gift packs upon arrival. This was all in a self contained part of the suite.

The roof-top infinity pool naturally is the draw card i'd say for nearly everyone. Early morning or late evening swims allowed for lesser crowds and great photo opps with generous open / close times. It spands across nearly the entire roof-top which allows for quiet parts to find and enjoy the moment / view / swim.

You have an abundance of choise for food, drinks, breakfast locations (both on the roof-top pool and ground level) at Spargo or Rice along with multiple bars and resturants throughout.
LAVO which is an Italian themed restaurant on the roof-top also is worth dining at.
The underneath walk-thru connecting you to 'The Shoppes' complex entirely is a nice way to wander through the warmer parts of the day and so easy to move around.

As mentioned at the start, it is a Bucket-list Luxury Hotel
which is on such an extreme scale (size wise) that you can feel quite overwhelmed in trying to take it all in and see everything it has to offer.

The service provided though by Apriel and the team are what made this Hotel such an enjoyable experience and one we won't forget. Thank you also to the initial bookings team and cleaning staff for our rooms who did a terrific job on every day of our stay.

review_text:
This is next level.....Stayed in the suites within tower 2 as we were advised that there was renovation work taking place in tower 3 in the cheaper room deals. Im so glad I paid the extra and the room was simply incredible. Spacious, high tech and well laid out.

All furnishings and fittings are sumptuously high end....definitely book a stay here and enjoy not only the views from your room but also the restaurants and infinity pool located on the 57th floor.

Check in staff were very polite, efficient and very helpful....especially after the long 14hr flight from the UK.

You will have no regrets booking this hotel and one that must be experienced!

review_text:
If you want the best views of Singapore (minus the view of the MBS itself), look no further than here. Upon arrival we were kindly upgraded by KC to a (smoking although we don’t smoke) stunning suite with excellent views of Singapore city centre. The room was, as I say, stunning - Faultless in fact aside from the slightly too wintery bedding for the climate.

Breakfast downstairs (can’t recall the name) was included and was faultless - Upstairs at Spago was a little more lacklustre but still fine.

The reason I call this an experience is all the people who simply visit the MBS to visit it - From the lobby which is like a shopping centre to the rooftop pool which is a bit of a joke with others paying to enter. I get the economics of it, but as a guest of the hotel, it doesn’t actually feel like you’re an exclusive guest.

The service was actually fairly poor - Nothing to write home about and unlike other establishments in the city. Felt like another number rather than a valuable customer.

review_title: Very nice, one night is enough
review_text:
Iconic hotel. Once in your life you have to go there. But, unless you are rich and have no other places to visit, one night is enough to enjoy the remarkable pool and take some Instagrammable photos. For the rest, nice hotel but not nicer than others that cost half the price.
I recommend a view of the gardens

review_title: Mostly Disappointing with Very Few Sparks of Excellence. Inconsistency is Their Only Consistency.
review_text:
Maybe we were spoiled from our prior stays at Amansara and Capella right before checking into MBS. but the hotel left a lot to be desired.

We stayed 3 nights at the Paiza Signature Suite. Originally we had booked the Paiza Premiere Suite, but due to the number of people, we wanted to have at least an additional powder room. So we decided to inquire about an upgrade upon arrival. And things started going south from right then (see CONS section below).

But before I begin with the longer list of things that could have been better, I would just like to mention the highlights of our stay.

>>PROS

1. Ivan Teng, our limo driver was AMAZING!!! He alone deserves 10 stars and is the reason I gave 3 stars. We requested a limo for 4 hours on our second day to tour the city and were lucky enough to be assigned to Ivan. We basically gave the hotel a list of places we wanted to visit, and requested we stop whenever we wanted to get off the limo and walk around. Ivan was not only accommodating, but when we got hungry, he gave us lunch spot recommendations (one of the best meals we had in Singapore!), basically gave us a tour by explaining the buildings, neighborhoods, etc., was super funny and easy to talk to, and when we went to get some fruits at a local market, and had forgotten to get Singapore Dollars (we only had US dollars), he came to the rescue. I cannot say enough praises about Ivan. Although our stay was far from amazing, Ivan alone is enough to make me consider a return to MBS (but then I was told we are not able to request specific limo drivers).

2. Jeffrey Lim, another limo driver. The best department at MBS must be their limo drivers, because most of them were amazing. But Jeffrey Lim, whom we had only a brief 15 minute ride with, was so friendly and courteous. He was like a breath of fresh air. For some reason, about 90% of the staff at MBS did not introduce themselves by name (which most staff members at high end resorts/hotels do). Jeffrey not only introduced himself the moment we got in the car, but was very accommodating.

3. Win, housekeeping team. Now most of everything at MBS was incredibly slow (will mention below). But Win was anything but. He showed up the moment we requested anything, and understood our needs right away. So, thank you.

4. Serena, one of the butlers. We met Serena on the second day of our stay. Our stay in general was quite disappointing as the title mentions, and as will be explained below. However, Serena tried her best to amend things, which I really appreciated. Also, after our check out, we discovered one of our companion's wallet was missing, and we had to go back to the hotel. Serena was more than accommodating in getting a search going at the hotel. We did find it somewhere else later, but Serena and the staff's help was much appreciated.

5. Soo, one of the managers at Paiza Sky Residence. Paiza Sky Residence had opened the day prior to our departure, and they had only just officially opened, so it is more than understandable that things are being worked out, one of those things was missing a decaf option for coffee. Upon merely suggesting that it may be a good option to have for the future, Soo made it happen right away.

6. Xander, one of the butlers gave us a really authentic recommendation for a local fruit stand.

7. As everyone knows, the hotel has inside it, or is connected to many attractions--Gardens by the Bay, Shoppes, Casino, etc--you basically won't even have to leave the complex to make it a vacation.

8. We actually had some very smelly food during one of the stays. We ate it on the balcony, and requested plastic wraps when disposing of it, and since we already had air purifiers in the room (see below), we made good use of them. But we really appreciated the staff for accommodating this.

And the pros pretty much end there.

>>CONS
1. The Check-in process took 90+ minutes. We did request an upgrade, and the hotel had to check the availability. So taking slightly more than usual is definitely understandable. But I mean, OVER 90 minutes...? Upon requesting an upgrade to a room with a bathroom and a powder room, and explaining that we needed two toilets, the staff member who helped us check in just did not understand my request and kept asking me if I needed two bathrooms. I had to explain the request to the staff member about 4 times.

It took about an hour JUST to figure out if there was a room available and to give us a quote on the new price. And upon agreeing to the price, took another 30 minutes of us standing at the check-in desk to secure the room.

2. We were not told about the Paiza Check-in desk. Although we had from the initial reservation, booked a Paiza Suite, we were not told about the Paize Check-in section. Our 90+ minutes would have been very much easier to bear if we had known.

3. While the room was getting ready, we were shown to Renku, the lounge. We ordered Coke, Peppermint Tea, and water. You can imagine how tired and thirsty we might have been after the long stressful check-in process. One of my companions had actually flown in that morning and was just dying to relax. Imagine my frustration when the peppermint tea and even the WATER took 25 minutes to arrive.

After more waiting... for our butler, we just could not stand it anymore and requested we just walk to the room ourselves.

Now the Paiza Signature room comes at OVER 6000 SGD a night. Yes, you read that right. three 0's. So imagine my surprise when...

4. ...we got into the room, we found no welcome fruit or cookies/snacks other than the regular complimentary food. We only received them when we called to ask about it ("hey... so do you guys usually do any welcome fruits?").

And you know how high end hotels usually restock the welcome fruit daily? MBS did not. One day they didn't, the other day they did... inconsistent.

5. ...there was hair in the corner of the bathroom. Despite them telling us that do deep cleaning after every guest. I was just so tired of everything at this point, I didn't really bother to do much about it. But again, at this price point... and having mentioned a deep cleaning after every guest?

6. ...the room smelled of chemical--probably from the deep cleaning. However, at the price point, I would expect them to have figured the smell out. We had to basically run an air purifier and an ionizer during the entire stay.

7. ...there was a strong smell of cigarettes in the hallway. We had requested a non-smoking room. But I guess they do not group the room types together. Walking out of the room was unpleasant every single time. At least the smell didn't seep into the room.

8. ...one of the 2 iPads used to control the room did not work. I did let them know and they offered to fix it. But the timing was off and the engineer came when we were in the room so we just told them we'd use the other iPad. I'm starting to sound like a broken record, but at the price point... I would expect things to be working at tip top shape from the get-go.

9. ...the light along the curtain, when turned off, makes a ticking noise. This kept me up for hours until the light cooled down and stopped making the noise. I figured there was nothing the staff could do about this, so I did not mention this part.

10. ...we had to use no less than 2 bath towels to stop the flood from the shower every time we used it. So I read in an article, that the hotel purposefully left a gap on the bottom of the door to the shower so that the mat wouldn't get caught. Now don't get me wrong, the shower is one of the most gorgeous and beautiful parts of the room. However, I feel like if they were smart, they would have added a threshold the height of a mat rather than just leaving a gap where the water would just flood out. It didn't help that everything was marble and VERY slippery when wet (beautiful to look at, but dangerous nonetheless). Also didn't mention this to the staff because again, it's part of the design of the room.

11. During our stay, we requested that we get a seat at Lavo, their rooftop bar. We specifically requested the al fresco high table right next to the kid's pool. We also mentioned that the reservation would be UNNECESSARY if those specific seats were not available. We were told the butler team was able to secure a reservation at 10pm of the requested day. We actually worked the night's schedule around this reservation. So imagine, again, my disappointment, when we were shown to an indoor table. This was one of a number of miscommunications within the staff it seemed.

12. We ordered the fruit platter the same night as 11 above, and requested that we get as much tropical fruits as possible if available. We waited over 60 minutes, but had not gotten the fruits. When inquired, they just told us that there was some kind of a miscommunication. The butler team did give us an extra plate of fruit as a token of apology.

13. Check out process wasn't the smoothest. So we did mention most of our concerns to one of the managers at the hotel. And the butler team gave us some gifts (candle, musical toy, faux leather tray) and the management was gracious enough to promise us a discount of about 16% (which we had in writing via text). However, upon checkout, when we got the bill, the marked discount was 12%. When inquired, we were told this was the first time the staff member had heard about it. The staff member had to go back, check with her team, and came back with the new bill. Although the discount was MUCH appreciated, it was unfortunate that even the check out process wasn't as smooth as it could have been.

And below are not necessarily cons, but just small things the hotel could maybe work on to become a high(er) end hotel:

1. It would be great if the staff all introduced themselves and also remembered our names correctly. I was referred to by the wrong name about 3 to 4 different times by the butler team.

2. While dining at Paiza Sky Residence, which had opened the previous day, one of the servers actually took one of my companion's napkin away in the middle of the meal. I feel like the staff member was trying to freshen up the napkin when we actually put in an additional order, and the staff member walked away to put in the order. But I've actually never seen this happen anywhere else so it was a bit humorous.

3. As mentioned above we were not told of the Paiza Check In counter. Ever. Not only when checking in, but even during our stay. I just feel like this is something that guests need to be at least informed of when any one of the staff at the hotel realizes a guest is staying at one of the Paiza rooms. There were a few other services and details that could have used mentioning/explaining.

All in all, unfortunately, MBS was sorely disappointing...especially for what we paid. Mostly service and communication, and I'd say even the quality of the breakfast spread left quite a lot to be desired. It would be nice to not need a discount or multiple apologies, and rather have had been delivered the expected experience.

review_title: Beautiful hotel with a grand pool, just a couple of things that don't quite hit the mark.
review_text:
Marina Bay Sands has been one of my dream destinations since 2013, and while our stay was quite luxurious, there were a couple of things which prevent me from rating this place the full 5 stars.

I'll start by listing everything great about the hotel.

I booked a room with a gardens by the bay view. The room itself was a considerable size and the view was incredible as we were on the 27th floor. The bed was large, the room had a charming design (despite us not being in one of the newly renovated ones), the bathroom was well stocked with Roberto Cavalli toiletries, and the minibar was restocked every day with a good selection of soft drinks.

We were also there to celebrate an anniversary and the staff kindly provided us with a small complimentary chocolate cake which tasted incredible. Most of the staff throughout the hotel were also very accommodating and were extremely kind to us.

We opted for the breakfast in our stay and went to the ground floor restaurant every morning. The quality and selection of the food was to a high standard and was some of the best hotel food I've ever eaten.

The rooftop pool was the main reason I booked this hotel and the views were definitely what I had hoped for. They even provide a suncream dispenser free of charge to all guests which was a much needed amenity.

While we were waiting for our room to be ready, and after we checked out, we were provided with a temporary access card which allowed us to use the hotel's facilities such as the pool, which was a nice gesture.

Now onto some minor things which I felt reflected badly on this hotel.

We had just landed in Singapore and wanted to get to our room to rest, however were met with a huge line for check-in, this took away from the luxury feel of a 5 star hotel, but luckily the line moved quickly. The room wasn't ready and the staff told us that they will send us a text when it is, however I advised them that we have new Singaporean SIM cards for our stay, and that they should update the system with it because they had our home numbers saved. They told us that it will be dealt with, however the sms went to our old number, and we had to go to the check in line again a few hours later to see whether our room was ready or not.

We finally got to the room, and one of the staff members entered our room without knocking, this was odd but they did apologise to us and since we had just entered, it wasn't a big deal.

Breakfast queues were also an issue, the staff told us to get there before 8am to "beat the rush" which was already a red flag, but we didn't realise how bad it was until we actually went down. The lines in the mornings were extremely long, and did not reflect the amount of money we were paying. Some days we were waiting for up to 30 minutes to be seated. We even tried to go to the top floor restaurant one day as we were told it would be quieter, but the line was even worse than the one downstairs so we avoided it entirely.

Another thing which took away from the opulent feel of the hotel was the pool itself, while the view was amazing, it was incredibly crowded. Some days we had to walk around for a while to even find a seat so that we could sunbathe or put our stuff down. It would only start to quieten down towards the latter part of the evening.

Lastly, we decided one night to go for a drink at the rooftop bar called Ce La Vie. There was a receptionist who'm we asked directions from, but she was too engrossed on her phone to even notice that we were standing in front of her, she finally looked up and asked "what" not even realising that we were asking her a question. This isn't the kind of service you'd expect at a hotel like this.

To summarise, it is a good hotel with fancy rooms, nowhere else in the world will you find its picturesque views. Although, I find myself wondering whether I would return due to the aforementioned issues. It seems the hotel justifies its price primarily based on the pool view, however in order to be in line with what they advertise themselves to be, there are some improvements that in my opinion should be made to achieve the reputation that the hotel aims to hold.

review_text: Well, well, well, where do I start. From the moment you arrive you’re hurdled into a cattle queue that feels like you’re off to be slaughtered. The desks and queuing system resemble that of a primark store, thankfully our front of house was rather kind and actually gave us a newly renovated room hence the 3 stars. You’re not escorted to your room or the lifts which make it difficult because the signage is impossible, the place is built like a maze. Now for the truly exceptional treat to your luxury stay, the rooftop infinity pool! Oh sorry, I meant the butlins water park. The pool is packed full of screaming kids, you might as well be in a water park. Ironically the kids pool didn’t have a single child in. We tried to go for breakfast on the rooftop restaurant, yet again faced with a queue, then upon being shown to our table we were sat on what could only be described as a school lunch table with a backless chair, all for the price of 100 SGD (for 2), we actually left at this point and decided to dine in a local spot nearby for half the price. In the afternoon we sampled the infinity pool and the views are spectacular I have to say but ruined by the flurry of influencers attempting to con their following into thinking they’re living a lavish lifestyle when in actual fact they’re bathing in children’s urine. At this point I decided to order a lemon ice tea which I got the cheque book out for at a whopping 8 dollars. Wow, it came as a punchy lemon juice. I asked the pool side service to replace it and they asked me how I’d like it made, funny enough I actually had an iced lemon tea for 4 dollars in the breakfast place and it was made to perfect without me even asking them! I thought this was supposed to be a 5 star resort?? Lastly, we were advised that upon our checkout after our 2 night stay that we would be allocated a room to have a shower and clean up before our flight as our flight wasn’t until 11pm, and yes you better believe it, there wasn’t any rooms available. There also isn’t any allocated space to change, sit or freshen up. The whole place is actually cleverly designed to feed tourists in, give them a somehow expensive but fictitious experience and huddle you out ready for the next set of unlucky, unaware victims. Stay for 1 night only, enjoy the views and leave to stay at a more customer service central hotel.

review_text:
The hotel is perfect. Due to its grandeur, I thought that, like Caribbean resorts, the service was mechanized and impersonal. I'm mistaken. The staff are impeccable from start to finish and make you feel really special. Highlight, of course, the swimming pool, which is the highlight of the stay! The entire structure of the place (the 3 towers with the roof shaped like a ship's hull) is EXCEPTIONAL!
Not to mention the location, which is extremely privileged!
Unfortunately, even though it is very expensive, the hotel does not have breakfast included. To do so, the guest must access one of the two restaurants (one on the 57th floor and the other on the ground floor). The amount, which with taxes, amounts to 62 Singapore dollars, is charged per day and per person.

review_title: A unique first class hotel with first class amenities in an amazing location
review_text: MBS is not just a hotel it is a tourist attraction. We stayed there for 5 nights, and the place does not disappoint. Magnificent architecture, GREAT location - you can walk to Gardens by the Bay, a must-see attraction in Singapore - amazing amenities (infinity pool on the 57th floor), first class service and excelente restaurants. You can also ride the escalators down to the basement and find a LARGE number of hawker style food stalls. Relatively expensive but staying there is a unique experience! There was some remodel going on at the time (noise during the day in T3) and as a tourist attraction the lobby is always crowded. One of the breakfast rooms is in 57th floor, right by the roof top pool and breakfast is buffet and/or a la carte. Special mention to Mei Yi that took care of us every single day at breakfast. Thank you Mei Yi! Highly recommended

Amazing hotel. Check-in at 15.00, check-out at 11.00 the next morning.
The pool on the 57th floor is very warm in March, there is a children's area and several Jacuzzis. You can leave your room in a swimsuit and robe, everyone moves between floors like that, no one worries.
We had breakfast on the 1st floor (breakfast until 11.00), a very varied choice.
We also used the room service, ordered alcohol to the room, and everything was delivered promptly.
I definitely recommend staying in Marina Bay for at least one night, it's worth it!

review_title: Very nice hotel but catering not up to par
review_text: Very nice hotel. Gigantic with its 3 towers and astonishing with its architecture. During our stay in Singapore we spent the first 3 nights there. On our arrival we were very well received in a small lounge for check-in. The Marina Bay garden view room was spacious and comfortable. Very high prices all the same for what is offered. Avoid breakfast in the two restaurants that offer it. We tested on the roof at the Spago restaurant. Very expensive at 75 EUR per person and unremarkable. Are not capable of cooking two fried eggs correctly and the orange juice not even squeezed on site as well as the pastries are unworthy of such an establishment. For breakfast, it's better to go to the ground floor to eat an almond croissant with a coffee at Origin + Bloom at the foot of tower 3. Avoid meals in the hotel's restaurants. Are very expensive. We tried dinner at the Rise restaurant on the ground floor. For more than 100 EUR per person any buffet. Only the champagne was very good at $110, as well as the macaroons from the dessert buffet. At the shellfish buffet everything is cold and the shrimp had no taste. Very pleasant rooftop swimming pool offering a magnificent view of the city and its skyscrapers. Open until midnight. Sipping a cocktail after taking a dip while admiring the magnificent view is an undeniable pleasure. At the foot of the hotel there is a magnificent shopping center but there are only luxury boutiques and local restaurants in the basement at a more affordable end (tower 3 side). Last point if you book a room in this hotel ask for a room in a tower where there is no work! Otherwise impossible to take a nap due to the noise of the jackhammer.

review_title: All you can ask for in a hotel
review_text:
The greatest customer service we’ve ever received from any hotel: every staff from housekeeping, concierge, and premium services were amazing and accommodating. This is a great location for everything you would want to see. It is walkable distance to the nearby nature domes. There were two exhibits at the nearby ArtScience museum. It connects to the subway system if you want to explore the city like we did. There’s an indoor casino, and an abundance of stores inside the shopping center. The food court has so much variety and every place we tried was so delicious with great prices, including dessert. You could stay here and eat for the whole week if you wanted to. Daily light shows from the Garden and water show next to the ArtScience museum. Last but not least, the Infinity pool that’s available to guests only. What a view. We will definitely want to come back here when we return to Singapore.
We want to thank Yasmina for a warm welcome and helping us answer any questions we had, and every housekeeping staff that we came across.

review_title: Still a world famous hotel with very attentive staff
review_text: Stayed here for one night during our honeymoon and received a free room upgrade to a deluxe bayview room. Very uncomplicated check-in process and attentive staff. The infinity pool is more like a public swimming pool and totally overcrowded. People (especially influencers) tend to go there to take pictures only and not enjoy the view itself, which is a bit annoying. But that itself is probably part of the concept and why Marina Bay Sands is famous all over the world. Our room was one of the newer rooms and everything was clean and tidy. Room service also worked without any problems. We also had a great view at the light show in the Marina Bay at night. Definitely a must stay when you are in Singapore.

Subject: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING EXPERIENCE

Although I know MBS will still fully book no matter how bad their services are, no matter how many complaints they receive, but I still wanna share the bad experiences during my stay on the 8 mar.

1st Booked 7 rooms, sent email to request check in together for all rooms, reservation team replied ok, but during check in, front desk was unfriendly and said cannot check in together because I was not there and my wife checked in for me. My wife requested high floor and only given 7th floor, and she requested to check in together so that my guests will not get low floor, but front desk person said will try their best, so wife requested the lady to prepare all keys and I only need to retrieve when I reached with guests. The front desk lady said ok but when I reached with guests, front desk took 1 HOUR to give me key cards!!! Really really bad!! All the promises were all lies!! My guests are extremely disappointed all due to MBS EMPTY PROMISE AND inflexibility and rigid staff. Despite me paying so much but not getting the right treatment is just basically horrible.

2nd, we got 7th floor room and there was strong sewage smell, wife told the housekeeping but She gave only diffuser and explained cannot do much because smell from drain. The housekeeping lady was nice but she couldn't do much and Wife needed to go off and front desk packed so couldnt request for room change. Ended up we believed the sewage smell or diffuseR cause my son's nose to be sensitive and did not feel well after spending the night there. Really really bad!!! Spent 10k yet stayed in sewage smell room, emailed MBS ask for compensation and yet MBS person said no compensation. Of course la, they wont bother small business from me, they no need do any nice thing hotel also full, so why would they bother about my complaint right! They called me to say sorry but useless la... The sewage smell was obviously full of bacteria.

3rd, the worst part ---we went for breakfast at Spago and my wife almost ingested a part of chipped handglove is really atrocious and disgusting. I seriously thinking of cirluating the photo around but my wife's stopping me from doing so. I was not there with wife, because I was busy, if I were there, should really post the disgusting glove in porridge. They took the glove rather quickly though. So they waived off the breakfast but I think that was only fair because we didnt even eat anything after that disgusting glove! I WANT TO HIGLIGHT THIS, how can a hotel claiming to be a 5 star hotel making such unacceptable nonsense mistake? Totally atrocious. I paid a lot of money for the smelly room with unhygienic retaurant.

Sent few emails but no reply until say will.pst FB, so called to say sorry, which really useless. Compensation should be given but like i said, their business good so they cant be bothered.

I am extremely angry, disappointed and unhappy with my stay at MBS, share with you all la to make this known or I feel sibei imbalance. 10K le!! Yet worth less than 1k for sure!

review_text:
We splurged to stay here for the final night of our Singapore stopover. We were lucky to get upgraded to a newly renovated room overlooking the park, and it was pure luxury. So this review comes with the caveat that we did not pay full price for the room we got. If we'd stayed in the lower room type we actually booked (which was still incredibly expensive), our review would only be 4 stars because it wouldn't have been as special.

Moving on... The lobby was busy but there were helpful staff to direct us, and check-in was relatively easy. We tried using the app but it wouldn't sync our booking to our room (possibly because of the upgrade?).

The rooftop pool is as amazing as everyone says. Unfortunately we had bad weather and didn't get to fully enjoy it, but can't blame the hotel for that.

If you get a room overlooking the park, you can enjoy the Supertree light show from the comfort of your room! Great for us since it was raining during the show, so we didn't have to risk getting soaked.

They kindly gave us access to a shower room after check-out so we could freshen up before our evening flight home. It was basically a small hotel room (no bed) with the bathroom stocked with amenities, plus water bottles and snacks. Amazing!

It's important to note that all the shops and restaurants in the adjoining mall have significantly inflated prices. Even Starbucks and Din Tai Fung (dumpling restaurant) were way more expensive than at other Singapore locations. On that note, we highly recommend Origin + Bloom cafe in the lobby for a coffee and pastry.

Would we stay here again? We wouldn't come back until all rooms have been renovated, to ensure it's the special experience you'd expect for the price you pay.

review_text: I usually find hyped up hotels disappointing but not Marina bay sands hotel. It was amazing and lived up to the reviews. The infinity pool was superb as were the helpful staff, finding me a pod to sit in as I had to stay out of the sun. The room was beautifully appointed with nice little added touches, bookmarks and cable ties left by room staff and a soft drink complimentary bar with crisps. The two breakfasts restaurants were excellent with fabulous choice. Perhaps the most pleasing aspect was that we had booked 3 nights but had to check out a night early as we had made a mistake with our flight and Judith, the manager agreed to just charge us for 2 nights. This was very much appreciated. Thank you to all the wonderful staff at marina bay sands.

review_title: One night only if you must!
review_text:
We will certainly never stay here again. First impressions stick and MBS made a lasting impact with our arrival. 5 rows deep of taxi chaos out the front of tower 1 was a prelude. Our luggage was whisked away (more about this later) and we entered without a greeting. Looking up in the lobby is a marvel but at ground level totally inhuman. Packed, nowhere to sit and oddly walled off from the long spectacular space with high wall of a food outlet.

Shockingly our next experience was a three row deep snaking queue to check in. Our wait was 50mins, standing. Trying to download and use their app to check in was fruitless as, on our phones, registration for an account didn’t work. Finally we got to our room (tower 3 a decent walk away) eager to head to the Gardens by the Bay nearby but another wait began for our luggage. We called about its whereabouts twice during our wait of 45mins and no one could tell us where is was or when we could expect it.

Dinner: I mistakenly assumed that staying here we would be able to get a table for a meal. Every table was booked so no such luck. Fortunately as the crowded but incredible rooftop pool was a reason we wanted to stay, we could get a basic meal in our swimmers.
Better communication before arriving could have helped on this point.

Our experience of the MBS was epically impersonal, way finding was non existent (prepare to get lost and confused!) and an antiquated lack of sustainability practices topped off the experience.
title_translated: One night only if you must!
review_translated:
We will certainly never stay here again. First impressions stick and MBS made a lasting impact with our arrival. 5 rows deep of taxi chaos out the front of tower 1 was a prelude. Our luggage was whisked away (more about this later) and we entered without a greeting. Looking up in the lobby is a marvel but at ground level totally inhuman. Packed, nowhere to sit and oddly walled off from the long spectacular space with high wall of a food outlet.

Shockingly our next experience was a three row deep snaking queue to check in. Our wait was 50mins, standing. Trying to download and use their app to check in was fruitless as, on our phones, registration for an account didn’t work. Finally we got to our room (tower 3 a decent walk away) eager to head to the Gardens by the Bay nearby but another wait began for our luggage. We called about its whereabouts twice during our wait of 45mins and no one could tell us where is was or when we could expect it.

Dinner: I mistakenly assumed that staying here we would be able to get a table for a meal. Every table was booked so no such luck. Fortunately as the crowded but incredible rooftop pool was a reason we wanted to stay, we could get a basic meal in our swimmers.
Better communication before arriving could have helped on this point.

Our experience of the MBS was epically impersonal, way finding was non existent (prepare to get lost and confused!) and an antiquated lack of sustainability practices topped off the experience.

review_title: So bad.... only stay if you deserve punishment
review_text:
If I ever have burning desire to:

• Pay for a highfloor harbour-view and receive a lower floor garden-view
• Listen to jackhammers and other refurbishment/construction noises ongoing from 09:00 onwards during my entire stay
• stay in an overrated room which has damages, shoddy completed repairs, and no toilet roll (I have pictures)
• stay in a dirty room with dust everywhere and rust stains on the lamps (I have pictures)
• miss out on Internet, TV and Telephone for more than half a day (unannounced and no updates)
• reregister my keycard again because the elevator no longer accepts my original keycard
• have breakfast at 6:30 because that’s what the advice is and when it is the only time it is not crazy busy
• stand in line for every possible restaurant or feature
• especially just ridiculously overpay for the experience

Only then will I return to the MBS.

I believe that hotel restaurants should cater for guests first and then for 3rd parties. To not be able to reserve a table for the next 2 days as a hotel resident is just absurd.

I was promised unparalleled luxury matched by exceptional service and I got neither – I have travelled extensively in the world including to sunny Nigeria and other parts of Africa and this hotel for me was the biggest disappointment of all - I would rate the premises akin to a single star rating at very best.

I did not enjoy every minute; in fact I did not even enjoy one single minute of my stay and ohh by the way…. it cost me a small fortune.

This review was sent to MBS for comment but they decided to stay silent.

review_title: Perfection! Superb service and a million dollar location and view of Singapore
review_text:
We started our vacation in Singapore by staying here for 5 nights, and enjoyed every minute of it. Yes, it is a large resort and very busy, but that is part of the glamour and excitement. Our room was in Tower 3 on the 33rd floor overlooking the gardens. We found the room to be very clean, spacious with modern amenities. A ginormous flat screen TV. The resort provided bottled water plus complimentary beverages in the small refrigerator. Nice robes and slippers for our comfort and use during our stay. Also gave us a big platter of fresh fruits upon arrival and mid stay.

The view overlooking the garden was a bonus, as we enjoyed the light shows in the evening right from our room. Facing the gardens also gave us sweeping view to the sea. Part of our reasons for staying here is to use the stunning rooftop infinity pools on the 57th floor. Nothing short of perfection. The pool staff is elite, the food and beverages were superb, and we used the pool during the day as well as at sunset to maximize the amazing views. To see the bright moon light up the sky filled with beautiful city lights was so special.

The location of the resort is also great. Just a walkway to the Gardens By the Bay, as well as to endless restaurants and shops. Even a food court/center, filled with many great eats (in AC!). The MRT is also located nearby. We also used the gym a few times, although with quite a walk from our room. We walked the pedestrian Helix bridge to reach the Singapore Flyer, as well did the short way over to Lau Pa Sat hawker food center. We felt the city is very walkable, even went to the Merilion statue via the route around the waterfront.

As for the resort staff, it is clear that they have extensive service training. Special thanks to the front desk staff for smooth check-in and check-out process. We especially enjoyed talking to Din and Adele at the Concierge desk, they were delightful and so helpful with our questions.

With the highest rating of 5 stars, we really wanted to give the Marina Bay Sands 10! Bravo!

review_text: The best hotel of our lives. Swimming pool is a spectacle. Fantastic room and magnificent view. Located in front of Marina Bay. It has an attached shopping mall. Breakfast is expensive but there are very good options in the hotel lobby. Fantastic service.
review_translated: The best hotel of our lives. Swimming pool is a spectacle. Fantastic room and magnificent view. Located in front of Marina Bay. It has an attached shopping mall. Breakfast is expensive but there are very good options in the hotel lobby. Fantastic service.

review_text: I was in Singapore and knew I had to stay here, I booked a room for us on a Sunday night and was so happy I made the effort to do so, I was in 2 minds whether to book, its an American Vegas style hotel in Asia but it was so worth it you get the fantastic service and hospitality of Singapore but the fun aspect of an American Vegas style hotel. Our check in was seamless Patrick was lovely Peach very helpful and May upgraded us, so we were super happy. Our room was on the 39 floor overlooking the gardens, so nice for the show in the evening (although I would recommend actually being in the gardens for it to get a better experience,if your not there for the show do have a walk around its lovely, the animal sculptures of endangered species is very moving) You walk into your room and the curtains open, a nice touch with a great view. The decor was lovely with some very nice design touches, beds were amazing, bathroom super luxe and toiletries were Jo Malone also being upgraded you get a much nicer robe which becomes obvious when you are at the pool! The pool... so worth it! there is an adults section which is great however being a Sunday there wasn't too many children about, the beds get busy but there is a constant turn around 1 thing we didn't realise there is sun screen provided near the area you do the pool check in. As only hotel guests can use the roof top infinity pool it makes you feel special! the pool is 1 of the reasons to stay at the hotel and it really was a fantastic view and yes I got lots of pictures of me at the edge like in the advert for the hotel! We ate at the pool so food was from Spago a Californian restaurant with a very nice menu, while I was staying elsewhere I came to MBS and ate at CUT by Wolfgang Puck which I highly recommend the chicken is enormous it arrived as a full bird 1.1 kg they took it away and carved it for me. While staying at MBS we ate at the new French restaurant DB Bistro which we didn't enjoy so much maybe it was not to our taste? We visited the casino, free to tourists but $150 for locals! you must have your passport and Singapore landing card to enter. No quite as much fun as a Vegas casino the games are a little different and the gambling seemed more intense, but we had to give it a go and it was a nice finish to our evening. I read a lot about this hotel and on my visit to eat there before my stay there I was a little shocked how busy it was and felt it was almost a little too touristy, but that aside the architecture is totally amazing, the staff superb, if you love to shop the mall is great every shop you could possible wish for if you like high end, the evening light and water shows are a nice touch and I must say my whole experience was 10/10 we loved it, would I return now that I have done the pool and casino YES I would.

review_text:
This hotel is really massive. However the rooms are very nice, we had a great view over the gardens by the bay with the super trees. Our room was spacious and provided a great place to relax.
Breakfast can get a bit busy, so to avoid queueing up I would suggest arriving for breakfast at around 8:0am. There is plenty of selection at breakfast and the staf are efficient.
The hotel is connected to the MRT, Shopping mall and casino so its very easy to get around. The super tree grove, Floral fantasy, Cloud forest and flower dome are all within walking diatance.
The infinity pool at the rooftop is great for one of those photo opportunities, as is the observation deck. Both are free for guests. The pool is for guests only, whilst the observation deck is chargeable for non guests.
This hotel does not come cheap! But its location is perfect.
Staff are helpful. Our thanks to Balan and Ray for their help.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is hands down my favorite hotel in all of Singapore. I stayed in the newly renovated rooms in tower 2 and had a beautiful view of the Gardens by the Bay. The mall attached is breathtaking and the hotel offers so many restaurants you can’t go wrong with any of them. Lavo was amazing for a rooftop experience (highly recommend the meatball!) , Wakudu had the freshest fish if you’re looking for high end Japanese cuisine, and you can’t go wrong with room service.

Every part of the hotel is a work of art. Almost every part is a picturesque moment! The rooftop pool is breathtaking and is the best view in Singapore. Also, Marquee is the coolest club you’ll ever go to. A Ferris wheel and slide attached that you can’t miss.

Most of all, the employees and premium services were extremely catering, helpful and fast. Shoutout to Eunice from Premium Guest Services for going above and beyond each day of my stay. She gave me all the best recommendations and she was swift with all my responses. She also assisted me with all my rides to and from the hotel with ease.

This hotel has it all! If you’re just visiting, I highly recommend staying for at least 2 nights to explore all MBS has to offer!

-T

review_text: we went last summer. it is architecturally very impressive, but the hotel is so big that the service does not feel very personal. we arrived early and asked if we could check in early but this did not seem possible. the hotel lobby has no comfortable seating areas so we asked if we could find somewhere comfortable to sit, but this did not seem possible. as the hotel is such a landmark, the lobby is full of tourists and visitors, so as a resident you never feel the quality of the service. the restaurants, shopping mall, infinity poor and viewing deck are all amazing but you just do not get the personalised service a 5 star hotel should give you.

review_text:
One of the best hotels in the World that I have stayed in and I have stayed in many luxury hotels due to my job. From the minute we arrived we were met at the door and escorted to our rooms where check in took place which was seamless and so efficient. The rooms are out of this world and spotless and the attention to detail was fantastic. Breakfast is superb! The staff are incredible from the pool staff to the restaurants staff but the best service we had was we had booked a departure transfer to the airport which was late arriving due to a mix up but was handled very well. When we arrived at the airport there were 2 staff members from the hotel waiting for us to assist us to the tax refund and check in- I have never had such service in my 45 years in the industry all I can say if you can stay at this hotel it is a once in a lifetime experience.

Thank you for making our trip memorable!

review_text:
Our stay at Marina Bay Sands was enchanting from start to finish.
This flagship hotel of Singapore fully deserves it.
Everything is an exceptional experience: the legendary swimming pool, the breakfasts, the comfort of the rooms, the view of the city, the spirit of service, the team in general.
We would nevertheless like to thank Andy (Host team) in particular who spoiled us by offering us an exceptional upgrade!
His kindness and kindness towards us allowed us to have a wonderful time. May he be warmly thanked.
Our stay was even more memorable thanks to him!
Two other people deserve to be thanked in the same way for their sense of service, their friendliness and always demonstrated professionalism: Samantha (Host team) and Amil (Spago).
Thank you to all three for brightening up our stay!

review_text:
We booked two nights at the Marina Sands to end our trip to Singapore.
What can possibly be said about staying at such an iconic hotel.
The experience alone is amazing and with so much to take in can be a bit overwhelming.
( Definitely in a good way ).
The roof terrace and pool are just amazing and the views are incredible.
We had a fabulous room overlooking the gardens and watched the light show from our balcony.
I was taken aback by the structure of this hotel but what impressed me more was the way the staff seemed to run everything so efficiently,from the breakfast on the ground floor which was fine with plenty of choice available,to the bar service by the pool.
The check in was straightforward and when we checked out,we were given our pool access cards back which enabled us to enjoy the rest of the day relaxing before our 12:30 am flight home.
I must mention the lovely Ivy and Sara whose patience with me at the check in and checkout desks was impeccable.
Also Shasi who brought our
luggage and told me all about the hotel.
A real nice guy.
All in all an experience that will be impossible to forget.

Iain and Carol Patterson.
Newcastle Upon Tyne.

review_title: The Marina Bay Sands hotel is perfection at its finest
review_text:
We originally booked two king suites for our family of six. We were surprisingly up graded, free of charge to the presidential suite!

The staff were absolutely amazing, the bedrooms were stunning, both with breath taking taking views, the suite was immaculately clean and modern.

The complimentary breakfast, canopies and drinks, butler and limousine were the icing on the cake to our 2.5 week holiday of south East Asia as well as the amazing ininfinity pool.

Thank you Katherine and to all the staff at Marina Bay Sands who go above and beyond to cater to your needs. The customer service is absolutely amazing. We will forever have fond memories of the immaculate Marina Bay Sands hotel and beautiful Singapore that we will treasure dearly forever.

review_text:
The hotel is getting old. The elevator stopped where it wanted to, but not where you wanted to go. There was construction on our floor. 44th floor, Tower 3. Jackhammers all day. Unbearable. We weren't told about it. Discount? Nonsense. They just smiled and ignored it. Resting during the day was impossible. The room was stylish, but totally impractical. Only a fixed shower head. You can't clean your bottom or the soles of your feet. Taps with separate hot and cold water. You never find the right mix. The tap is much too close to the sink. Washing your hands is impossible. The toilet is nice and open. You can see in from every side (who likes that?) and it stinks so much in the whole room. There is just one chair in the room that you can sit on. The seating area is also stylish, but just as impractical to sit on. And you can't reach the "salon table" unless you're over 2 meters tall. I'm "only" 167 cm tall. So no chance.
The only thing that's great is the view from the 44th floor. Everything else didn't convince me. It's all very overpriced and not worth the price.
The breakfast buffet is huge but mostly designed for Asians. For Europeans, it's not worth the exorbitant price. Here you get a 3-course meal.
There is no hotel lobby for guests. As a hotel guest, you can't charge your electronic device anywhere (except in your own room). It happened to me when I had to leave the room but had paid until the end of the day. Very bad service for the year 2024, when you can only do everything electronically.
Conclusion: Once and never again.
By the way: You can access the top floor (57th floor) where the swimming pool is if you rent such an expensive room, but I personally never found a place by the swimming pool, let alone at the bar, because everything was occupied all day. Nobody mentions that. In no brochure, on no website. Another weak point for a lot of money.

review_text:
When I checked in, I told them that I only speak Japanese, and they called for a Japanese staff member, who was very helpful. He consulted me not only about Marina Bay Sands but also about Singapore and various other matters. Our staff are humble, kind, bright, and have wonderful humanity. I felt like I had made the most reliable friend in Singapore. We also appreciate the information staff who entertained us with simple English during the waiting time. I am honored to have met a gentleman with a wonderful smile. There were so many other great staff members that I would love to be friends with. I would like to visit them again.

チェックイン時、日本語しか話せない旨を伝えると日本人スタッフを呼んでくれてとても助かりました。
彼はマリーナベイサンズのことだけでなくシンガポールのことや様々な相談にも乗ってくれて嬉しかったです。謙虚で優しくて明るくて素晴らしい人間性を持っているスタッフです。シンガポールで一番信用できる友人ができた気分でした。
待ち時間に簡単な英語で私たちを楽しませてくれた案内スタッフにも感謝しています。笑顔が素敵な紳士に出会えて光栄です。
他にも友人になりたいと思える最高のスタッフが何人もいました。また彼らに会いに行きたいと思います。

review_text: Wow. Firstly, as a quick “down side”, be warned that there are a lot of people in the foyer. But even though there are lots of people, the customer service team have a knack for seeking you out amongst the crowd to see if you need anything. How they manage to know who is who is beyond me. Room is impressive. But the real highlight is of course the infinity pool and deck. It’s magnificent and the service that comes with it is what makes it so iconic. Thank you to Christy who treated my 5 year old son like he was royalty. Despite the price, the deck is considerably child friendly (I thought it wouldn’t be). There is a separate adults only section to prevent annoying relaxed adults. Food and beverage was fantastic but be prepared, it’s pricey I found the cafe downstairs (Bloom) decently priced for a coffee and croissant. All in all, an iconic experience worth doing once in your lifetime.

review_title: Great service but too many people for us
review_text: We stayed here for 4 nights in Tower 3 on the 20th floor. It is a bucket list place to see and stay and like others have commented the staff is great!! So friendly and will go out of their way to assist. Ziu from the bell desk gets a 10 plus. He assisted us with our luggage when we were checking. The pool is great but the first time we went in the afternoon there were no lounge chairs anywhere near the pool. Reminds me of the situation on a cruise ship. Sky deck is on floor 56. They do not make it convenient at all for people staying at the hotel to get back to their rooms. Had to go to first floor and go back inside to get to our tower elevator. Then there is the crowds. If you are not a fan of lots of people, might want to re-think staying here. Restaurant prices are quite high and very little selection for a reasonably priced breakfast. The Origin+Bloom was close to affordable for a coffee and croissant. We had a great view to see the light show at 745pm at Gardens by the Bay.

review_title: Consistently great experience at The Banyan Tree Spa, MBS
review_text:
I have always enjoyed my monthly trips to Banyan Tree Spa at Marina Bay Sands.

What makes my trips worthwhile is the Master Therapist Experience which is one of their signature treatment. Sand was the assigned therapist for my last two sessions and her techniques are therapeutic. Without fail she would unknot the tight spots troubling my shoulders and lower back and I would leave the spa feeling reinvigorated.
